!6h! The separated animals must be same as those in target Pasture. And the number must be less than the remain capacity of target Pasture.

!ca! Same function as a <color=#df840e>Marketplace</color> but with greater occupiable space, <color=#df840e>more workers</color> and <color=#df840e>more storage</color>.
!cc! Has the same function as <color=#df840e>Warehouse</color> but <color=#df840e>more storage</color>.
!cd! Can <color=#df840e>store materials</color>. Smaller size comes with <color=#df840e>smaller storage capacity</color>.

!cf! Can <color=#df840e>store items</color>. Workers inside will transport stored items to <color=#df840e>Warehouses outside of the range</color>.
!cg! Same function as <color=#df840e>Storage Yard</color>, but with <color=#df840e>greater storage capacity</color>.
!ch! Same function as <color=#df840e>Warehouse</color>, but citizens can <color=#df840e>walk across the structure</color>. Unremovable.

!cj! Workers will take <color=#df840e>the selected materials</color> to nearby production buildings from storage structures. <color=#df840e>Functionally powerful</color>.
!ck! Same function as <color=#df840e>Warehouse</color>, but with <color=#df840e>greatest storage capacity</color>.

!cm! Same function and scope as <color=#df840e>Marketplace</color>. <color=#df840e>Smaller structure size</color> comes with less workers and less storage capacity.

!cp! ·Can produce special medicine, Bandage and other medical supplies. ·Unlocked in 'Technology - Livability - Pharmacy'.
!cq! Can <color=#df840e>grow crops</color> here. Farmers sow in spring and harvest in autumn.
!cr! Can <color=#df840e>plant fruit trees</color> here. Trees will yield fruit after several years of growth.
!cs! Can <color=#df840e>raise livestock</color>. Herdsman will slaughter the mature animals for food.

!ct! Can <color=#df840e>catch fish</color>. <color=#df840e>The larger the water area within range, the higher the yield</color>. Having multiple fishing docks in close proximity will decrease the yield.

!cu! Hunters hunt <color=#df840e>wild animals</color> nearby to obtain <color=#df840e>meat</color>, <color=#df840e>Leather</color> and <color=#df840e>Fat</color>. There are possibilities of <color=#df840e>obtaining animals</color> to raise on Pasture.
!cv! Gatherers gather <color=#df840e>full-grown trees</color> and <color=#df840e>wild plants</color> within its range. There are possibilities of obtaining <color=#df840e>plant seeds</color>.
!cx! Farmers will grow <color=#df840e>Herbs</color> and <color=#df840e>special crops</color> in the field area.

!cy! Can produce <color=#df840e>Stone</color> but with limited reserves. When there are floods, it will store flood runoff to reduce the duration of flooding which leads to the <color=#df840e>inability to function</color>. <color=#df840e>Unremovable</color> after being built.
!cz! Salt-makers extract <color=#df840e>Salt</color> from Water, which is one of the materials of Salted Meat, Bacon, and Vegetable Can.
!d0! Reed farmers plant <color=#df840e>Reeds</color> inside, which is the raw materials of Paper and Ropes.
!d1! · Produce Soaps and Salt Soaps. · Soaps and Salt Soaps increase citizens' Health. · Unlock in 'Town Technology - Livability - Bathhouse'.
!d2! Same function as <color=#df840e>Field</color>. Can use fertilizer to <color=#df840e>boost yield</color>.
!d3! Same function as <color=#df840e>Orchard</color>. Can use Fertilizer to <color=#df840e>boost yield</color>.

!d4! Can produce <color=#df840e>Fish</color>. <color=#df840e>The larger the water area, the higher the output</color>. Output will further increase if there is a Fishing Point, but the output will decrease when there is overlapping area of multiple fishing docks.
!d5! Can plant trees and produce a large amount of <color=#df840e>Timber</color>. Farmers will only cut down the mature trees.
!d6! Can plant trees and produce a large amount of <color=#df840e>Timber</color>. Farmers will only cut down the mature trees. Can use fertilizer to <color=#df840e>boost yield</color>.
!d7! An artificial Fishpond with a <color=#df840e>higher and more stable output</color>. Can be <color=#df840e>built on land</color>.
!d8! Same function as <color=#df840e>Pasture</color>. Can use Fodder to <color=#df840e>accelerate animals' maturity and increase output</color>.
!d9! Same function as <color=#df840e>Field</color> but <color=#df840e>the size is fixed</color>.
!da! Same function as the <color=#df840e>Farm</color> but <color=#df840e>the size is fixed</color>.
!db! Same function as the <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> but <color=#df840e>the size is fixed</color>.
!dc! Same function as the <color=#df840e>Eco-Pasture</color> but <color=#df840e>the size is fixed</color>.
!dd! Can raise <color=#df840e>Horses</color> and <color=#df840e>Donkeys</color> here. And <color=#df840e>the yield increases by 50%</color> if used to raise other animals.
!de! Can grow crops with <color=#df840e>extra 40% yield</color>. Can be fertilized to reach higher output.
!df! Same function as <color=#df840e>Mine</color> but with <color=#df840e>greater reserves</color> and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Can be upgraded into a Deep Mine.

!dg! Can accommodate <color=#df840e>two families, up to 8 people</color> with long residual fuel endurance and allows large stockpiles. Must be placed <color=#df840e>in the range of marketplaces</color>. Can relieve <color=#df840e>25%</color> residents' stress rate.

!dh! Same function as <color=#df840e>Mine</color> but with <color=#df840e>greater reserves</color> and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Can be <color=#df840e>built on flat area</color>. Can be upgraded to Open Deep Mine.
!di! Can produce <color=#df840e>Blubber</color>, <color=#df840e>Seal Fur</color> or <color=#df840e>Lobsters</color> by using Fishing Net.

!dj! Same function as the <color=#df840e>Quarry</color> but with <color=#df840e>higher reserves</color> <color=#df840e>and efficiency</color>. When there are floods, it will store flood runoff to reduce the duration of flooding which leads to the <color=#df840e>inability to function</color>.
!dk! A house for a <color=#df840e>4-person family</color>. Must be placed <color=#df840e>in the range of marketplaces</color>. Can relieve <color=#df840e>5%</color> residents' stress rate.
!dl! Same function as <color=#df840e>Quarry</color>. Must be <color=#df840e>built on a hillside</color>.

!dm! Same function as <color=#df840e>Quarry</color> but with <color=#df840e>greater reserves</color> and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Must be <color=#df840e>built on a hillside</color>. Can be upgraded to Deep Mountain Quarry.
!dn! Can produce <color=#df840e>Water</color>. Can <color=#df840e>put out fires</color> using the water here.
!do! Can produce <color=#df840e>a large amount of Water</color>.
!dp! Can produce a <color=#df840e> Drinking Water</color>. Water produced can be used for <color=#df840e>fire extinguishing</color> .
!dq! The Chopping House can process <color=#df840e>Timber</color> or <color=#df840e>Dried Dung</color> into <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuels</color> which can be used to heat houses.

!dr! Foresters will <color=#df840e>plant saplings</color> and periodically <color=#df840e>chop down mature trees</color> within structure range. <color=#df840e>More wood</color> can be gathered when the forester chop down trees.
!ds! Herbalists will <color=#df840e>search nearby land for Herbs</color> which generally <color=#df840e>grow near mature trees</color>.
!dt! Can produce <color=#df840e>Tools</color> made from <color=#df840e>Stone, Timber</color> or <color=#df840e>Iron Ore</color>. Blacksmiths are at risk of Tracheitis.

!du! Can process <color=#df840e>Leather</color>, <color=#df840e>Wool</color>, <color=#df840e>Alpaca Wool</color>, <color=#df840e>Linen</color> or <color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color> into <color=#df840e>clothes</color>. Can be upgraded into Advanced Tailor and Clothing Factory.
!dv! Can produce <color=#df840e>Stone</color> but with limited total output. <color=#df840e>Unremovable</color> after being built.
!dw! Can <color=#df840e>produce Iron and Coal</color> with limited total output. <color=#df840e>Unremovable</color> after built. Can be upgraded to a Senior Mine and a Deep Mine.
!dx! Can process <color=#df840e>grain</color> or <color=#df840e>fruit</color> into <color=#df840e>alcohol</color> which can be used to increases citizens' happiness.
!dy! Can process <color=#df840e>Cotton</color> or <color=#df840e>Flax</color> into <color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color> or <color=#df840e>Linen</color>. Cloth is the raw material for advanced clothes.
!dz! Same function as the Textile Mill but with <color=#df840e>greater efficiency</color>.
!e0! <color=#df840e>More efficient</color> at making Domestic Fuel than the <color=#df840e>Chopping House</color>. Also processes Timber into <color=#df840e>Planks</color>.
!e1! Same function as Sawmill but powered by water thus with <color=#df840e>greater efficiency</color>.

!e2! Can process <color=#df840e>Timber</color> or <color=#df840e>Coal</color> into <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> for the use in Forge, Smelter, Kiln Factory and Pottery Workshop. Citizens who work here are at risk of Tracheitis.
!e3! Can process <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color> or <color=#df840e>Coal</color> into <color=#df840e>Charcoal</color> or <color=#df840e>Coke</color> for heating houses.
!e4! Can produce multiple kinds of <color=#df840e>alcohol</color>. Citizens can have higher <color=#df840e>Health</color> by consuming alcohol.

!e5! Can grind <color=#df840e>Wheat</color> or <color=#df840e>Oats</color> into <color=#df840e>Flour</color> or <color=#df840e>Malt</color>, which can be used in Bread Shop and Winery. The resource spot of Grassland will be created in the center of the buildings, providing a 50% production buff for Pasture structures within the range.
!e6! The same function as <color=#df840e>Mill</color> but is powered by water with <color=#df840e>greater efficiency</color>.
!e7! Can process <color=#df840e>Flour</color> and <color=#df840e>Sugar</color> or <color=#df840e>Butter</color> or <color=#df840e>Jam</color> into <color=#df840e>Bread</color>.
!ea! Can process <color=#df840e>Malt, Sugar Beet, Sugar Cane and Maple Sap</color> into <color=#df840e>Sugar</color>.
!ec! Can process <color=#df840e>Fish</color> or <color=#df840e>Meat Chop</color> and <color=#df840e>Salt</color> into <color=#df840e>Salted Meat</color> or <color=#df840e>Salted Fish</color>.

!ed! Can process <color=#df840e>Reeds</color> or <color=#df840e>Flax</color> into <color=#df840e>Ropes</color>. Also processes <color=#df840e>Ropes</color> into <color=#df840e>Fish Nets</color> after unlock technology.
!ee! Same function as <color=#df840e>Tailor</color> but with <color=#df840e>a greater variety of clothes</color> to produce and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>.

!ef! Can process <color=#df840e>Iron</color> and <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> into <color=#df840e>Steel</color> through exposure to high temperatures. Citizens who work here are at risk of Tracheitis.

!eg! Same function as <color=#df840e>Smithy</color> but with <color=#df840e>a greater variety of tools</color> to produce and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Citizens who work here are at risk of Tracheitis.
!eh! Can process <color=#df840e>Steel, Glass, and Bricks</color> into <color=#df840e>Building Kits</color>. Citizens who work here are at risk of Tracheitis.

!ej! Can generate <color=#df840e>a large amount of Tech EXP</color> and use <color=#df840e>Paper</color> to increase output. Can be upgraded into Research Academy after unlocking corresponding technology.

!ek! Can process <color=#df840e>Dried Dung</color> into <color=#df840e>Fertilizer</color>. The resource spot of Fertile Soil will be created in the center of the buildings, providing a 50% production buff for agricultural structures within the range.
!em! Dredgers harvest <color=#df840e>Sand</color> or <color=#df840e>Clay</color> from waterfront areas, which is the raw materials of Bricks, Glass, and Pottery.

!en! Can process <color=#df840e>Coffee Beans</color>, <color=#df840e>Cocoa Beans</color> or <color=#df840e>Tea</color> into <color=#df840e>beverages</color>; provides beverages to increase the Health of citizens.

!ep! Place that processes <color=#df840e>meat</color>, <color=#df840e>salt</color> and <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color> into <color=#df840e>sausages, bacon</color> or <color=#df840e>salted meat</color>.

!eq! Can process <color=#df840e>vegetables</color> and <color=#df840e>Salt</color> or <color=#df840e>fruits</color> and <color=#df840e>Sugar</color>and <color=#df840e>Meat Chop</color>,<color=#df840e>Fish</color> and <color=#df840e>Salt</color> into <color=#df840e>Vegetable Can</color> or <color=#df840e>Fruit Can</color> or <color=#df840e>Meat Can</color>.
!er! Can process <color=#df840e>Feathers</color> or <color=#df840e>Wool</color> and <color=#df840e>Cloth</color> into <color=#df840e>Bedding Set</color>. Can be upgraded into Bedding Factory.
!es! Can process <color=#df840e>Timber</color> and <color=#df840e>Leather</color> into <color=#df840e>Furniture</color>. Can be upgraded into Luxury Furniture Factory.

!et! Can process <color=#df840e>Fat</color> into <color=#df840e>Lamp Oil</color>, and process <color=#df840e>Lamp Oil</color> and <color=#df840e>Glass Bottles</color> into <color=#df840e>Lanterns</color>.
!eu! Same function as <color=#df840e>Mine</color> but with <color=#df840e>unlimited reserves</color> and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Cannot work without <color=#df840e>Lamp Oil</color>
!ev! Can process <color=#df840e>Stones</color> into neat <color=#df840e>Cut Stones</color>. Citizens who work here are at risk of Tracheitis.
!ew! Same function as the <color=#df840e>Bread Shop</color> but with <color=#df840e>a greater variety of food</color> to make and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>.
!ex! Can process <color=#df840e>Meat</color> and <color=#df840e>other materials</color> into <color=#df840e>various cuisines</color>.
!ez! Silkworm farmers feed silkworm with <color=#df840e>Mulberry Leaf</color> for <color=#df840e>Silkworm Cocoons</color>, which is the raw materials for silk production at the Textile Mill.
!f0! Same function as <color=#df840e>Paper Mill</color> but with <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Also can produce <color=#df840e>Ink</color> and <color=#df840e>Books</color>.

!f1! Same function as <color=#df840e>Bedding Shop</color> but with <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Can also process <color=#df840e>Wool</color> or <color=#df840e>Feathers</color> and <color=#df840e>Silk</color> into <color=#df840e>Luxury Bedding</color>.

!f2! Same function as <color=#df840e>Furniture Factory</color> but with <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Also can process <color=#df840e>Planks</color> and <color=#df840e>Refined Leather</color> into <color=#df840e>Luxury Furniture</color>.
!f3! Same function as the <color=#df840e>Forge</color>. Also processes <color=#df840e>Steel Tools, Ropes</color> and <color=#df840e>Leather</color> into <color=#df840e>Tool Kits</color>.
!f4! Can process <color=#df840e>Silver</color> into coins for use in town. Citizens who work here are at risk of Tracheitis.
!f5! A structure upgraded from <color=#df840e>Research Institute</color> where can consume Books to improve research efficiency.
!f6! Can process <color=#df840e>Silver</color> or <color=#df840e>Gold Sand</color> or <color=#df840e>Jade</color> into Jewelry for trading.

!f7! Can brew <color=#df840e>Liquors</color> from <color=#df840e>Potatoes</color> or <color=#df840e>Agaves</color> which can be used to increase citizens' happiness. Can be upgraded to Winery after unlocking the corresponding technology.
!f8! Can process <color=#df840e>Iron</color>, <color=#df840e>Timber</color> or <color=#df840e>Gold Sand</color> and <color=#df840e>Jade</color> into Statues for trading.
!f9! Can pan <color=#df840e>Sand</color> for <color=#df840e>Gold Sand</color> for the use in Carving Workshop and Jewelry Workshop.
!fa! Can find <color=#df840e>Jade</color> in <color=#df840e>Stone</color>, which can be used in the Carving Workshop and Jewelry Workshop.
!fb! Same function as <color=#df840e>Advanced Tailor</color> but with <color=#df840e>a greater variety of clothes</color> to produce and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>.

!fc! Same function as the <color=#df840e>Quarry</color> but with <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color> and <color=#df840e>reserves</color>. The production requires <color=#df840e>Iron Tools</color>. After floods, water will remain causing it to be <color=#df840e>unable to function</color>. But this also helps to reduce the duration of flooding.

!fd! Can process <color=#df840e>Sand</color> or <color=#df840e>Clay</color> and <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> into <color=#df840e>Glass</color>, <color=#df840e>Glass Bottle</color> and <color=#df840e>Bricks</color> by melting raw materials at high temperatures. Citizens who work here are at risk of Tracheitis.
!fg! Can produce all kinds of <color=#df840e>candies</color> which can <color=#df840e>increase happiness</color> after eating.

!fh! Makeshift resident for a <color=#df840e>3-person family</color> with light material consumption. Provides citizens with rest, food and drink. Can be heated . <color=#df840e>Can be placed outside the control zone of Marketplace</color> .

!fi! Traders will transport <color=#df840e>selected items</color> to the caravan in Trading Post. Caravan can be dispatched to <color=#df840e>trade with Factions</color> periodically. Water Trading Post, with larger inventory and high death risk, requires much more people to do trading.

!fj! A <color=#df840e>primary school</color> that offers basic education. Children from 8 to 9 years old will enter Primary School to complete basic education. Students <color=#df840e>must take a full course load</color> to graduate. The study year gets longer if students live too far from school. Graduate students will get a <color=#df840e>Basic Education Certificate</color> and their <color=#df840e>output will not decrease</color>.
!fk! A <color=#df840e>Cemetery</color> is used as a resting place for the deceased. Enough places for proper burial raises happiness.

!fl! Can accommodate <color=#df840e>up to 24 people</color>. Provides a place for citizens to rest, eat, drink and stay warm. Can only be built near Marketplace. However, overcrowded Interim Housings will cause the <color=#df840e>loss of desire to procreate</color>. Suitable for accommodating immigrants.
!fm! Citizens can entertain themselves and get service from bartenders, thus can <color=#df840e>increase happiness</color>.
!fn! Citizens can keep their body clean by enjoying a body scrub at the bathhouse, thus increase their <color=#df840e>health</color>.
!fo! Clinics can be upgraded to Hospitals. Citizens within the Hospital's effect range will gain <color=#df840e>Health</color> bonuses, and extra bonuses will be given with items consumed.
!fp! <color=#df840e>Central building</color> of the town where you can accept <color=#df840e>immigrants</color> and recruit an <color=#df840e>administrator</color>.
!fq! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town. <color=#df840e>Provides lighting</color> at night.
!fr! A mini-market where you can regularly <color=#df840e>sell goods</color> in exchange for <color=#df840e>silver coins</color>.

!fs! An <color=#df840e>advanced school</color> for uneducated adults. Graduate students will receive <color=#df840e>Diplomas</color> and <color=#df840e>have the possibility of gaining additional output during their work</color>.

!ft! <color=#df840e>Cures the sick</color> and increases the Health of citizens within its effective range. It can be upgraded to a <color=#df840e>Hospital</color> after unlocking the required technology.
!fu! Traders will transport <color=#df840e>selected items</color> to the caravan in Trading Post. Caravan can be dispatched to <color=#df840e>trade with Factions</color> periodically.

!fw! A <color=#df840e>primary school</color> that offers basic education. School-age children will attend boarding schools. After graduation, they will need to move into a new house. Boarding schools cannot shorten the school year by consuming paper. Educated workers' <color=#df840e>output will not decrease</color>.
!fx! Same function as the Small Trading Post with <color=#df840e>larger inventory and structure size</color>. More traders can work here and more caravan can also be formed here.

!fy! <color=#df840e>Merchant ships</color> will come to the Dock every a period of time with goods that can be purchased. The workers will transport the <color=#df840e>purchased or ordered items</color> to warehouses.
!fz! Citizens can now go to the Theater to watch plays, which <color=#df840e>increases their happiness</color>.

!g0! A <color=#df840e>advanced school</color> that offers higher education and holds <color=#df840e>more students</color>. Graduate students will get their <color=#df840e>Diplomas</color> and <color=#df840e>have the possibility of gaining additional output during their work</color>.
!g1! Repair Shops can assign repairmen to ensure that town buildings <color=#df840e>will not be damaged</color>.

!g2! Can process <color=#df840e> Medicinal Powder</color> and <color=#df840e>glass bottles</color> into <color=#df840e>Special Medicine</color>. Can also process <color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color> and <color=#df840e>Herbs</color> into <color=#df840e>Bandage</color> .
!g3! Can assign builders in Builders Cabin, whose duty is to guarantee the construction of <color=#df840e>buildings</color> and <color=#df840e>roads</color>.

!g4! Can process <color=#df840e>Clay</color> and <color=#df840e>catalysts</color> into <color=#df840e> pottery</color> or <color=#df840e>porcelain</color>, and <color=#df840e>silver ore</color> into <color=#df840e>Silver cutlery</color>. Citizens who work here are at risk of Tracheitis.

!g5! When a <color=#df840e>disaster</color> occurs in the town, citizens, <color=#df840e>excluding combatants</color>, can enter shelters to avoid casualties. However, since food is not stored in the shelter, they need to be evacuated from there as soon as possible after the disaster.

!g6! A pleasant home for <color=#df840e>a family of 5</color>. Storage capacity is greater than <color=#df840e>a two-story house</color>, fuel lasts longer and help <color=#df840e>relieve more stress</color>, can only be built within the market places. Press F during preview to change its type.
!g7! Building bridges allows citizens to <color=#df840e>cross the river</color>. Each side of a bridge should have more than 2 grids on land.
!g8! Building tunnels allows citizens to <color=#df840e>travel through mountains</color>. Each side of a Tunnel should have more than 2 grids on land.

!g9! Can process <color=#df840e>Fat</color>, <color=#df840e>Blubber</color>, <color=#df840e>Beeswax</color> and <color=#df840e>Medicinal Powder</color> or <color=#df840e>Salt</color> into <color=#df840e>Medical Soaps</color> or <color=#df840e>Salt Soaps</color>. Medical Soaps and Salt Soaps can increase citizens' <color=#df840e>Health</color>.
!ga! Cathedrals provide citizens with spiritual sustenance and grant <color=#df840e>Happiness bonuses</color>. They predict disaster but the prediction can be wrong.

!gc! Wider bridges allow more citizens to <color=#df840e>cross the river</color>. Greatly increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>75%</color>. Each side of a bridge should have more than 2 grids on land.
!gd! The Boiler Rooms consume <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color> to provide <color=#df840e>heating</color> for area houses, decreasing Fuel consumption significantly.
!ge! When <color=#df840e>criminals</color> appear in the town, sheriffs can hunt down suspects when things are still under control. Preventing further casualties.
!gf! Increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>25%</color>.
!gg! Roads constructed with <color=#df840e>Stone</color>. Greatly increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>50%</color>.

!gh! Bridges constructed with <color=#df840e>jade</color>, allow more citizens to <color=#df840e>cross the river</color>. Greatly increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>125%</color>. Each side of a bridge should have more than 2 grids on land.

!gi! Bridges constructed with <color=#df840e>cut stone</color>, allow more citizens to <color=#df840e>cross the river</color>. Greatly increases the speed that citizens walk by <color=#df840e>75%</color>. Each side of a bridge should have more than 2 grids on land.

!gj! A temporary shelter for <color=#df840e>32 people</color>. Storage capacity is larger than <color=#df840e>an Interim Housing</color> and fuel lasts longer, can only be built within the market places.
!gk! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> trees that can be placed in the town.
!gl! A <color=#df840e>decorative</color> flower-stand that can be placed in the town. Citizens can travel through it.

!gm! A small <color=#df840e>decorative</color> Stone Statue that can slightly reduce citizens' stress. <color=#df840e>Unlock after surviving in Easter Island</color>. Press F during placement to change its style.

!gn! A medium-size <color=#df840e>decorative</color> Stone Statue that can slightly reduce citizens' stress. <color=#df840e>Unlock after surviving in Easter Island</color>. Press F during placement to change its style.
!go! A <color=#df840e>decorative</color> Moai Stone Statue that can slightly reduce citizens' stress. <color=#df840e>Unlock after surviving in Easter Island</color>.
!gp! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town. Can <color=#df840e>provide lighting</color> at night.
!gq! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town. Can <color=#df840e>provide lighting</color> at night.
!gr! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town. Can <color=#df840e>provide lighting</color> at night.
!gs! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town. Can <color=#df840e>provide lighting</color> at night.

!gu! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town. Can <color=#df840e>provide lighting</color> at night. Press F during preview to change its type.
!gv! Roads constructed with <color=#df840e>bricks</color>. Greatly increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>100%</color>.
!gw! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town. <color=#df840e>Provides lighting</color> at night.
!gx! The Great Temple symbolizes the prosperity of the town and provides faith and happiness for a large number of citizens. But some of the citizens will be sacrificed each month.
!gy! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town.
!gz! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town.

!hd! <color=#df840e>Decorative buildings</color> that can be built in towns, blueprints required. The soothing aura can slightly reduce the Stress on the citizens.
!he! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town.
!hf! <color=#df840e>Decorative buildings</color> that can be built in towns, blueprints required. Can attract animals and increase the probability of obtaining animal cubs during hunting.
!hg! <color=#df840e>Decorative buildings</color> that can be built in towns, blueprints required. Can inspire the citizens and slightly increase their movement speed.
!hh! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town. Can <color=#df840e>provide lighting</color> at night.
!hi! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town.
!hj! <color=#df840e>Decorative buildings</color> that can be built in towns, blueprints required. Ancient Trees, symbolizing fertility, slightly increase citizens' birth rate.
!hk! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town.
!hl! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town.
!hm! <color=#df840e>Decorative buildings</color> that can be built in towns, blueprints required. The statue of Angel will slightly increase citizens' lifespan.
!hn! <color=#df840e>Decorative buildings</color> that can be built in towns, blueprints required. The statue of Demon will slightly reduce citizens' lifespan.
!ho! Buildings with <color=#df840e>magical powers</color>. Can get certain items by consuming coins every once in a while. See how lucky you are!
!hp! <color=#df840e>Decorative buildings</color>, symbolizing the courage of the forerunners, can trigger events every once in a while. Be them good or bad, do you have the courage to welcome them!
!hq! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town.
!hr! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town.
!hs! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the water. Can slightly reduce citizens' stress.

!ht! Building the Grand Thermae is a milestone for town sanitation development. The Grand Thermae is a facility for bathing and increases the Health of citizens. Needs the corresponding blueprint to unlock.
!hu! Roads constructed with <color=#df840e>Cut Stone</color>. Greatly increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>75%</color>.
!hv! Roads constructed with <color=#df840e>Gold Sand</color>. Greatly increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>125%</color>.

!hw! Luxury housing for <color=#df840e>two families (8 people)</color>. Greater storage capacity, fuel lasts longer, and help <color=#df840e>relieve much more stress</color>, can only be built within the market places.
!jf! Use Fishing Nets to improve fish output.
!ji! Use Paper to quicken students' graduation.
!nh! Roads constructed with <color=#df840e>jade</color>. Greatly increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>125%</color>.
!oq! The Great Castle symbolizes the prosperity of the town and can accommodate <color=#df840e>80 families, up to 400 people</color>. Can relieve <color=#df840e>25%</color> residents' stress.

!pe! Can accommodate <color=#df840e>one family, up to 5 people</color> with long residual fuel endurance and allows large stockpiles. Must be placed in the range of marketplaces. Can relieve <color=#df840e>15%</color> residents' stress.
!pu! After being enabled, Field output will increase by up to 25% by continuously using fertilizer.
!pv! Consuming paper to increase the education efficiency <color=#df840e>by 100%</color>. The Tech EXP output increased by <color=#df840e>150%</color>.
!pw! Increase 300 technology experience by consuming ropes while working
!q1! Use Paper to increase students' learning efficiency.
!q2! Use Paper to increase students' learning efficiency.
!q4! Increase 200 technology experience by consuming paper while working
!q5! After being enabled, Orchard output will increase by up to 25% by continuously using fertilizer.
!q6! Increase 900 technology experience by consuming books while working
!q7! After being enabled, the fish output will increase by continuously using Fishing Nets. Production will normally proceed without fishing nets.
!q8! After being enabled, Forest Farm output will increase by up to 25% by continuously using fertilizer.
!q9! After being enabled, livestock will grow faster and pasture output will increase by continuously using fodder.
!qa! Output of the Plantation increases when enabling the use of Fertilizer.
!qb! Use Fodder to accelerate animals' growth.
!qc! Use Fodder to increase lifespan and yield of the animals.
!qh! Number of resources to be cleared
!qo! The construction of this structure has been paused.
!qr! Inventory of the structure is full.
!r3! Low durability，consume materials to repair the structure<color=#df840e>damage</color>.
!r5! This structure is <color=#df840e>ruined</color>. Please rebuild it.
!r6! High durability. No materials consume when <color=#df840e>repairing</color>.
!rm! The structure is damaged and in need of repair.
!rp! There is a fire! The fire will soon spread to structures nearby.
!rv! The plant doesn't grow in this season.
!rx! A product has not been selected.
!rz! Food reserves are low at home.
!s0! Domestic Fuel reserves are low at home.
!s2! Water reserves are low at home.
!s4! Cannot raise if you haven't acquired this animal.
!s5! Need to transfer the same animal species from other Pastures.
!s8! Please unlock Research Institute in <color=#df840e>Technology - Science</color>. Then open Service (hotkey: 6) toolbar to build 3 <color=#df840e>Research Institutes</color>.
!sc! Prioritize the construction of this building.
!sf! The number of survival items reserved. Items will not be transported to trade buildings below this number. Can be adjusted in the Stock Management panel.
!si! Number of items used for trade. Items will be transported to trade buildings until the number is reached.
!sl! List of random events: Number of citizens +99 Number of citizens -99 Silver coins +99999 Silver coins -99999 Spawn 9 flocks of idle chickens Spawn 9 flocks of turkeys

!sm! The Goof-off Hero is a symbol of danger and opportunity. A random event will take place every six months once it is built. <color=#df840e>Note: Disabling the structure will prevent the effect.</color>
!sq! When you think the generation speed of Tech EXP is slow, develop <color=#df840e>Science</color> first can greatly improve the output of Tech EXP.
!t0! {0} is giving a lecture to students.

!tw! Can accommodate <color=#df840e>15 families, up to 45 people</color> with larger inventory than <color=#df840e>Interim Housing</color>. Fuel last longer. Each family inside can <color=#df840e>have a child</color>. Built near <color=#df840e>Marketplace</color>.
!u0! Citizen is now angered, and may commit crimes.
!u1! Ctizen is now encouraged, gain +30% efficiency bonus. Movement speed+10%
!u5! Citizen is excited, efficiency +10% movement speed +10%
!u6! Citizen is weak, gain higher odds for plague infection
!u7! Citizen is now vigorous, Stamina consumption-20% immune to plagues, fracture and sprain

!v7! A <color=#f8af23>merchant ship</color> has arrived at the Dock.
!v8! The delivery ship has arrived with your ordered goods.
!vi! <color=#f8af23>{0}</color> citizens got a <color=#f8af23>sprained ankle</color>! The use of Bandage will shorten the healing time.
!vj! <color=#f8af23>{0}</color> citizens got a <color=#f8af23>fracture</color>! You need a clinic or hospital to cure the sick. The use of Bandage will shorten the healing time.
!vk! <color=#f8af23>{0}</color> citizens suffered from cholera! You need a clinic or hospital to cure the sick.
!vl! <color=#f8af23>{0}</color> citizens suffered from measles! You need a clinic or hospital to cure the sick.
!vm! <color=#f8af23>{0}</color> citizens suffered from tuberculosis.You need a clinic or hospital to cure the sick.
!vn! <color=#f8af23>{0}</color> citizens suffered from pandemic flu! You need a clinic or hospital to cure the sick.
!vp! The <color=#f8af23>administrator's</color> term of office has expired.
!w2! Citizen is now exhausted, gain higher odds of plagues, fracture and sprain.
!w6! New animals acquired. Build a Pasture to raise them.
!w7! The merchant ship has arrived. Go and see what goods the merchant has brought.
!w8! The merchant ship has arrived with your order. Your items have been unloaded.
!w9! <color=#df840e>{0}</color> citizens are freezing! Click the icon to check each of them.
!wa! A snowstorm is raging in your town.
!wb! A tornado is raging in your town.
!wc! A Technology Point acquired! Use it in the Town Technology panel.
!wd! The autumn harvest has begun. Building storage structures near the fields would have better efficiency.
!we! There are <color=#df840e>{0}</color> citizens without a house! Click the icon to check each of them.
!wf! <color=#df840e>{0}</color> citizens are starving! Click the icon to check each of them.
!wg! <color=#df840e>{0}</color> citizens are sick! Click the icon to check each of them.
!wh! <color=#df840e>{0}</color> citizens got injured during work. Click the icon to check each of them.
!wi! All Storage Yards are full! Need to build new Storage Yard.
!wj! An administrator's term is about to expire! Click the icon to switch to the Town Hall.
!wk! The sheriff found an murderer. You can choose whether to banish him from your town.
!wl! There are <color=#df840e>{0}</color> citizens without workplaces! Click the icon to check each of them.
!wm! There are <color=#df840e>{0}</color> citizens without clothes! Click the icon to check each of them. Clothes can be made in <color=#df840e>Tailor</color>.
!wn! No repairmen. Please beware of building damage. You can build the <color=#df840e>Repair Shop</color> and assign repairmen there.
!wo! Fuel reserves are low. Citizens may get frostbite.
!wp! Herb reserves are low. The Health of citizens may decrease.
!wq! Lacking laborers may impact the transport and production. Unemploy some workers to have more laborers.
!wr! Stone reserve is low. Construction may be affected. Stone can be gathered in the wild or mined from the Quarry.
!ws! Tech points have not been used for a long time. Please use them to unlock some tech in Technology.
!wt! There are <color=#df840e>{0}</color> citizens without tools! Click the icon to check each of them.
!wu! Timber supplies are low. Construction and Domestic Fuel production may be affected. Timber can be harvested in the Foresters Hut.
!wv! Immigrants are visiting your town. Check in Town Hall for more info!
!ww! There are <color=#df840e>{0}</color> residents who have become adults and want their own houses.
!wx! New seeds acquired. Can grow the crop in the field now.
!wy! <color=#df840e>{0}</color> citizens are thirsty! Click the icon to check each of them.
!wz! All Warehouses are full! Need <color=#df840e>Storage Yard</color>, or production in structures will <color=#df840e>stop</color>！
!x3! The citizen will be banished from the town, but the happiness of his/her family will be greatly reduced. Are you sure you want to exile this citizen?
!xz! Suffering from a disease that might spread to others.
!y0! Suffering from a Plague that might spread to others.
!y3! Suffering from Cholera that might spread to others.
!y4! Suffering from Measles that might spread to others.
!y5! Suffering from Tuberculosis that might spread to others.
!y6! Suffering from Pandemic that might spread to others.
!y9! No clothes, easier to be frozen to death.
!yt! This tutorial will guide you through the <color=#df840e>basic operations</color> in game.
!yu! Now try to cut down some trees to get some wood. <color=#df840e>Right click</color> can exit the selected command states.
!yv! Press <color=#df840e>F2</color> 3 times to speed up the game until it's <color=#df840e>10x</color> speed.
!yw! After the structure is closed, production will stop and workers will leave. Now, please try to <color=#df840e>close the marketplace</color>.
!yx! Please click on the <color=#df840e>house</color> to open the building details, and then click the locate button in the upper right corner to <color=#df840e>switch</color> to other house.
!yy! Click a <color=#df840e>Durable Storage Yard</color> to set its <color=#df840e>Storable Items</color>.
!yz! Select <color=#df840e>Bridge</color> in <color=#df840e>Roads</color> toolbar. Bridge has to be placed over water and 2 grids each side of it has to be placed on land.

!z0! Select the tunnel in the <color=#df840e>Road (hotkey: 7)</color>, pay attention to the tunnel have to pass through the mountain, the length of both sides on the flat ground has two squares before you can place it, let's build your first tunnel.
!z1! Click the <color=#df840e>Statistics</color> button on the top right corner or press hotkey <color=#df840e>I</color> to view the <color=#df840e>Town Details</color> page.
!z2! ·Select it in Houses (hotkey: 1). ·Citizens with their own house can recover stamina quickly. ·Press <color=#df840e>R</color> to rotate structure while placing.
!z3! ·Select it in Agriculture (hotkey: 2). ·Farmers only start to sow after <color=#df840e>choosing seeds</color>. ·Only in suitable season and temperature can a Field be sowed and harvested.
!z4! Click the menu button on the <color=#df840e>top right corner</color> or press <color=#df840e>ESC</color> to open the menu.
!z5! ·Select it in Resources (hotkey: 3). ·Foresters Hut works better <color=#df840e>in forests</color>. ·You can use Command (hotkey: 0) to collecting materials on the map.
!z6! ·Select it in Resources (hotkey: 3). ·More harvestable plants will grow around <color=#df840e>mature trees</color>. ·Use Command (hotkey: 0) to collect materials on the map.

!z7! ·Select it in Resources (hotkey: 3). ·Hunters will hunt <color=#df840e>animals</color> on the map and <color=#df840e>have chances to get cubs</color>. ·Hunting scope of hunter is everywhere he can reach.

!z8! ·Select it in Processing (hotkey:4). ·Processing type buildings will only begin production after <color=#df840e>choosing a recipe</color>. ·<color=#df840e>Sawmill</color> and <color=#df840e>Water Sawmill</color> can also complete this task. But technology needed.

!z9! ·Select it in Resources (hotkey: 3) ·Production type buildings will only begin production after <color=#df840e>choosing a recipe</color>. ·You can use Command (hotkey: 0) to collect materials on the map.
!za! ·Select it in House (hotkey: 1). ·Citizens with their own house recover stamina quickly. ·You can use Command (hotkey: 0) to collect materials on the map.
!zb! ·Select it in Service (hotkey: 6). ·Repairman can keep your buildings <color=#df840e>from being damaged</color>. ·Buildings need to be rebuilt if they are destroyed by disaster.

!zc! ·Click on the building to open building menu. ·You can disable the building by toggling the green button in the leftside of the building's icon. ·Production will <color=#df840e>stop</color> and the workers will also <color=#df840e>leave</color> after being disabled.
!zd! Citizen is now in proper condition. No effect.
!ze! ·Select it in Service (hotkey: 6). · Cures the sick. ·Clinic can raise citizens' <color=#df840e>health</color> in its range.
!zf! Use <color=#df840e>WASD</color> or move the cursor to the screen edge in full-screen mode to move the camera.

!zg! ·Select it in Processing (hotkey:4). ·Liquor can raise citizens' <color=#df840e>happiness</color>. ·Processing type buildings will only begin production after <color=#df840e>choosing a product</color>.
!zh! Please click on people statistics and <color=#df840e>open the citizen statistics menu</color> to view.
!zi! Here you can see the upcoming events such as merchant ships, immigrants and disasters.

!zj! In <color=#df840e>Services</color> toolbar, select and build a <color=#df840e>Town Hall</color>. When there are multiple structures being built at the same time, you can click the more urgently needed structure and select <color=#df840e>Prioritize</color>.
!zk! There are some basic development routes, some answers to common questions in Help (hotkey: O). Structure and item description can also be found there to help you plan better.

!zl! Now that you have understood the basic operations of the game, let's head to the <color=#df840e>advanced tutorial</color> where it shows you how to <color=#df840e>solve basic survival problems</color>.
!zm! Toggle the on/off switch again in building menu to <color=#df840e>enable the Marketplace</color>.

!zn! If you still don't know the basic operations, such as rotating the buildings during placement, gathering resources on the map, viewing total output or consumption etc, you are suggested to take the previous tutorial first.
!zp! Open Resources toolbar and build a <color=#df840e>Big Well</color>.
!zq! You can also rotate the camera by holding <color=#df840e>the middle button on mouse</color> and dragging.
!zr! Open Services toolbar and build a <color=#df840e>Repair Shop</color>.
!zs! Click on Builders Cabin and <color=#df840e>increase the number of builders to 4</color>.
!zt! Open Resources toolbar and build a <color=#df840e>Gatherers Hut</color>. Better to built it near forest, but not too far away from residential areas.
!zu! Please open Resources toolbar(shortcut: 3) to build <color=#df840e>a Hunters Hut</color>.
!zv! Open <color=#df840e>Agriculture</color>toolbar (hotkey 2) and build a <color=#df840e>Farmland</color>. After it is built, you need to select a targeted Crop.
!zw! Please open Agriculture (hotkey: 2) and build a <color=#df840e>Orchard</color>. When the Orchard is built, you need to select crops.

!zx! Please open Resource toolbar(shortcut: 3) and build a <color=#df840e>Foresters Hut</color>. Foresters Hut will cut down full-grown trees so it is not recommended to be built near Gatherers Hut or Hunters Hut.
!zy! Open Processing (hotkey: 4) in Build Menu and build a <color=#df840e>Chopping House</color>. Processing type buildings will only begin production after <color=#df840e>choosing a product</color>.
!zz! Open Processing toolbar and build a <color=#df840e>Tailor</color>.
!100! Open Processing and build a <color=#df840e>Smithy</color> and select a product for making tools.
!101! <color=#df840e>Tick</color> the resource to monitor its quantity more conveniently.
!102! Citizen is now vital, immune to accidential death at work.
!103! Build a <color=#df840e>Distillery</color> and select a suitable product.
!104! Open Services toolbar and build a <color=#df840e>Clinic</color>.
!105! Now that you have understood how to ensure the citizen's survival, the <color=#df840e>advanced tutorial</color> will show you how to <color=#df840e>develop technology and trading</color>.
!106! If you are still unclear about the basics or how to keep citizens alive, it is recommended that you go through the previous tutorials.
!107! Select and build a <color=#df840e>Fishing Dock</color> at Agriculture toolbar.
!109! Let's build a <color=#df840e>Fishing Dock</color> once plank can be produced in Sawmill. Note that you will need to select a production product after the construction is completed.
!10a! Scholars adept at commerce-related affairs, trade affairs of the town would be benefitted from commerce-focusing guidelines.
!10b! Let's wait until <color=#df840e>a Tech Point</color> is generated. The technology icon at the top of the screen shows the progress of the current Tech EXP.
!10c! Click on the sidebar to view the <color=#df840e>detailed information on the citizens</color>.
!10d! Please open <color=#df840e>Technology - Mining</color> to unlock <color=#df840e>silver mining</color> technology.
!10e! Please build <color=#df840e>a mine</color> and <color=#df840e>choose silver ore</color> as the product. Note that the mine needs to be built on the mountain.
!10f! Unlock <color=#df840e>Grocery Store in Technology - Trade</color> and build one in your town.
!10g! Select <color=#df840e>items to sell</color> and wait for vendors to earn you <color=#df840e>silver coins</color>.
!10h! Citizen is now vital, stamina comsumption-20%. Work accident death nullified.
!10i! When a merchant ship docks, click the merchant ship or the Dock to conduct <color=#df840e>trading</color>.
!10j! If you encounter problems, you can view the help log or review the tutorial from the main menu.
!10k! There are also needs for religious service and medical care despite the citizen's basic needs for survival.
!10n! Some buildings have multiple styles, press the <color=#df840e>F</color> key to switch between various styles.
!10o! Your people have finally found a settlement and now start to build their own homes on this new land.
!10q! You can slow down (F1) or speed up (F2) by <color=#df840e>the button at the top left corner</color>. Press the <color=#df840e>Spacebar</color> to pause the game.

!10r! You can view the building details by clicking it, please click on the <color=#df840e>Marketplace</color>. In the building details panel, the button to the left of the building icon can be used to <color=#df840e>disabled buildings</color>.

!10s! When you have <color=#df840e>multiple buildings of the same kind</color>, you can click the circular <color=#df840e>positioning</color> button in the upper right corner of the building details to switch between them.
!10t! You can select what type of items to store in a storage type structure by clicking the <color=#df840e>Storable Items</color> button below the building panel.
!10u! <color=#df840e>The bridge</color> allows citizens to reach the other side of the river, increasing the scope of activities.
!10v! The <color=#df840e>tunnel</color> allows citizens to reach the other side of the mountain, greatly reducing the moving distance.
!10w! Knowing the details of the city is essential for management. Press <color=#df840e>(i)</color> to open the <color=#df840e>Town Details</color> window.
!10z! You can open Option Menu anytime by following methods
!11a! First, we will learn how to <color=#df840e>move the camera</color>.

!11c! In addition to city details, clicking on <color=#df840e>the number of people at the top of the screen</color> can also quickly view the citizen's occupation and population structure, including gender ratio, fertility rate, etc.
!11d! The Event Indicator at the upper right corner of the screen shows upcoming events <color=#df840e>in the next 12 months</color>.
!11e! In Town Hall, you can accept and turn immigrants into citizens. Once the population reaches <color=#df840e>a certain number</color>, you can also select administrators.
!11f! If you have any question during the game, you can press letter <color=#df840e>(O)</color> on keyboard to open the <color=#df840e>Help log</color>.

!11h! If there are <color=#df840e>Laborers</color> (citizens that haven't assigned jobs) when <color=#df840e>enabling structures</color> or when <color=#df840e>new structures are completed</color>, they will automatically be placed in the structure to work.
!11i! This tutorial will guide you how to <color=#df840e>keep citizens alive</color>.
!11j! Citizens without house will recover stamina slower and work with low efficiency.
!11l! You can rotate the camera by pressing <color=#df840e>Q</color> or <color=#df840e>E</color>.
!11m! Structures will break down easily without <color=#df840e>repairmen</color>.
!11n! When there are multiple structures under construction, building more <color=#df840e>Builders' Cabins</color> or assigning more builders can speed up the process.
!11o! In order to survive, <color=#df840e>food</color> is indispensable.
!11p! Hunters can get meat for <color=#df840e>food</color> through hunting, and also possibly capture an animal's <color=#df840e>cub</color>.
!11r! Fruit from the <color=#df840e>Orchard</color> can also be used as <color=#df840e>food</color>. But it <color=#df840e>takes years</color> for new fruit trees to mature.
!11s! Citizens may <color=#df840e>freeze to death</color> without enough <color=#df840e>fuel</color> to warm them up. Wood is an important raw material for making fuel.
!11t! <color=#df840e>Fuel</color> can keep houses <color=#df840e>warm</color>. Cold citizens need to be warmed in time to survive.
!11u! Citizens who have clothes in cold weather can work longer.
!11v! The availability of <color=#df840e>tools</color> has a great impact on <color=#df840e>work efficiency</color>.
!11w! Press <color=#df840e>U</color> or the <color=#df840e>top left button</color> to open the Resource Monitor.
!11x! ·Selectable in Service (hotkey: 6). ·Chapels can raise citizens' <color=#df840e>happiness</color> in its range. ·Consume ceremonial bread or lanterns to provide better happiness bonus.
!11y! <color=#df840e>Wine</color> are cleaner than regular water. Grants <color=#df840e>health</color> bonus to citizens; premium wine grants better bonus.
!11z! <color=#df840e>Clinics</color> improve the <color=#df840e>Health</color> of residents in the area. Citizens who are sick need clinics to treat their illnesses.
!121! This tutorial will guide you how to <color=#df840e>develop technology and trade</color>.
!122! Many materials require <color=#df840e>technology</color> to be harvested or produced.

!123! <color=#df840e>Planks</color> is necessary for building a Fishing Dock, but they cannot be obtained directly by gathering. You will need a <color=#df840e>Sawmill</color> to process Wood into Planks.
!124! Open Processing and build a <color=#df840e>Sawmill</color>. Open the Sawmill's building menu and select recipe <color=#df840e>Building Material - Plank</color>.
!125! Scholars adept at education-related affairs, education of the town would be benefitted from science-focusing guidelines.
!126! With multiple Research Institutes or Academies, the output of <color=#df840e>Tech EXP</color> will be much faster. You can further boost its output by using paper or books.
!127! <color=#df840e>Information on the sidebar</color> displays the problems encountered by citizens.
!128! <color=#df840e>Silver ore</color> is a valuable ore that requires a <color=#df840e>Tech to be unlocked</color> before it can be mined.
!12a! You can sell items for <color=#df840e>silver coins</color> at the Grocery Store. After unlocking the Mint Tech, you can also directly mint silver coin using silver ore.
!12b! You need to set the <color=#df840e>goods for sale</color> in the Grocery Store. The goods must be present in your inventory for it be selected.
!12c! Summon the Service panel to build a <color=#df840e>Chapel</color> at where you see fit.

!12d! Let's wait for a merchant ship to arrive so that we can try trading. Merchant ships do not carry silver coins. You can only trade for a merchant ship's goods <color=#df840e>using your own silver coins or products</color>.
!12e! You've completed the last tutorial. Now you can start building your town!
!12f! Scroll the mouse wheel to <color=#df840e>zoom in and out</color> with the camera for a better view.
!12g! Press <color=#df840e>R</color> to adjust the house orientation. Press <color=#df840e>F</color> to switch certain structure type.
!12h! Build <color=#df840e>4 more houses</color> for homeless people.
!12i! Check the citizens'status to know their needs, fullfilled needs grants extra <color=#df840e>happiness</color> and <color=#df840e>health</color> bonus.
!12u! You can change day and night in <color=#df840e>settings</color>.

!12v! Teachers can produce <color=#df840e>Tech EXP</color> during work. When the town has enough experience, the town acquires a Tech Point, which can be used to unlock new technologies (<color=#df840e>Hotkey: T</color>).
!12w! Note that the plants only grow <color=#df840e>around trees</color>. If there are no trees, there is nowhere to gather.

!12x! Herbs guarantee the health of your town. Maintaining a sufficient supply of Herbs can keep <color=#df840e>health</color> levels high. Advanced medicines can further increase health. Some of the medicines have additional benefits.
!12y! Foresters focus on maintaining an <color=#df840e>ecological balance</color> and do not produce a high output of Timber. You can unlock forest farms in Technology for a steady source of Timber.

!12z! To spend silver coins, you need to build a <color=#df840e>dock</color> or a <color=#df840e>ferry</color> for the merchant ships to visit. When no ships are arriving, you can place orders to deal with any shortage of resources.
!130! A good supply of liquor is a significant factor in maintaining high levels of <color=#df840e>happiness</color>.
!131! When the population grows to a certain level, a new administrator will be elected. Elected administrators have different skills.

!132! Citizens affiliated with the church will not commit crimes due to their <color=#df840e>religious beliefs</color>. Note that a church can only serve <color=#df840e>a limited area</color>. It's still possible for other citizens to <color=#df840e>commit crimes</color>.
!133! Clinics can treat diseases and plagues. There is no guarantee of stable <color=#df840e>health</color> until a clinic is built.

!134! Once built, cemeteries provide citizens that have passed away with a <color=#df840e>resting place</color>. If there is no cemetery, the family of the dead will suffer from grief, and their happiness levels will decrease.
!135! Also, the well is important for extinguishing <color=#df840e>fires</color>, so remember to place them in multiple different areas.
!136! The time bar in the top right indicates when the merchant ship will be <color=#df840e>arriving</color>. The ship requires a port of call to dock if you wish to trade.

!137! Interim Housings are intended to function as temporary housing when <color=#df840e>immigrants arrive</color> or <color=#df840e> disasters occur</color>. When there are better houses, citizens will move out of the Interim Housings. However, the <color=#df840e>Luxury Interim Housing</color> is excellent in every way and does not impair citizens' desire to have children.

!13a! The products of nearby structures can be placed directly in the marketplace. Vendors will automatically <color=#df840e>balance their supplies</color>, replenishing the insufficient and removing the excess.
!13b! A mine has <color=#df840e>limited reserves</color>. You can upgrade it to a mine with endless reserves in Town Technology.
!13c! An ordinary quarry has <color=#df840e>limited reserves</color>. You can upgrade it to an unlimited quarry in Town Technology.

!13d! Fertile adults will have children when their houses are not full. When the children grow up, they will want to <color=#df840e>move out</color>. New houses can be used by a single citizen, a couple, or a whole family.
!13e! You can sell goods at the grocery store to get <color=#df840e>silver coins</color>.

!13f! The fields will have a <color=#df840e>slack season</color> when the farmers do not work, though they will help the laborers transport items and follow basic directions. The period from March to September is the <color=#df840e>busy season</color> when the farmers work hard. Note that each crop has its own <color=#df840e>characteristics</color>. Some have an early harvest, and some have a high yield. <color=#df840e>New crop seeds</color> are mainly sourced through the Gatherers Hut and trade.

!13g! Stuctures such as <color=#df840e>Gatherers Hut, Hunters Hut and Fishing Dock</color> can obtain food monthly. While structures like <color=#df840e>Field, Orchard</color> will produce food yearly.

!13h! <color=#df840e>Big Well</color> is in <color=#df840e>Resources</color> toolbar (Hotkey: 3). <color=#df840e>Reservoir</color> is here too, but it needs Technology - Livability - Clean Water to be unlocked, by using Hotkey T to quite open the Technology panel.
!13i! Tools can be produced in <color=#df840e>Smithy</color> which is in <color=#df840e>Processing toolbar (4)</color>.
!13j! <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color> can be produced in <color=#df840e>Chopping House</color>, which is in Processing (4).
!13k! Items can be stored in <color=#df840e>Storage Yard</color> which is in <color=#df840e>Logistics toolbar (5)</color>.

!13l! It takes many years for fruit trees to <color=#df840e>grow</color>. When the trees have matured, fruits will ripen when the temperature is right and the farmers will harvest the Orchard. In addition, when reserves are low, <color=#df840e>felling</color> trees in the Orchard is a quick way to get Timber.
!13m! If you cannot find the right fishing waters upgrading your techniques is the best choice. If there are no suitable fishing areas you can prioritize developing other industries.

!13n! You can <color=#df840e>build a bridge</color> to increase the yield of hunting. It is also possible for the hunters to capture <color=#df840e>animal cubs</color>, which can be raised in the pasture as a steady source of protein.

!13o! Houses with sufficient fuel will quickly <color=#df840e>recover</color> citizen's warmth, allowing them to return to work again. If citizens are cold and their home is too far away, they will go to <color=#df840e>nearby</color> structures for warmth. If a citizen's level of warmth is too low and they have no access to heat, they will <color=#df840e>lose HP</color> until they freeze to death.
!13p! The Smithy has <color=#df840e>Activating upgrades</color> can lead to the production of advanced tools. The work efficiency of citizens who work without tools is significantly reduced.

!13q! You can set <color=#df840e>product limits</color> for production structures. The number of products produced by the Tailor is related to the population, so you should adjust the limit in response to population changes.
!13r! It's getting dark and there is no light at night. You can build some <color=#df840e>illuminative buildings</color> to light up the town in Decoration (<color=#df840e>Hotkey: Tab</color>).
!13s! You are constructing a school. Schools require teachers. The town's first generation of adults are all educated.

!13t! You are constructing a Gatherers Hut, which is an <color=#df840e>area structure</color>. Gatherers can gather <color=#df840e>food</color>, <color=#df840e>Herbs</color> and <color=#df840e>agave</color> in nearby area. It is also possible to obtain crop seeds that can be grown in the field.
!13u! You are constructing a herbalist's cabin, which is an <color=#df840e>area structure</color>. The yields of overlapping area structures will be lower.

!13v! You are constructing a Foresters Hut which is an <color=#df840e>area structure</color>. The Foresters Hut is a facility that produces <color=#df840e>Timber</color>. Foresters will cut down mature trees and plant saplings.

!13w! You are constructing a grocery store. It will automatically sell designated goods in exchange for <color=#df840e>silver coins</color>. Coins are common currency and can be used, without limit, for trading with the merchant ship.
!13x! You are constructing a distillery, which produces <color=#df840e>spirits</color>. The raw materials can be acquired from Gatherers Huts and wells.
!13y! You are constructing a Town Hall, which is where you will assign <color=#df840e>administrator</color> to govern the town. You can also <color=#df840e>accept immigrants</color> at the Town Hall.
!13z! You are constructing a church. Once a cleric has been assigned, citizens will start attending.
!140! You are constructing a clinic. Once doctors are assigned, the citizens will have <color=#df840e>health care</color>. The clinic can only serve a limited area.
!141! You are constructing a cemetery, which is the right thing to do. The max number of <color=#df840e>tombstones</color> is related to the size of the cemetery.

!142! You are constructing a well. The well provides <color=#df840e>water</color> , used for drinking and as a raw material in various products. Citizen may be <color=#df840e>thirsty</color> if lacking water.
!143! You are constructing a Dock. Dock are both <color=#df840e>ports of call</color> for ships.

!144! You are constructing a Interim Housing. Citizens who live in houses will not relocate to a Interim Housing. Interim Housings are crowded and small, so occupants will <color=#df840e>lose the desire to procreate</color>.
!145! You are constructing an adult school, which is exclusively for uneducated <color=#df840e>adults</color>.
!146! You are constructing a boarding school, which houses <color=#df840e>school-age children</color> until they graduate.
!147! You are constructing a marketplace. Assigned vendors will transport items from nearby <color=#df840e>warehouses</color> and <color=#df840e>storage yards</color> for citizens to use.
!148! You are constructing a mine. A mine can produce coal or Iron.

!14a! You are constructing a sawmill, which processes Timber into <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color> with great efficiency. It can also produce <color=#df840e>planks</color> as construction materials.

!14b! You are constructing a house. Add <color=#df840e>builders</color> at <color=#df840e>builders cabin</color> to complete the construction. <color=#df840e>Homeless</color> citizens will move into new houses as a family.
!14c! You are constructing a traded goods facility, which processes raw materials into exquisite <color=#df840e>tradable goods</color>. These items are exclusively for sale and demand higher prices.
!14d! You have placed a field. You need to <color=#df840e>select a crop</color> and assign farmers to start sowing seeds.
!14e! Some citizens are <color=#df840e>hungry</color>. Select Gather Plants in Command toolbar to assign laborers to collect wild vegetables. People without work currently will go gathering too.
!14f! Some citizens are <color=#df840e>thirsty</color>. Well or Reservoir needed to solve this problem.
!14g! Some citizens have <color=#df840e>no tools</color>. Work efficiency greatly decreased.
!14h! Some citizens are <color=#df840e>freezing</color>. Citizens' warmth will keep decreasing in cold weather and vitality will also decrease until this citizen die if warmth is 0.
!14i! Warehouses or Storage Yards are full. Citizens have nowhere to store suppies.
!14k! You are constructing a fishing dock. It is an <color=#df840e>area structure</color> and the yield is related to the area of water covered by the structure.

!14l! You are constructing a Hunters Hut, whose hunting scope covers the <color=#df840e>entire map</color>. Hunters go hunting once a month. Note that the hunters cannot cross the river without bridges.
!14m! You are constructing a Chopping House, which is the main facility for producing <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color>.
!14n! You are constructing a Smithy. Iron tools are more durable than stone tools, but stone tools are easier to make.
!14o! You are constructing a Tailor. The primary materials for Tailors come from the <color=#df840e>Hunters Hut</color>, while advanced materials come from pastures and the textile industry.
!14p! Tornado: Destroys all the buildings and trees in its path and carries away the people and animals.
!14q! Snowstorm: Temperature drops to extremely low levels. Requires warm clothes to work outside for long periods of time.
!14r! Fire: Random buildings will catch fire, which will spread to surrounding ones.
!14s! Plague: The disease is spread by contact.
!14t! Plague: The disease is spread by contact.
!14u! The yield from fields increases by 30% in harvest years.
!14v! When drought comes, fish disappear and yields from farmlands, Orchards and water structures decrease.
!14w! Acid rain is coming. Citizens who are exposed to it will lose 10% Health.
!14x! Extreme cold is coming and a large number of wild plants and animals freeze to death.
!14y! The apocalypse has come. You can build a Church to improve the accuracy of prophecies.
!14z! The clouds have been a strange shape lately...
!150! This winter seems to be much colder than usual...
!151! The air has been particularly dry lately...
!152! Everybody seems to have poor immune systems recently...
!153! Everybody seems to have poor immune systems recently...
!15h! Citizens have less time to work when a snowstorm hits. Citizens with less clothes will receive greater impact from the snowstorm.
!15j! {0} ({1}) died of starvation. There is no tombstone for people to mourn over.
!15k! {0} ({1}) died of thirst. There is no tombstone for people to mourn over.
!15l! {0} ({1}) froze to death. There is no tombstone for people to mourn over.
!15m! {0} ({1}) died of an illness. There is no tombstone for people to mourn over.
!15n! {0} ({1}) was missing after being taken away by tornado. There is no tombstone for people to mourn over.
!15o! {0} ({1}) died of old age. There is no tombstone for people to mourn over.
!15w! {0}'s happiness has decreased due to family conflict and unfriendly neighborhoods.
!15x! {0} ({1}) has been murdered. Please increase citizens' happiness.
!15y! The delivery ship has arrived with your order.
!160! It's time for the Great Harvest!
!161! Drought arrived. Crops output plummeted. Fishes died and merchant ships ran aground.
!162! Acid rain has decreased the yield of fields.
!165! {0} reached school age and went to school for study.
!16g! {0} ({1}) has been carried away by the tornado.
!16h! Thank you to the heroes who took part in our first test and gave us so much valuable advice. With your help, our game has been greatly improved! Here is a list of those incredible heroes:

!16j! The difficulty determines the <color=#df840e>available citizens</color> and <color=#df840e>resources on map</color> at the start of the game. Temperature and food production from structures will also drop on higher difficulties.
!16k! Disasters may lead to devastating results, but much of their destruction can be avoided with proper planning.
!16l! Mountains are rich in mineral resources, but may create problems for town planning.
!16m! Lakes are bodies of water surrounded by land. Suitable for water-related development.
!16n! Story Mode: You can experience the rise and fall of the settlement on a preset map by completing tasks when enabled. You can build freely on the map if you disable it.
!16o! Sandbox mode is for players who are already familiar with this game.
!16p! Special Structures: Rubik's Cube and Goof-off Hero will now appear in Blueprint toolbar when enabled.
!16q! Ore is necessary for several industries. They are non-renewable resources.
!16r! Each map size offers a different experience. If you are new to the game we advise that you use the recommended map size.
!16s! Map seeds create random differences in the map's mountains and rivers.
!16t! Vegetation provides primary resources like wood and food. Plants are renewable. Maps with a high vegetation density are more rich in resources.
!16u! River branches increase the water area. Works better with wide rivers.
!16v! Wider rivers mean larger water areas but smaller land areas.
!16w! The climate has an impact on both the citizens and the crops. Cold weather makes the game more difficult.

!16z! Survivors finally found a suitable settlement location through ups and downs. They followed the trade caravan to this land of no man and began a new life. A merchant followed the survivors here and became an important bridge for future trade. After setting up camps, the adventures of the survivors are just beginning.
!17o! Low framerate detected. Click 'Confirm' to lower the graphics quality and increase the framerate.
!17t! Edible crop harvested from the <color=#df840e>Fields</color>. Resilient to coldness . A kind of raw food. The seeds can be obtained through <color=#df840e>trade</color>.
!17u! Goods made from <color=#df840e>Flour</color> and <color=#df840e>Butter</color> at the <color=#df840e>Bread Shop</color>. Filling food, better to prevent hunger.
!17v! Select the <color=#df840e>Dock</color> in <color=#df840e>Storage</color> toolbar and build it on map.
!17w! Food <color=#df840e>collected in the wild</color> or obtained from the <color=#df840e>Gatherers Hut</color>. Directly edible. It's a kind of raw food.
!17x! Potato seeds. Grown in the <color=#df840e>field</color>. Potatoes are hardy and can yield even in cold weather.
!17y! Broccoli seeds. Grown in the <color=#df840e>Field</color>. Fast-maturing but low yield.
!17z! Corn seeds. Grown in the <color=#df840e>Field</color>. High yield.

!193! Can be raised in <color=#df840e>Pastures</color>. Cubs can only be obtained through <color=#df840e>hunting</color>. Double the output during Christmas.
!194! Can be raised in <color=#df840e>Pastures</color>. Cubs can only be obtained through <color=#df840e>hunting</color>.

!19a! Can be raised in <color=#df840e>Corrals</color>. When they grow up, they can provide transportation to some structures.

!19c! Can be raised in <color=#df840e>Pastures</color>. Cubs can only be obtained through <color=#df840e>hunting</color>.
!19d! Food <color=#df840e>collected in the wild</color> or obtained from the <color=#df840e>Gatherers Hut</color>. Directly edible. It's a kind of raw food.
!19e! Saplings grown in the <color=#df840e>Nursery</color>. Can be used for town decoration.
!19f! Vegetables grown in the <color=#df840e>Fields</color>. Directly edible. It's a kind of raw food.

!19h! Vegetables grown in the <color=#df840e>Fields</color>. Directly edible. It's a kind of raw food.

!19l! Vegetables grown in the <color=#df840e>Fields</color>. Directly edible. It's a kind of raw food.
!19n! Common currency. Obtained through <color=#df840e>trade with Factions</color>. Can be used to exchange for items of equal value.
!19o! Used to upgrade the Technology Level. It increases naturally over time and can be produced through buildings such as Schools and Research Academies.
!19p! Obtain the blueprint to unlock the Totem Pole, which can increase the Health of citizens when placed in the town.
!19q! Obtain the blueprint to unlock Fountain, which can slightly increase the happiness for all citizens.
!19r! Obtain the blueprint to unlock Stone Lion, which can slightly relieve the stress for all citizens.
!19s! Obtain the blueprint to unlock Leader Statue.
!19t! Obtain the blueprint to unlock Small Stone Statue and Medium Stone Statue.
!19u! Obtain the blueprint to unlock Skull of a Giant Beast, which can slightly increase the probability of obtaining cubs from hunting.
!19v! Obtain the blueprint to unlock Large Horn, which can slightly improve citizen's movement speed.
!19w! Obtain the blueprint to unlock building Angel, which can slightly increase the citizen's lifespan.
!19x! Obtain the blueprint to unlock Skeleton, which can slightly decrease the citizen's lifespan.
!19y! Obtain the blueprint to unlock Ancient Trees, which can slightly increase the citizen's birth rate.
!19z! Obtain the blueprint to unlock Adult School where uneducated adults can study and get education.
!1a0! Obtain the blueprint to unlock structure Excalibur, which can slightly reduce the citizen's stress.
!1a1! Obtain the blueprint to unlock the Grand Thermae. This structure is a facility for bathing and significantly increases the Health of citizens.
!1a2! Vegetables grown in the <color=#df840e>Fields</color>. Directly edible. It's a kind of raw food.
!1a3! Vegetables grown in the <color=#df840e>Fields</color>. Directly edible. It's a kind of raw food.
!1a4! Food made from <color=#df840e>Flour</color> and <color=#df840e>Eggs</color>at <color=#df840e>Bakery</color>. Filling food, have better fillingness.

!1a5! Food made from <color=#df840e>Cake</color>, <color=#df840e>Fruits</color> and <color=#df840e>Jam</color> at <color=#df840e>Bakery</color>. Filling food, better to prevent hunger and makes citizens happy and relaxed for a period of time.

!1a6! Food made from <color=#df840e>Pie</color>, <color=#df840e>fruits</color> and <color=#df840e>Honey</color> at <color=#df840e>Bakery</color>. Filling food, better to prevent hunger and makes citizens happy and relaxed for a period of time.
!1a7! Within the chapels' range, the citizens' religious needs can be met, thus grant them with <color=#df840e>happiness</color> bonus.
!1a8! Cereals grown in the <color=#df840e>Fields</color> with a higher yield. Directly edible. It's a kind of raw food.
!1a9! You can take part in <color=#df840e>trading affairs</color> at the dock via merchant ships.

!1aa! Medicine made from <color=#df840e>Herbs</color>, <color=#df840e>Honey</color> and <color=#df840e>Leather</color> at the <color=#df840e>Pharmacy</color>. Can <color=#df840e>increase health</color>.
!1ab! Medicine made from <color=#df840e>Herbs</color> and <color=#df840e>Fat</color> at the <color=#df840e>Pharmacy</color>. Can <color=#df840e>increase health</color>.
!1ac! Obtained from the <color=#df840e>Well</color> or the <color=#df840e>Reservoir</color> for citizens to drink daily, grants a <color=#df840e>Health</color> bonus.

!1ad! Medicines made from <color=#df840e>Herbalist hut</color>, <color=#df840e>Herb</color> and <color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color> or <color=#df840e>Linen</color> in <color=#df840e>the Pharmacy</color> which can be used to cure the wounded quickly.

!1ae! Medicines made from <color=#df840e>Bandage</color>, <color=#df840e>Spirits</color> and <color=#df840e>Cotton</color> in <color=#df840e>the Pharmacy</color> which can be used to cure the wounded more quickly.
!1af! Flavored food made from <color=#df840e>fruits</color> at the <color=#df840e>Jam Workshop</color>. It's a kind of simple food.
!1ag! Fruit harvested from the <color=#df840e>Orchard</color>. Trees cannot produce fruit until they have matured. It's a kind of simple food, edible and can be processed into other kinds of food.
!1ah! Fruit harvested from the <color=#df840e>Orchard</color>. Trees cannot produce fruit until they have matured. It's a kind of simple food, edible and can be processed into other kinds of food.

!1an! Fruit harvested from the <color=#df840e>Orchard</color>. Trees cannot produce fruit until they have matured. It's a kind of simple food, edible and can be processed into other kinds of food.

!1ao! Simple Food made from <color=#df840e>Glass Bottles</color>, <color=#df840e>vegetables</color> and <color=#df840e>Salt</color> in the <color=#df840e>Cannery</color>. Cans are more filling than other kinds of food.

!1ap! Food made from <color=#df840e>Biscuits</color>, <color=#df840e>Vegetable Can</color>, or<color=#df840e>Toast</color>, <color=#df840e>Fruit Can</color> or <color=#df840e>Croissant</color> or <color=#df840e>Meat Can</color> in theBakery. With better fillingness and makes citizens happy and release citizen stress for a period of time.
!1aq! Medicinal material gathered by workers in the <color=#df840e>field</color> or <color=#df840e>Gatherers Hut and nursery</color>.
!1ar! Cereals grown in the <color=#df840e>Fields</color>. Directly edible. Can be processed into Flour or Malt at Mill and Watermill. Can be used for brewery. It's a kind of raw food.
!1as! Fuel made from <color=#df840e>Timber</color> at the <color=#df840e>Chopping House</color>. Can be used directly for house heating.
!1at! Fuel produced at the <color=#df840e>Mine</color>. Can be used directly for house heating or processed into Refined Fuel.
!1au! <color=#df840e>Fertilizer</color> processed from <color=#df840e>Dried Dung</color> can be used in crops to increase yield.
!1av! <color=#df840e>Fodder</color> processed from <color=#df840e>Beans</color> and <color=#df840e>Corn</color>. Can be used in Pastures to increase yield.
!1aw! Materials produced by animals in the <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> on a daily basis. Can also be made into Domestic Fuel for heating or Fertilizer for the use in Field.
!1ax! Hay, grown in <color=#df840e>Fields</color>, can be use as the feed for Pasture animals or made into Domestic Fuel.

!1ay! Obtained by <color=#df840e>cutting down trees in the wild</color> or produced at the <color=#df840e>Foresters Hut</color>. Can be made into Domestic Fuel at the Chopping House. One of the most important construction materials.
!1az! Made from <color=#df840e>Timber</color> in the <color=#df840e>Sawmill</color> or <color=#df840e>Water Sawmill</color>. Can be used for structure upgrades.
!1b0! Made from <color=#df840e>Timber</color> at the <color=#df840e>Carving Workshop</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color>.
!1b1! Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>wild deer</color> in the <color=#df840e>Hunters Hut</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher. It's a kind of raw food.

!1b2! Medicine made in <color=#df840e>Pharmacy</color> with<color=#df840e>medicinal powder</color> and <color=#df840e>glass bottles</color>. Hospitals and Barber shops will consume the stock to grant health bonus.
