!1b3! Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>sheep</color> in the <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color> can be processed into Meat Chops at the Butcher or Fancy Food at the BBQ House. It's a raw food.

!1b4! Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>cows</color> or <color=#df840e>cattle</color> in the <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color> can be processed into Meat Chops at the Butcher or Fancy Food at the BBQ House. It's a raw food.

!1b5! Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>chickens</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher. It's a kind of raw food.

!1b6! Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>turkeys</color> in the <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color> can be processed into Meat Chops at the Butcher or Fancy Food at the BBQ House. It's a raw food.

!1b7! Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>geese</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher. It's a kind of raw food.

!1b8! Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>alpaca</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher. It's a kind of raw food.

!1b9! Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>buffaloes</color> in the <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color> can be processed into Meat Chops at the Butcher or Fancy Food at the BBQ House. It's a raw food.
!1ba! Fuel made from <color=#df840e>Timber</color> or <color=#df840e>Coal</color> at <color=#df840e>Fuel Factory</color>. Can be used in Smelters and Pottery Workshops.
!1bb! Simple Food made with <color=#df840e>Glass Bottle</color> and <color=#df840e>fruit</color> and <color=#df840e>Sugar</color> in <color=#df840e>Cannery </color>. Provides more fillingness.

!1bc! Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>ducks</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher. It's a kind of raw food.

!1bd! Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>pigs</color> in the <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color> can be processed into Meat Chops at the Butcher's or Fancy Food at the BBQ house. It's a raw food.
!1be! Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>horses</color> in <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher. It's a kind of raw food.
!1bf! Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>donkeys</color> in <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher. It's a kind of raw food.
!1bg! Food processed from <color=#df840e>various meats</color> at <color=#df840e>Butcher</color>. Can be used to make cured meat at Curing Workshop. It's a kind of raw food.
!1bh! Food made from <color=#df840e>Meat Chop</color> and <color=#df840e>Salt</color> at the <color=#df840e>Curing Workshop</color>. Filling food, better to prevent hunger.

!1bi! Simple Food and material produced by <color=#df840e>chickens</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Cakes at the Bakery. Provides less fillingness as food.

!1bj! Simple Food and material produced by <color=#df840e>cows</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Butter at Butter Workshop. Provides less fillingness as food.
!1bk! Food made with <color=#df840e>beef</color>, and <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color> at the <color=#df840e>BBQ house</color>. Provides better fillingness and slight stress relief.

!1bl! Made by melting <color=#df840e>Sand</color> with <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> at the <color=#df840e>Kiln Factory</color>. Widely used building materials. Can be used to make <color=#df840e>Building Kits</color>.

!1bm! Made by firing <color=#df840e>Clay</color> and <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> at the <color=#df840e>Kiln Factory</color>. Widely used building materials. Can be used to make <color=#df840e>Building Kits</color>.

!1bn! Made by smelting <color=#df840e>Iron Ore</color> and <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> at the <color=#df840e>Smelter</color>. Can be used to make <color=#df840e>Building Kits</color> at Forge or <color=#df840e>Steel tools</color> at Advanced Smithy.

!1bo! Building materials for structure upgrades made from <color=#df840e>Steel</color>, <color=#df840e>Planks</color> and <color=#df840e>Glass</color> or <color=#df840e>Bricks</color> at <color=#df840e>Forge</color>.
!1bp! Building materials made with <color=#df840e>Steel</color> and <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> at the <color=#df840e>Forge</color>.

!1bq! Materials for structure upgrade, made from <color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color> or <color=#df840e>Linen</color> and <color=#df840e>Wool</color> or <color=#df840e>Feathers</color> at the <color=#df840e>Bedding Shop</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color>.

!1br! Building materials for structure upgrades made from <color=#df840e>Timber</color> and <color=#df840e>Leather</color> at the <color=#df840e>Furniture Factory</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color>.
!1bs! Food made with <color=#df840e>pork</color>, and <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color> at the <color=#df840e>BBQ house</color>. Provide better fillingness and slight stress relief.

!1bt! Building materials for structure upgrades made with <color=#df840e>Clay</color> and a <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> at the <color=#df840e>Pottery Workshop</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color>.

!1bu! <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color> made with <color=#df840e>Clay</color>, <color=#df840e>Sand</color> and a <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> at the <color=#df840e>Pottery Workshop</color>.

!1bv! Advanced building material for structure upgrades made with <color=#df840e>silver ore</color> and a <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> at the <color=#df840e>Pottery Workshop</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color>.

!1bw! Advanced material for structure upgrade, made from <color=#df840e>silk</color> and <color=#df840e>Wool</color> or <color=#df840e>Feathers</color> at the <color=#df840e>Bedding Factory</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color>.

!1bx! Advanced building materials for structure upgrades made from <color=#df840e>Planks</color> and <color=#df840e>Refined Leather</color> or <color=#df840e>Seal Fur</color> at the <color=#df840e>Luxury Furniture Factory</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color>.

!1by! Can be used to upgrade the <color=#df840e>Churches</color> and increase its service scope. Can obtain through trade, and also can be produced by <color=#df840e>Advanced Smithy</color> after unlocking related Technology.

!1bz! Can upgrade <color=#df840e>Field</color>, <color=#df840e>Orchard</color> and<color=#df840e>Forest Farm</color> to increase output. Can obtain through trade, and also can be produced by <color=#df840e>Knitting Workshop</color> after unlocking related Technology.

!1c0! Remodel materials for <color=#df840e>Luxury House</color>, <color=#df840e>Luxury Apartment</color>, <color=#df840e>Garden Villa</color> or <color=#df840e>Great Castle</color>. Residence with washroom <color=#df840e> no longer produce dry feces</color>, while the residents health will not be improved. Obtain through trade only.
!1c1! Can upgrade some buildings to increase their work efficiency. Can obtain through trade, and also can be produced by <color=#df840e>Advanced Smithy</color> after unlocking related Technology.
!1c2! A cute cat can release citizens' stress. Can be used to remodel <color=#df840e>various houses</color>, obtain through trade only.
!1c3! Fancy food made with <color=#df840e>Pork</color> and <color=#df840e>Salt</color> at <color=#df840e>BBQ House</color>. Filling food, have better fillingness.
!1c4! Fancy food made with <color=#df840e>Buffalo Meat</color> and <color=#df840e>Salt</color> at the <color=#df840e>BBQ House</color>. Filling food, have better fillingness.
!1c5! Food made with <color=#df840e>Meat chop</color> and <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color> at the <color=#df840e>BBQ house</color>. Provide better fillingness and slight stress relief.
!1c6! Building materials made from <color=#df840e>Glass Bottles</color> and <color=#df840e>Lamp Oil</color> at the <color=#df840e>Lighting Factory</color>. Commonly used in services of worship.
!1c7! Fancy food made with <color=#df840e>Beef</color> and <color=#df840e>Butter</color> at the <color=#df840e>BBQ House</color>. Provide better fillingness and slight stress relief.
!1c8! Food obtained from the <color=#df840e>Fishing Port</color> can be processed into Fancy Food at the <color=#df840e>BBQ House</color>. It's a raw food.
!1c9! Fancy food made with <color=#df840e>Turkey</color> and <color=#df840e>Butter</color> at the <color=#df840e>BBQ House</color>. Provide better fillingness and slight stress relief.

!1ca! Fancy food made from <color=#df840e>Baked lobster</color> or <color=#df840e>Rack of Lamb</color> and <color=#df840e>Veggie salad</color> at the <color=#df840e>Gourmet Shop</color>. Filling food, have better fillingness and can <color=#df840e>ease citizens' stress</color> for a period of time.

!1cb! Fancy food made from <color=#df840e>Beer</color> and <color=#df840e>Turkey</color> or <color=#df840e>Steak</color> at the <color=#df840e>Gourmet Shop</color>. Filling food,have better fillingness and can <color=#df840e>ease citizens' stress</color> for a period of time.

!1cc! Fancy food made from <color=#df840e>Coffee</color> and <color=#df840e>Ham</color> or <color=#df840e>Buffalo jerky</color> at the <color=#df840e>Gourmet Shop</color>. Filling food, have better fillingness.
!1cd! Raw materials gathered from fallen hives at the <color=#df840e>Apiary</color>. Can be used in the Soap Workshop and Lighting Factory.
!1ce! Material collected by the <color=#df840e>waterside</color> or harvested from <color=#df840e>Reed Field</color>. Can be made into ropes at the Knitting Workshop or paper at the Paper Mill.
!1cf! Grown in the <color=#df840e>Nursery</color> . Used at the <color=#df840e>brewery</color>. The seeds can be obtained through <color=#df840e>gathering</color>.
!1cg! Made from <color=#df840e>sand</color> at the <color=#df840e>kiln factory</color>. Widely used.

!1ch! Raw materials obtain from <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color> by slaughtering <color=#df840e>large animals</color>. Can be made into Soap at the <color=#df840e>Soap Workshop</color> and can be made into Lamp Oil at the <color=#df840e>Lighting Factory</color>.

!1ci! Collected from the <color=#df840e>Fishing Port</color>. Can be made into lamp oil at the <color=#df840e>lighting factory</color> and can be made into soap at the <color=#df840e>soap workshop</color>
!1cj! Collected from the <color=#df840e>sandpit</color>. Can be made into glass or Glass Bottles at the <color=#df840e>kiln factory</color> or panned for gold sand.
!1ck! Fancy food made from <color=#df840e>Mutton</color> and <color=#df840e>Butter</color> in the <color=#df840e>BBQ House</color> can better satisfy hunger and slightly relieve citizens' stress.
!1cl! Made from <color=#df840e>Timber</color> or <color=#df840e>reeds</color> at the <color=#df840e>paper mill</color>. Improves the efficiency of technology research.
!1cm! Grown in the <color=#df840e>field</color>. <color=#df840e>Inedible</color>. Used as a raw material for the sugar refinery. The seeds can be obtained through <color=#df840e>trade</color>.
!1cn! Grown in the <color=#df840e>field</color>. <color=#df840e>Inedible</color>. Used as a raw material for the sugar refinery. The seeds can be obtained through <color=#df840e>trade</color>.
!1co! Harvested from <color=#df840e>maple trees</color> grown in the <color=#df840e>Orchard</color>. Can be refined into sugar at the sugar refinery.
!1cp! Made from <color=#df840e>coal</color> at the <color=#df840e>printing workshop</color>. Can be used to print books.
!1cq! Made from <color=#df840e>paper</color> and <color=#df840e>ink</color> at the <color=#df840e>printing workshop</color>. Significantly improves the efficiency of technology research.

!1cs! Cereals grown in the <color=#df840e>fields</color>. Directly edible. Can be processed into flour at the mill or malt at the watermill. It's a kind of raw food. The seeds can be obtained through <color=#df840e>gathering</color>.
!1ct! Collected in the wild or from a <color=#df840e>Quarry</color>. Widely used material.
!1cu! Made from <color=#df840e>stone</color> at the <color=#df840e>masonry workshop</color>. Can be used to construct or pave roads.
!1cv! Made from <color=#df840e>stone</color> at the <color=#df840e>jade house</color>. Can be used to create jade statues or pave roads.
!1cw! Carved from <color=#df840e>jade</color> at the <color=#df840e>Carving Workshop</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color> with an extremely high value.
!1cx! Made at the <color=#df840e>fishing dock</color>. Can be processed into salted fish. It's a kind of raw food.
!1cy! Processed from <color=#df840e>fish</color> and <color=#df840e>salt</color> at the <color=#df840e>curing workshop</color>. More filling.
!1cz! Beans grown in the <color=#df840e>fields</color>. Directly edible. It's a kind of raw food. Higher yield than vegetables.
!1d0! Beans grown in the <color=#df840e>fields</color>. Directly edible. It's a kind of raw food. High yield.
!1d1! Beans grown in the <color=#df840e>fields</color>. Directly edible. It's a kind of raw food.
!1d2! Cereals grown in the <color=#df840e>fields</color>. Directly edible. It's a kind of raw food.

!1d3! Clothes made from <color=#df840e>Linen</color>,<color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color>,<color=#df840e>Wool</color>,<color=#df840e>alpaca Wool</color> or<color=#df840e>Leather</color>. Keeps citizens warm.

!1d4! Made from <color=#df840e>linen</color>,<color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color> or <color=#df840e>Leather</color> and <color=#df840e>Feathers</color>,<color=#df840e>Wool</color> or <color=#df840e>alpaca Wool</color>. Warmer than rough clothes.

!1d5! Made from <color=#df840e>silk</color>,<color=#df840e>seal fur</color> or <color=#df840e>Refined Leather</color> and <color=#df840e>Feathers</color>,<color=#df840e>Wool</color> or <color=#df840e>alpaca Wool</color>. Warmer than a down jacket and makes citizens happier.
!1d6! Made from <color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color> at the <color=#df840e>Tailor</color>. Increases citizens' ability to store items. Wears out over time and requires periodical replacement.

!1d7! Craftable at the <color=#df840e>Knitting Workshop</color> using <color=#df840e>reeds</color>. Increases the movement speed of citizens, but will gradually wear out and needs to be replaced regularly. Slightly reduces the probability of ankle sprains and fractures.

!1d8! Craftable at <color=#df840e> Leatherware Hut </color> using <color=#df840e> Leather </color>. Increases citizens' movement speed, but will gradually wear out and needed to be replaced regularly. Reduce the chance of citizens suffering from ankle sprains and fractures.

!1d9! Craftable at the <color=#df840e> Leatherware Hut </color> using <color=#df840e> Refined Leather </color> or <color=#df840e>Seal Fur </color>. Increases citizens' movement speed, but will gradually wear out and needs to be replaced regularly. Greatly reduce the chance of citizens suffering from ankle sprains and fractures.
!1da! The tool consume <color=#df840e>reeds</color> in <color=#df840e>the weaving huts</color> to add weight to the population and will gradually wear out and need to be replaced regularly.
!1db! Made from <color=#df840e>Plank and Steel</color> in <color=#df840e>the Smithy</color> to add carry weight to the citizen but will gradually wear out and need to be replaced regularly.
!1dc! Collected in the wild or collected from a <color=#df840e>Mine</color>. Widely used material.
!1dd! Valuable ore collected from a <color=#df840e>Mine</color>. Can be made into coins or Silver Cutlery.
!1de! High-value ore panned from <color=#df840e>Sand</color> at the <color=#df840e>Gold Miner's Cabin</color>. Can be used to make statues or pave roads.
!1df! Made from <color=#df840e>Gold Sand</color> at the <color=#df840e>Carving Workshop</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color> with an extremely high value.
!1dg! Made from <color=#df840e>Iron Ore</color> at the <color=#df840e>Carving Workshop</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color> with reasonable value.
!1dh! Gathered at the <color=#df840e>Apiary</color> from fallen hives. Can be processed into other food.

!1di! Flavoring made from <color=#df840e>Sugar Beets</color>,<color=#df840e>Sugar Cane</color>,<color=#df840e>Maple Sap</color> or <color=#df840e>Malt</color> at the <color=#df840e>Sugar Workshop</color>. Used in food production.
!1dj! Flavoring produced at <color=#df840e>Saltworks</color>. Can be used in textiles and food production.
!1dk! Fancy food made from <color=#df840e>Lobsters</color> and <color=#df840e>Butter</color> in the <color=#df840e>BBQ House</color> can better satisfy hunger and slightly relieve citizens' stress.
!1dl! Collected from the <color=#df840e>sandpit</color>. Can be made into bricks at the <color=#df840e>Kiln Factory</color> or pottery at the <color=#df840e>pottery workshop</color>.
!1dm! Made from <color=#df840e>Sugar</color> and <color=#df840e>honey</color> at the <color=#df840e>Candy Workshop</color>. Provides<color=#df840e> happiness</color> bonus.
!1dn! A tool that is made by using <color=#df840e>Stone</color> and <color=#df840e>Wood</color> at the <color=#df840e>Smithy</color>. Increases Citizen's Productivity, but is not very durable.
!1do! Made from <color=#df840e>Iron Ore</color> and <color=#df840e>Timber</color> at <color=#df840e>Smithy</color>. Able to increase work efficiency.

!1dp! Soaps that made from <color=#df840e>Fats</color>, <color=#df840e>Beeswax</color> or <color=#df840e>Blubber</color> in the <color=#df840e>Soap Workshop</color>; can be used to bathe citizens in the Bathhouse to increase their Health.
!1dq! Made from <color=#df840e>Fat</color>, <color=#df840e>blubber</color> or <color=#df840e>beeswax</color> at the <color=#df840e>soap workshop</color>.
!1dr! Made from <color=#df840e>Fat</color> or <color=#df840e>Blubber</color> at the <color=#df840e>Lighting Factory</color>. Can be made into Lanterns.
!1ds! Made from <color=#df840e>Milk</color> at the <color=#df840e>Butter Workshop</color>. Products are prerequisite materials for the Bakery and the Gourmet Shop.
!1dt! A kind of widely used materials that made from <color=#df840e>Flax</color> or <color=#df840e>Reed</color> at <color=#df840e>Knitting Workshop</color>. Can be made into Fishing Nets.
!1du! Made from <color=#df840e>Ropes</color> at <color=#df840e>Knitting Workshops</color>. Can be used in Fishing Dock and Fishing Port.
!1dv! Made from <color=#df840e>Steel</color> and <color=#df840e>Wood</color> at <color=#df840e>Advanced Smithy</color>. More durable.
!1dw! Made from <color=#df840e>Steel Tools</color>, <color=#df840e>Leather</color> and <color=#df840e>Ropes</color> at <color=#df840e>Forge</color>. More durable.

!1dx! Fancy food made from <color=#df840e>Cocoa Beans</color>,<color=#df840e>Water</color> and <color=#df840e>sugar</color> at the <color=#df840e>Candy Workshop</color>. Can <color=#df840e>increase citizens' happiness</color>.
!1dy! Made at the <color=#df840e>Forge</color>. Can increase the <color=#df840e>production efficiency</color> of some production buildings.
!1dz! Produced in Advanced Smithy, can increase the probability of obtaining Cubs from hunting.
!1e0! Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>rat</color> in <color=#df840e>Hunters Hut</color>. Can be processed into roast rat meat at the BBQ house. Harmful to health if eaten directly.
!1e1! Food made with <color=#df840e>rat meat</color> and <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color> at the <color=#df840e>BBQ house</color>. No harm to health.
!1e2! Made from <color=#df840e>Dried Dung</color> in the <color=#df840e>Compost Plant</color>. Can boost the yield of farmland and tree farm.
!1e4! Made from <color=#df840e>Wheat</color> or <color=#df840e>Oats</color> at the <color=#df840e>Mill</color> or <color=#df840e>Water Mill</color>. Can be used in fermentation or Sugar Refining.

!1e5! Obtained by slaughtering animals in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Hunters Hut</color>. Can be made into clothing at the Tailor, or Refined Leather at the <color=#df840e>Leatherware Hut</color>.
!1e6! Textile materials collected from <color=#df840e>sheep</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color>. Can be made into clothing at the Tailor.
!1e7! Textile materials collected from <color=#df840e>Ducks</color> or <color=#df840e>geese</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color>. Can be made into clothing at the Advanced Tailor.
!1e8! Textile materials collected from <color=#df840e>alpacas</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color>. Can be made into clothing at the Tailor.

!1e9! Textile materials which can be planted in the <color=#df840e>Field</color>. Can be made into Linen at the Textile Mill, or Ropes at the Knitting Workshop. The seeds can be obtained through <color=#df840e>gathering</color>.
!1ea! Textile raw materials which can be planted in <color=#df840e>Field</color>. Can be made into Cotton Cloth at the Textile Mill.
!1eb! Widely used textile materials made from <color=#df840e>Flax</color> at <color=#df840e>Textile Mill</color>.
!1ec! Widely used textile materials made from <color=#df840e>cotton</color> at <color=#df840e>Textile Mill</color>.
!1ed! Textile materials made from <color=#df840e>Leather</color> and <color=#df840e>Salt</color> at the <color=#df840e>Leather Shop</color>.
!1ee! Special <color=#df840e>Mulberry Leaves</color> grown in the <color=#df840e>Orchard</color>. Necessary for raising silkworms.
!1ef! Cloth made from <color=#df840e>Silkworm Cocoons</color> at <color=#df840e>Textile Mill</color> or <color=#df840e>Textile Water Mill</color>. Valuable textile materials.
!1eg! Textile materials produced by silkworms consuming <color=#df840e>Mulberry Leaves</color> at the <color=#df840e>Silkworm Shed</color>. Necessary materials for making silk.
!1eh! Rare textile materials from the <color=#df840e>Fishing Port</color>.
!1ei! Refined from <color=#df840e>wheat</color> or <color=#df840e>oats</color> at the <color=#df840e>mill</color> or <color=#df840e>watermill</color>. Necessary for making bread.
!1ej! Magical items obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>idle chickens</color> in the <color=#df840e>pasture</color>. Their use is unclear.
!1ek! Can be planted in the <color=#df840e>Orchard</color> and processed into <color=#df840e>drinks</color>. The seeds can be obtained through <color=#df840e>trade</color>.
!1el! Can be planted in the <color=#df840e>Nursery</color> and suitable for <color=#df840e>Trade</color>. The seeds can be obtained through <color=#df840e>trade</color>.
!1em! Can be planted in the <color=#df840e>Nursery</color> and processed into <color=#df840e>drinks</color>. The seeds can be obtained through <color=#df840e>trade</color>.
!1en! Can be planted in the <color=#df840e>Nursery</color> and processed into <color=#df840e>drinks</color>. The seeds can be obtained through <color=#df840e>trade</color>.
!1eo! Made from <color=#df840e>Gold Sand</color>, <color=#df840e>Jade</color> or <color=#df840e>Silver Ore</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color> with a high value.
!1ep! A beverage made from <color=#df840e>Coffee Beans</color> and <color=#df840e>Water</color> at the <color=#df840e>Tea Shop</color>; grants <color=#df840e>Health</color> bonus.

!1eq! Drinks made from <color=#df840e>Cocoa Beans</color>, <color=#df840e>Water</color>, and <color=#df840e>Glass Bottles</color> in the <color=#df840e>Tea Shop</color> can increase citizens' <color=#df840e>Health</color> and <color=#df840e>relieve their stress</color>.

!1er! Drinks made from <color=#df840e>Tea</color> and <color=#df840e>Water</color> in the <color=#df840e>Tea Shop</color> can increase citizens' <color=#df840e>Health</color> and <color=#df840e>relieve their stress</color>.
!1es! Food processed from <color=#df840e>Flour</color> and <color=#df840e>Jam</color> at <color=#df840e>Bakery</color>. Filling food, better to prevent hunger.

!1et! Beverages made from <color=#df840e>Wheat</color> or <color=#df840e>Oats</color> and <color=#df840e>Water</color> in the <color=#df840e>Winery</color> can increase citizens' <color=#df840e>Health</color>.

!1eu! A spirit made from <color=#df840e>Agave </color> or <color=#df840e>Potatoes </color>at <color=#df840e>Distillery </color>. Can make citizens <color=#df840e>happy</color>. Slightly increase warmth but reduce movement speed of citizens.

!1ev! Medical Soaps, made from <color=#df840e>Medicinal Powder</color>, <color=#df840e>Fats</color>, <color=#df840e>Beeswax</color> or <color=#df840e>Blubber</color> in the <color=#df840e>Soap Workshop</color>; can be used to bathe citizens in the Bathhouse to increase their Health.

!1ew! A beverage that is made from <color=#df840e>Malt</color>, <color=#df840e>Water</color>at the <color=#df840e>Winery</color>; can <color=#df840e>relieve citizens' stress</color> for a period of time, and grant a <color=#df840e>Health</color> bonus.

!1ex! A beverage produced in the <color=#df840e>Winery</color> by consuming <color=#df840e>Agave</color>, <color=#df840e>Water</color> and <color=#df840e>Glass Bottles</color>; can <color=#df840e>relieve citizens' stress</color> and grant a <color=#df840e>Health</color> bonus.

!1ey! Fine clothing made from <color=#df840e>Silk</color>, <color=#df840e>Refined Leather</color> or <color=#df840e>Seal Fur</color> and <color=#df840e>Feathers</color>,<color=#df840e>Wool</color> or <color=#df840e>Alpaca Wool</color> at the <color=#df840e>Clothing Factory</color>. Warmer than <color=#df840e>Luxury Coats</color>.

!1ez! First-class luxuries made from <color=#df840e>Silk</color>, <color=#df840e>Refined Leather</color> or <color=#df840e>Seal Fur</color> and <color=#df840e>Jewelry</color> at the <color=#df840e>Clothing Factory</color>. Much warmer than <color=#df840e>Gowns</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color> with a high value.
!1f0! Luxuries made from <color=#df840e>Refined Leather</color> at the <color=#df840e>Leatherware Hut</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color> with a good value.

!1f1! Food processed from <color=#df840e>Flour</color> and <color=#df840e>Sugar</color> at the <color=#df840e>Bread Shop</color>. Filling food to prevent hunger. Can only build <color=#df840e>Mills</color> after unlocking the technology.

!1i9! A beverage produced in the <color=#df840e>Winery</color> by consuming <color=#df840e>Grapes</color>, <color=#df840e>Water</color>, and <color=#df840e>Glass Bottles</color>; can <color=#df840e>relieve citizens' stress</color> for a period of time, and grant a <color=#df840e>Health</color> bonus.
!1mb! Smaller number, higher priority. Citizens use prioritized items first.
!1o5! Slow down time when disasters strike
!1pv! Watching a play in the theater...
!1q1! Fetching water to put out the fire...

!1q4! This game is a <color=#df840e>simulation building survival game</color>, you not only need to <color=#df840e>develop your town</color>, but also need to <color=#df840e>maintain the survival of the citizens</color>. If the basic survival needs are not met, the citizens will <color=#df840e>die</color>, and maintaining survival under high difficulty will be a major problem in the early stage. Even after the development and expansion of the town, it is easy to face severe survival problems due to disasters or population growth. We believe that after multiple death retries, you will be able to find a way to lead the survivors to survive and develop. If you feel difficult, you can choose to start a new game and reduce the difficulty of the game.
Before officially starting the game, you need to know how to view the data of each area and town on the map. Press <color=#df840e>M</color> to open the <color=#df840e>mini map</color>, view the basic information of the map, and see the random seed of the map.
Press <color=#df840e>I</color> to open the Town Details. Here you can view the number of all <color=#df840e>professions</color> and <color=#df840e>buildings</color>, and you can click the button to go to a column to <color=#df840e>locate</color> directly, and multiple clicks will switch among multiple citizens or buildings. The details also include the production, use and inventory of various materials to help you check whether the <color=#df840e>supply</color> of materials meets the demand. In the inventory, you can also set the <color=#df840e>priority</color> of items. The smaller number means the higher priority. You can ban the items if you want them only used for production instead of consumption. In addition, population change curves and unlocked seeds, animals, and blueprints can be checked here.
The most important thing in the game is to ensure the <color=#df840e>happy life of citizens</color>.
The most urgent task in the early stage is to <color=#df840e>satisfy the survival needs of citizens</color>. You need to ensure there are enough <color=#df840e>food, drinking water, housing and heating</color>, otherwise it will be difficult to survive in the harsh environment. You can check the more detailed elaboration on basic survial methods in <color=#df840e>Help - Survival</color>. After having basic living materials, we must pay attention to <color=#df840e>the happiness and health</color> of the citizens, develop <color=#df840e>industries</color> to improve the livability, and increase the <color=#df840e>population</color>. You will also need to pay attention to the stress of citizens if you want to increase the population. Higher happiness and health, and more available houses can encourage the citizens to have children. For more information, please check the <color=#df840e>Help - Citizen Stress and Fertility Rate</color>. Citizens need hospitals to treat illnesses and need Herbs and Soaps to maintain their health. Note that long-term consumption of raw foods can reduce health. Churches can effectively prevent citizens from committing crimes, but higher happiness requires wine, sweets, and high-quality food. In <color=#df840e>Help - Citizens' Happiness</color> and <color=#df840e>Help - Citizens' Health</color>, the reasons for the reduction and improvement of happiness and health will be introduced in details. After the population grows, you can choose the administrator, and talented managers can bring many benefits to your town. When the development of science and technology is slow, education needs to be developed to accelerate the acquisition of technology points. You can choose the industrial chain based on your existing materials and obtain the missing parts through trade. For more information about advanced development, you can check <color=#df840e>Help - Town Development</color>.

!1q5! Output of Fishing Dock that covers the fishing point increased by 100%. Multiple fishing point won't bring more buff to the same strcture. Fishes will disappear when drought hits the town, and will recover after rainstorm and flood.

!1q6! After selecting a building, by default you can use the R key to rotate the building, and then click on the ground to confirm placement. You can use the F key to change the appearance of some of the buildings.
!1q7! You can drag the cursor to specify the size of the structures when you are building Field, Pasture and roads. However, there is a maximum size that cannot be surpassed.

!1q8! Once a structure is built, you can click on it to assign workers or to check for more information including the output statistics for each year. There is a highlighted area surrounding certain structures when you click on them. The output will usually drop if there is overlapped part in the highlighted areas of the same structure.
!1q9! Know well about your citizens. You can check what problems are bothering them when you can see some prompt icons on the left. You can click it for details.
!1qa! Click any citizen to view his/her detailed information, including the Health, Happiness, Stamina, Inventory, Education, Profession, Current Tasks and other info.

!1qb! You need to always pay attention to the state of the citizens. When they have <color=#df840e>no stamina</color> or <color=#df840e>are thirsty</color>, they will go home to eat and drink, and when it is cold, they will look for a warm house nearby for <color=#df840e>heating</color>. The initial living resources can be obtained by <color=#df840e>Command (hotkey: 0) - Collect All</color>, and the trees, ore and wild vegetables on the ground can be obtained by collecting. Trees, plants and animals in the wild will have new births but ore that has been mined will no longer appear.

!1qc! Homeless citizens <color=#df840e>recover physical stamina slower</color> and work inefficiently. Residents with house can quickly regain their stamina and replenish hunger and thirst. After a period of time, citizens will move into a new home closer to their workplaces. Making sure that there are sufficient laborers available can make home relocation faster. The citizens in the house form a family, and children will be born in the family. When the children reach adulthood, they need to move to a new house to form a new family. If you want to <color=#df840e>increase the population</color>, it is best to <color=#df840e>provide new houses</color> for adult children.

!1qd! There are many ways to obtain food, including gathering and hunting, which can provide <color=#df840e>opportunities to acquire seeds and cubs</color> as well as other food sources.
<color=#df840e>Gathering</color> is a method of obtaining food where you can collect wild plants and have the opportunity to acquire some <color=#df840e>seeds</color>. Gathers in the Gatherers Hut will collect wild plants within the building’s range.
<color=#df840e>Hunting</color> is a method of obtaining meat and other animal by-products, such as Leather, and also provides the opportunity to obtain animal <color=#df840e>cubs</color>. The hunting range of hunters is the whole map, but animals nearby will be prioritized. Note that hunters cannot hunt animals across lands without bridges.
<color=#df840e>Agriculture</color>: You can arrange planting once you obtain seeds. Most crops are edible, and there are differences in yield and cold resistance between different crops. Crops should be <color=#df840e>planted during the proper season and temperature</color>, and they need to ripen before workers can harvest them. You can also manually harvest crops that are not fully mature, but this will reduce the yield. Late or slow sowing may result in incomplete planting, causing crops to mature later. Crops that are <color=#df840e>not harvested in winter are likely to die</color>. To ensure smooth planting and harvesting, sufficient manpower must be allocated to the farmland. However, if farmers in a certain field can already handle all the work and harvest all the crops before winter, assigning more workers would be unnecessary. During the slack season, farmers can assist laborers with transporting and gathering work without having to lay them off.
<color=#df840e>Animal husbandry</color>: Raising livestock in the Pasture requires acquiring animal cubs, which can be obtained through <color=#df840e>hunting and trading</color>. Even one animal in a pasture can multiply, but the reproduction speed slows down when the number of animals is low. Note that animals have a certain lifespan, and if they are not kept in the pasture for a long time after being captured, they will die. The output of the pasture depends on what animals are raised there. Products such as Eggs and Dried Dung are <color=#df840e>produced daily</color>, while Meat and Leather are obtained by <color=#df840e>slaughtering animals</color>. The number of animals kept alive in the pasture can be set manually. When the total amount of animals exceeds the set number, the extra will be slaughtered. If all animals in a pasture are slaughtered, then the raising process will be stopped.
<color=#df840e>Fishery</color>: The output of the Fishing Dock is affected by the Fishing Point buff and the size of the water area, and the output will decrease when the effect ranges of multiple Fishing Docks are overlapped. In contrast, the Fish Pond has a more stable output.
<color=#df840e>Orchard</color>: Fruits are not only a source of food, but they can also be used as materials to produce Fancy Food. However, it takes years for fruits to ripen.

!1qe! Water is an important resource for survival. Wells, Large Wells, and Reservoirs (unlocked through tech) are able to produce a large amount of water. When a <color=#df840e>fire</color> happens, Citizens will get water from Wells and Large Wells in order to put out the fire, so please make sure there are enough wells.

!1qf! When the game starts, examine the map and terrain so you can form the best strategy.
All the hotkeys below are all default, you can change your preferences at any time in Settings.

!1qg! Citizens will go to their warm houses when feeling cold, but they can <color=#df840e>freeze to death</color> if there is no sufficient fuel to heat houses. Fuel can be obtained from the <color=#df840e>Chopping House</color> by processing <color=#df840e>Timber or Dried Dung</color> or through exploiting <color=#df840e>Coal</color> after unlocking the Technology Mining. The <color=#df840e>Boiler Room</color> provides heating for houses within its effect range, significantly saving fuel. Note that citizens often need to get warm in cold weather, and accidents can easily occur if they are sent to work far away from home.

!1qh! Clothes enable citizens to <color=#df840e>work outdoors for extended periods</color>. To create basic attire such as <color=#df840e>Rough Clothes</color>, you’ll need to gather necessary materials to make some in the <color=#df840e>Tailor</color>. These materials can be obtained through gathering, hunting, or trading. Once you’ve acquired seeds and animal cubs, you can ensure a steady supply of these materials. Upgrading the Tailor allows for the production of a wider variety of clothing. However, this will also require advancements in technology and industry for support.
!1qi! <color=#df840e>Tools have a great boost on work efficiency</color>. They can be made in Smithy, and Forge can also make advanced Tool Kits.

!1qj! If all warehouses are full and there is no place to store the output materials, production will stall. In this case, <color=#df840e>open-air warehouses should be built as soon as possible</color> to allow temporary storage of materials so that production work can continue and higher-level warehouses can be built. The location of the warehouse is very important to production and life. Materials will be placed in the nearest warehouse. <color=#df840e>If the warehouse is too far away, the efficiency will be greatly reduced</color>. Low-level warehouses have limited capacity, and warehouses with large capacity will be needed to develop the processing industry.

!1qk! Roads can increase the movement <color=#df840e>speed</color> of citizens, which is <color=#df840e>of great help</color> to production and transportation. Advanced roads will increase the movement speed quite a bit.
!1ql! When Health is low, citizens are susceptible to disease, greatly reducing their work efficiency. The plague will break out, which is widely contagious and causing mass deaths.

!1qm! <color=#df840e>Tool quality:</color>Provide citizens with properly crafted tools to prevent possible accidents.Betters tools means a higher health bonus. <color=#df840e>Logistic equipment:</color>Provide citizens with properly crafted logistic equipments to prevent possible accidents.Betters tools means a higher health bonus. <color=#df840e>Drinks:</color>Provide citizens with properly crafted tools to prevent possible plague outbreaks.Betters sources of drinks means a higher health bonus. <color=#df840e>Medicare:</color>Build medical facilities to cure sicks,facilities consume household products to provide a higher health bonus. <color=#df840e>Sanitation</color>;Build sanitation facilities to maintain hygeinic condions,facilities consume household products to provide a higher health bonus. <color=#df840e>Waste disposal</color>;Build public toilets for safe disposal of human wastes,facilities consume household products to provide a higher health bonus. <color=#df840e>Not-yet-Known:</color>You can meet certain conditions to provide health bonus, try find them out! Tips: Higher health value means lower stamina consumption and longer citizen working shifts.
!1qn! When Happiness value is low, the food consumption is sped up, and the crimes may occur when happiness value of citizens is too low.

!1qo! <color=#df840e>Garments:</color> Provide citizens with garments to keep them properly dressed. Better garments provide better Happiness bonuses. <color=#df840e>Shoes:</color> Provide citizens with shoes to prevent movement injuries. Better shoes provide better Happiness bonuses. <color=#df840e>Food Ration:</color> Provide citizens with food to keep them strong and able to work. Better foods provide better Happiness bonuses. <color=#df840e>Religion:</color> Build religion structures to provide services for citizens. Better Happiness bonuses with household goods consumed. <color=#df840e>Entertainment:</color> Build pleasure structures to provide entertainment in town. The consumption of household goods can bring better Happiness bonuses. <color=#df840e>Proper Burial:</color> Building Cemeteries allows citizens to mourn the dead and provides Happiness bonuses. <color=#df840e>Hidden Access:</color> Hidden conditions met could provide extra Health bonuses.

!1qp! Citizen stress is directly related to population growth, <color=#df840e>high stress</color> leads to lower fertility.
<color=#df840e>Total number of Population</color> affects citizen's stress. Improving <color=#df840e>Health</color> and <color=#df840e>Happiness</color>, providing <color=#df840e>Fancy Food</color> for citizens can significantly reduce their stress. Premium housing greatly helps to reduce the stress on citizens. Also, the abilities of administrators, technologies, structures, structure remodeling and Blueprints can contribute to reducing citizens' stress.
You need to adjust the stress of citizens, control the population and pay attention to <color=#df840e>the age structure</color> of the town population. For example, a baby boom can bring in a large workforce in adulthood but it can also cause aging when they get old.

!1qq! Use <color=#df840e>W, A, S, D</color> to move the screen up, left, down, and right. You can also move the mouse cursor to the edge of the screen to move the camera. You can turn off screen edge movement by switching to windowed mode, or by turning the screen movement speed to 0.

!1qr! You can choose your own development route based on existing resources, such as animal husbandry, farmland, fishery etc. You can choose to fully develop various industries to be self-sufficient or you can obtain the materials you lack through trade. If you feel technology is developing slowly, a large number of research institutes or research institutes can be helpful, paper and books can also greatly increse the Tech EXP.

!1qs! Earn <color=#df840e>Silver Coins</color> and <color=#df840e>Reputation</color> by selling and buying goods with other factions at <color=#df840e>Trading Posts</color> using Silver Coins or bartering, unlocking new structures and recipes as your Reputation Level increases. At the <color=#df840e>Dock</color>, you can buy goods from the regularly arriving Merchant Ship using <color=#df840e>Silver Coins</color> or <color=#df840e>bartering</color>. The arrival of the Merchant Ship is shown in the upper right timeline. When the Merchant Ship icon disappears in the timeline, it will show up in your town. You can <color=#df840e>place orders</color> for designated goods but the <color=#df840e>price will be higher</color> and <color=#df840e>only Silver Coins are available</color>.

!1qt! <color=#df840e>When the population grows to a certain level</color>, there will be talented people who you can choose to be the administrator of the town when you have the <color=#df840e>Town Hall</color>. More administrators can be hired as the town grows, with up to 10 administrators to help the town's development after building faction building Great Temple.

!1qu! Your town can <color=#df840e>take in immigrants to increase population</color> with the <color=#df840e>town hall</color>. Immigrants will visit from time to time, you can see the icon on the timeline in the upper right corner of the page. When the icon disappears, the immigrant enters the map and heads to your town. If you want to control the population, you can choose not accept immigrants.
!1qv! Even tiny events could become disasters that set back the town's growth, but much of their destruction can be avoided with proper planning.

!1qw! Occasionally, there might be harvest years where the temperature is particularly suitable and the yield of all crops will be boosted. Stresss on the food supply can be relieved significantly in these circumstances.

!1qx! Crops will be affected by temperature, so they will be killed by the coldness in winter if they haven't been harvested. To counter this, you can harvest the crops in advance, or stock enough food to avoid food shortage.

!1qy! When a snowstorm comes, it will become extremely cold outside. Settlers without proper clothes will have to stay indoors to keep warm, preventing them to go out and work. High quality clothes allow them to work longer under such conditions. When it is cold, if there is not enough fuel for heating, settlers are likely to freeze to death. High quality housing consumes less fuel and ensures that the house is kept warm.

!1qz! When the average Health of all citizens is low, the plague may break out, which is widely contagious and causes low work efficiency, or even death. Clinics and Hospitals can treat common diseases, but not plague unless the corresponding technology is unlocked. Note that immigrants may bring plague to your town when accepting them.

!1r0! Tornados are rare and powerful. They can destroy fields and buildings and carry away your citizens and livestock. You can prepare Interim Housings in preparation, which can temporarily house families while the town is being rebuilt.

!1r1! Pressing <color=#df840e>Q</color> and <color=#df840e>E keys</color> while holding the left mouse button down will rotate the camera left and right. You can also hold down the middle mouse button and swipe left and right to rotate the view.
!1r2! Fires may break out from time to time. If a fire does break out, citizens will use water from the nearest well to prevent it from spreading.

!1r3! Domestic Fuel: Processed from Timber and Dried Dung. Can be used for house heating. Coal: Produced from Mines. Can be used for processing Ink, Refined Fuel, etc. Leather: Obtained by slaughtering animals. Can be used for making clothes, high-class furniture, and luxury goods, etc. Wool: Obtained from sheep. Can be used for making clothes and textiles, etc. Food: Obtained by gathering, planting, fishing, hunting, and farming. Can increase citizens' satiety and Happiness. Water: Obtained from Wells. Can quench Thirst and produce alcohol, beverages, ink, etc. Herb: Obtained from gathering or planting. Can improve citizens' Health and be used for making advanced medicines, etc. Soap: Produced from Soap Workshops. Can improve citizens' Health. Tool: Produced from Smithies. Can improve Citizens' working efficiency. Drinks: Produced from the Wineries and Tea Shops. Can improve Citizens' Health. Cut Stone: Produced from Masonry Workshops. Can be used for constructing buildings and roads. Paper: Produced from Paper Mills. Can improve the efficiency of gaining Tech EXP in Schools, Research Institutes, and Research Academies. Ink: Produced from the Printing Factories. Can be used for making books. Books: Produced from the Printing Factories. Can improve the efficiency of gaining Tech EXP in Research Academies. Plank: Produced from the Sawmills. Can be used in Building construction and furniture manufacturing, etc. Refined Fuel: Produced from the Fuel Factories. Can be used in Smelters and other industrial construction. Glass: Produced from Kiln Factories. Can be used in Building construction, etc. Brick: Produced from Kiln Factories. Can be used in Building construction, etc. Steel: Produced from the Smelters. Can be used in Building construction and making tools, etc. Glass Bottle: Produced from Kiln Factories. Can be used for crafting Lanterns. Lamp Oil: Produced from Lighting Factories. Can be used for crafting Lanterns. Building Kits: Produced from the Forges. Can be used in building construction, etc. Sand: Produced from Sandpits. Can be used for crafting Glass, etc. Clay: Produced from Sandpits. Can be sued for crafting Bricks, etc. Silver Ore: Produced from the Mines. Can be used for crafting Silver Cutlery, etc. Gold Sand: Produced from Gold Miner's Cabin. Can be used for building Gold Avenue. Jade: Produced from the Jade Houses. Can be used for building Jade Avenue.
!1r4! Press the <color=#df840e>F11</color> key to open Photo Mode, hide all menus and observe the town at a close distance.
!1r5! Click the <color=#df840e>Citizen View</color> button in the Citizen Details to observe the citizen's daily life and work.

!1r6! Drought will lead to lack of water. Water structures will stop working due to lower water levels, merchant ships will be stranded, bonus to fishing resources will be permanently lost, and yields from farmlands will also decrease. During this time, citizens can only utilize the groundwater from wells.
!1r7! Scrolling the mouse wheel will zoom the camera in and out.

!1r8! Production of Field, Farm,Grove, Nursery and Forest Farm improved by 50%. Around the resource spot, the buff-covered area will appear when building this type of structure. Whenever a grid of structure landed on the area, a grid of extra output can be gained. Will disappear after a certain amount of time.

!1r9! Production of Pasture, Eco-Pasture and Corral improve by 50%. Resource points will show the buff-covered area when building this type of structure. Extra output depends on the number of grids a structure lands on the buff-covered area. Will disappear after a certain amount of time.
!1ra! A wild animal that can be captured 100% by hunters after building a Hunters Hut. The resource point will disappear once the animal dies naturally.
!1rb! A wild plant whose seeds can be obtained 100% by the gatherers after building a Gatherers Hut or manually sending laborersto gather it. Resource point will disappear if the plant dies.
!1sq! Citizens are starving and require food. If they do not get food soon, their HP will start to decrease. When their HP reaches 0, they will die of starvation.
!1sr! Housing Domestic Fuel reserves are low. Without supplementary fuel, citizens might freeze to death.
!1st! The warehouse has reached its storage capacity.
!1su! You must select a formula for this structure to operate.
!1sv! No workers have been assigned to this structure.
!1sw! The constructure or processing has been suspended due to a shortage of materials.
!1sx! The output limit had been reached. Production has been suspended.
!1sy! The building reserves for Large Mines and Large Quarries ran out and could no longer be used. These buildings cannot be dismantled.
!1sz! This building is due to be demolished.
!1t0! The durability of this building is low.
!1t1! Citizens are thirsty and require drinking water. If they do not get water soon, their HP will start to decrease. When HP reaches 0, they will die of thirst.
!1t2! The durability of this building has reached 0. The structure cannot be used anymore.
!1t4! This structure is on fire, which will spread over time.
!1t5! Set this task as a priority for the workers.
!1t7! Farmers do not work during the slack season (plants won't grow in winter). And they will work as laborers instead.
!1t9! The total reserve of Herbs is low.
!1ta! The total reserve of Timber is low.
!1tb! The total reserve of Stone is low.
!1tc! Citizens are freezing and need to get warm. If they cannot get warm soon, their HP will start to decrease. When HP reaches 0, they will freeze to death.
!1td! The total reserve of fuel is low.
!1te! The term has 1 year left for the administrator.
!1tf! New animals have been acquired through various means.
!1tg! New seeds have been acquired through various means.
!1th! The merchant ship has arrived. You can make purchases or cancel the trade at dock.
!1ti! Immigrants have arrived. You can grant or refuse them citizenship at the Town Hall.
!1tj! It's time to harvest the crops.
!1tk! Some children have grown up and would like their own houses.
!1tl! The town lacks repairmen. Buildings might fall into disrepair or ruin.

!1tn! There are citizens without houses to live in who can only recover stamina by loafing around. They can only get warm at other citizens' homes and get food and water from the warehouse. Homeless citizens cannot have children.
!1to! Lack of clothing, easy to get freeze and death.
!1tp! Citizens are infected with the Plague. A rapid response is needed or the Plague will spread and kill many.
!1tq! Citizens have no tools to work with and are using their bare hands. Their work efficiency is significantly reduced.
!1tr! Citizens have nowhere to work. They have nothing to do but to help the laborers. Please build a workplace for them as soon as possible.
!1ts! Housing food reserves are low. Without supplementary food, citizens might die of starvation.
!1tt! Housing water reserves are low. Without supplementary water, citizens might die of thirst.
!1ty! A product has not been selected
!1u1! The yield limit has been reached
!1uj! You have acquired an animal cub
!1uk! You have acquired new crop seeds
!1un! The autumn harvest is about to begin
!1uo! A citizen has become an adult

!1uy! You can ask laborers to gather wild vegetables or place orders with the merchant ships to get food more quickly. The Hunters Hut, Gatherers Hut, and Fishing Dock produce food each month. Fields, Orchards, and Pastures have high yields but require a long time to mature before they can be harvested.
!1uz! Keep an eye on Domestic Fuel reserves and ensure warehouses are not too far away from residential areas.
!1v0! You can manually choose to enable or disable of a structure, but remember, you will need to assign workers again to the work after re-enable the structure.
!1v1! New warehouses are required for storage.
!1v2! No formula has been selected. You must select a product for the structure.
!1v3! You must assign more workers to this profession.
!1v4! Keep an eye on material reserves and ensure warehouses are not too far away from houses and processing type buildings.
!1v5! You must adjust the output limit to allow production to continue.
!1v6! This structure cannot be used after reserves are exhausted. Remember to dismiss the workers in the structure.
!1v7! You can use the Cancel command to abort the demolition.
!1v8! Pay attention to the number of repairmen to avoid structures being damaged.
!1v9! You can ensure the supply of drinking water by constructing wells and assigning water fetchers to gather it. You can also use coins to order drinking water.
!1va! A ruined building needs to be rebuilt by the builders.
!1vb! Can be manually enabled or disabled.
!1vc! Fires can only be put out if there are wells nearby. Changing the policy can change the firefighting method.
!1vd! Prioritizing new events will lower the priority of previous ones.
!1ve! Keep an eye on fertility rates. And you can postpone building houses if they are already more than enough for the use of next generation.
!1vf! You can reassign farmers to temporarily assist with other work.
!1vg! Tech Points can be used in Technology panel.
!1vh! In the early stages, the Gatherers Hut can be used as a source of Herbs. Later, obtaining herb seeds through trade or tech will allow you to grow large amounts of Herbs in the Nursery.
!1vi! Timber can be acquired by cutting down trees. But you can have higher outputs in Forest Farms.
!1vj! Stone can be collected in the wild, but mining at a Quarry is more efficient and has a higher output.
!1vk! Produce enough clothing and Domestic Fuel can keep citizens warm.
!1vl! Fuel can be obtained by processing Timber at the Chopping House. Or you can have a higher output in the Sawmill.
!1vm! You can reappoint or replace the administrators at the Town Hall.
!1vn! A Pasture or Corral is required to raise animals.
!1vo! A Field, Nursery or Plantation is needed to grow crops.
!1vp! A Dock is required for the merchant ship to stop at.
!1vq! A Town Hall is required for the immigrants to be accepted in town.
!1vr! All field crops in will be harvested in the autumn.
!1vs! New houses are required for citizens to live in.
!1vt! Repairmen are needed to maintain your town's structures.
!1vu! Cancel some citizens' work to make them laborers.
!1vv! Constructing houses or Interim Housings can solve this problem, however ordinary Interim Housings affect citizens' desire to have children.

!1vw! Tailors make clothing and backpacks. Basic clothing protects citizens in the winter and allows them to work outside, reducing their chances of freezing to death. Advanced clothing also increases happiness, though you will need to upgrade the Tailors to unlock advanced tailoring techniques. Advanced tailors can make all kinds of clothing. Backpacks allow citizens to carry more weight and largely increase transportation efficiency.
!1vx! Clinics and hospitals can treat citizens with diseases.
!1vy! Tools can be produced by constructing a blacksmith's. The ordering function of trade can be quickly obtained through the use of silver coins.
!1vz! Click the event bar to view or adjust citizens' professions, adjusting the number of workers a profession as required.
!1w0! Keep an eye on food reserves and ensure warehouses are not too far away from residential areas.
!1w1! Keep an eye on water reserves and ensure warehouses are not too far away from residential areas.

!1w9! A magical Rubik's Cube worshiped by locals. Anyone who throws a coin into it can make a wish and cause a random item(99) to appear. <color=#df840e>Notice: Magical power is restored once a month.</color>
!1wi! This structure is disabled in this scenario.

!1wk! <color=#df840e>Lowest</color> City Happiness. Citizens may <color=#df840e>commit crimes</color>. <color=#ff0033>Lowest: Potential crimes</color>. <color=#ff0033>Lower: Unwilling to procreate</color>. <color=#ff0033>Low: Work efficiency -20%</color>. Normal: No effects. High: Work efficiency +10%. Highest: Work efficiency +10% per 25% happiness after 100%. Church, theater, alcohol, candy and fancy food can increase happiness.

!1wl! <color=#67914a>Highest</color> City Happiness. Citizens work much more efficiently. Lowest: Potential crimes. Lower: Unwilling to procreate. Low: Work efficiency -20%. Normal: No effects. <color=#67914a>High: Work efficiency +10%</color>. <color=#67914a>Highest: Work efficiency +10% per 25% happiness after 100%</color>. Church, theater, alcohol, candy and fancy food can increase happiness.

!1wm! <color=#df840e>Lower</color> City Happiness. Citizens are <color=#df840e>unwilling to procreate</color>. Lowest: Potential crimes. <color=#ff0033>Lower: Unwilling to procreate</color>. <color=#ff0033>Low: Work efficiency -20%</color>. Normal: No effects. High: Work efficiency +10%. Highest: Work efficiency +10% per 25% happiness after 100%. Church, theater, alcohol, candy and fancy food can increase happiness.

!1wn! <color=#ff0033>Low</color> City Happiness. Citizens are a bit depressed. Lowest: Potential crimes. Lower: Unwilling to procreate. <color=#ff0033>Low: Work efficiency -20%</color>. Normal: No effects. High: Work efficiency +10%. Highest: Work efficiency +10% per 25% happiness after 100%. Church, theater, alcohol, candy and fancy food can increase happiness.

!1wo! Normal City Happiness. Citizens are happy and warm. Lowest: Potential crimes. Lower: Unwilling to procreate. Low: Work efficiency -20%. Normal: No effects. High: Work efficiency +10%. Highest: Work efficiency +10% per 25% happiness after 100%. Church, theater, alcohol, candy and fancy food can increase happiness.

!1wp! <color=#df840e>High</color> City Happiness. Citizens work more efficiently. Lowest: Potential crimes. Lower: Unwilling to procreate. Low: Work efficiency -20%. Normal: No effects. <color=#63C349>High: Work efficiency +10%</color>. Highest: Work efficiency +10% per 25% happiness after 100%. Church, theater, alcohol, candy and fancy food can increase happiness.

!1wt! <color=#ff0033>Lowest</color> City Health. A <color=#df840e>plague outbreak</color> is imminent. <color=#ff0033>Lowest: Plague outbreak</color>. <color=#ff0033>Lower: Movement speed -20%</color>. <color=#ff0033>Low: Stamina consumption +20%</color>. Normal: No effects. High: Stamina consumption -10%. Highest: Stamina consumption -10% per 25% health after 100%. Clinic or hospital, herb, soap and bathhouse can increase health.

!1wu! <color=#67914a>Highest</color> City Health. Stamina consumption reduced. Lowest: Plague outbreak. Lower: Movement speed -20%. Low: Stamina consumption +20%. Normal: No effects. <color=#67914a>High: Stamina consumption -10%</color>. <color=#67914a>Highest: Stamina consumption -10% per 25% health after 100%</color>. Clinic or hospital, herb, soap and bathhouse can increase health.

!1wv! <color=#ff0033>Lower</color> City Health. Citizens are in poor health and <color=#df840e>move slower</color>. Lowest: Plague outbreak. <color=#ff0033>Lower: Movement speed -20%</color>. <color=#ff0033>Low: Stamina consumption +20%</color>. Normal: No effects. High: Stamina consumption -10%. Highest: Stamina consumption -10% per 25% health after 100%. Clinic or hospital, herb, soap and bathhouse can increase health.

!1ww! <color=#ff0033>Low</color> City Health. Stamina Consumption increased. Lowest: Plague outbreak. Lower: Movement speed -20%. <color=#ff0033>Low: Stamina consumption +20%</color>. Normal: No effects. High: Stamina consumption -10%. Highest: Stamina consumption -10% per 25% health after 100%. Clinic or hospital, herb, soap and bathhouse can increase health.

!1wx! Normal City Health. Citizens are clean and healthy. Lowest: Plague outbreak. Lower: Movement speed -20%. Low: Stamina consumption +20%. Normal: No effects. High: Stamina consumption -10%. Highest: Stamina consumption -10% per 25% health after 100%. Clinic or hospital, herb, soap and bathhouse can increase health.

!1wy! <color=#67914a>High</color> City Health. Stamina consumption reduced. Lowest: Plague outbreak. Lower: Movement speed -20%. Low: Stamina consumption +20%. Normal: No effects. <color=#67914a>High: Stamina consumption -10%</color>. Highest: Stamina consumption -10% per 25% health after 100%. Clinic or hospital, herb, soap and bathhouse can increase health.
!1x4! Unlocked after completing the research in relevant technology
!1x5! Event Logs. Click to expand or fold. (<color=#df840e>{0}</color>)
!1x6! Map. Monitor the terrain and the distribution of structures and resources. (<color=#df840e>{0}</color>)
!1xb! Adults/Students/Kids Click to view Citizen Statistics.
!1xc! Laborers Click to view Citizen Statistics.
!1xf! Profession. You can adjust the number of jobs available in each profession. (<color=#df840e>{0}</color>)
!1xo! Survivors have chosen a place to settle down, but there are more challenges ahead waiting for them.
!1xp! Press W, A, S, D to move and find a good place on map for your settlement.
!1xt! Technology. Use <color=#df840e>Tech Points</color> to unlock new technology. <color=#df840e>Schools</color> can generate <color=#df840e>Tech EXP</color>. (<color=#df840e>{0}</color>)
!1y8! Hunting Point: Animal cubs can be captured nearby.
!1y9! Fertile Soil: Production of Field,grove and Farm increases by 50%.
!1ya! Fishing Point: Production from Fishing Dock increases by 100%.
!1yb! Grassland: Output from Pasture increases by 50%.
!1yd! Appointing a new administrator will makes the current one leave. This won't cost any silver coin.
!1yf! A experienced gravedigger can always find something useful in a mound. Of course digging it out is more beneficial to the development of the town than letting it sleep underground!
!1yg! A descendant of the oldest family in town. He can use mysterious rituals passed down through generations to change the local climate when the cold winter is coming.
!1yh! The fastest worker in town! It only takes him one month to go around the town carrying a bucket of water.
!1yi! A experienced businessman who maintains good relationships with trade caravans. He could bring more business opportunities.
!1yj! A fortunate miner who have experienced many accidents without being injured, believing that safety measures can help people survive the mine accidents or even meteorites.
!1yk! A excellent forest ranger focuses on the planting and conservation of trees at Foresters Hut, firmly believing that trees will grow faster and better as long as they are nurtured by people.
!1yl! Born in poverty and survived from the most difficult period by extramely saving living materials. These things can be used for much longer than they seem.
!1ym! Worked in farmland for many years and is very knowledgeable in planting and cultivating crops, hoping to pass on knowledge to everyone.
!1yn! Worked in fruit forests for many years and is very knowledgeable in planting and cultivating various fruit trees, hoping to pass on knowledge to everyone.
!1yo! Worked in the ranch for many years and is very knowledgeablein raising and breeding livestock and poultry, hoping to pass on knowledge to everyone.
!1yp! Collectors who have a good knowledge of field materials can help workers in cities and towns make better use of natural resources.
!1yq! Experienced builders know how to save materials in the construction process. Reasonably using less materials will not affect the quality of the building, will it?
!1yr! Experienced craftsmen, who are very knowledgeable about the processing procedures of various objects, can help the workers engaged in processing to perform more efficient work.
!1ys! One who loves soybeans so much that believed soybeans is the best crop in the world and should be grown on every farm then all can eat their fill.
!1yt! One who loves bread so much that believed wheat is the best crop in the world and should be grown on every farm then everyone can eat bread.

!1yu! One who used to be a tobacco trader believes tobacco is excellent goods. Planting tobacco in large quantities will certainly bring a lot of wealth to the town. Of course, Tobacco is not meant to be eaten.
!1yv! Herdsmen who have worked in pastures for many years, have a lot of experience with raising cattle.
!1yw! Used to be a school teacher for many years, emphasizing on education that will be a great help on the technology for towns.
!1yx! Scholars adept at mining affairs, mining affairs of the town would be benefitted from resource develeopment-focusing guidelines.
!1yy! Scholars adept at construction affairs construction of the town would be benefitted from infrastructure-focusing guidelines.
!1yz! Scholars adept at agriculture affairs, agriculture affairs of the town would be benefitted from agriculture-focusing guidelines.
!1z0! Scholars adept at processing-related affairs, processing industry of the town would be benefitted from processing-focusing guidelines.
!1z1! Scholars adept at logistics-related affairs, logistics of the town would be benefitted from logistics-focusing guidelines.
!1z3! Teachers increase the science proficiency of the town.
!1z4! Scholars who have a lot of research on livability, development programs that focus on education have greatly contributed to the livability of towns.
!1z5! Herbalists who master ancient formulas can bring stronger physiques to citizens.
!1z6! Thinks highly of food storage and civic diet.
!1z7! Used to live in an arid area so now cherishes water resources.
!1z8! Once lived in cold area, now extremely cares about heat preservation measures.
!1z9! Skilled worker who focus on summarization of experience and have published books on how to learn from experience, which is popular among the public.
!1za! Once was a researcher at the Institute and was able to lead the research and development of scientific research projects, emphasizing on scientific and technological research projects.
!1zb! Once was a interior designer, thinking highly of the comfortable home environment.
!1zc! Believe that population is the basis of the labor force and encourage people to have children.
!1zd! Believed that the admission of immigrants is conducive to diversified development and will formulate policies to accept more immigrants.
!1ze! Has a high reputation among the citizens and is loved by all.
!1zf! A trader who focuses on luxury goods and do business with the wealthiest merchants only. He can attract more affluent caravans to the town.
!1zg! Once was a doctor who cared about the healthy life of the citizens, emphasizing on the development of medicine.
!1zh! Once a businessman who spent all his estate on charity, hoping everyone can lead to a happy life.
!1zi! Once was an opera actor, think highly of the development of culture and art, being able to greatly reduce citizens' stress by the entertainment.
!1zm! Interval between the arrival of merchant ship: <color=#df840e> -10%</color>
!1zp! Duration of tools, clothes and backpacks: <color=#df840e>+20</color>
!202! Unlock buildings: <color=#df840e>Bathhouse</color> and <color=#df840e>Soap Workshop</color>. Curing speed of <color=#df840e>Measles</color> will be greatly increased.
!20e! Activate a random unlocked technology (Reappointment invalid)
!20j! Merchant Ships will all be Mega Merchant Ships, which carry more goods.
!20p! <color=#df840e>{0}</color> immigrants applied to settle in the town.

!20v! When administrators who have been selected for auto-reappointment reach the end of their term, the fee for their next term will be automatically charged. If they retire, another administrator with the same abilities will take over their job.
!20z! The administrator has retired. Do you want to appoint his son as his successor?
!220! Choose a scenario, lead the people, and build \nyour own town.
!224! If you are playing this game for the first time, we strongly recommend you turn on the Guides.

!235! <color=#df840e>9/30/2022 Announcement:</color> <color=#df840e>V{0}</color> Feature changes: 1.New SFX for clickings of Town hall, Police Station, Shelter, Great Palace 2.Map: Easter Island now has adjusted difficulty values 3.Dates now have an adjusted routine of production. 4.Reservoirs now have better efficiency value. Water mills and water sawmills now have better efficiency.
Bugfixes: 1.Insulation value would be correctly reach its new maximum when a perk granting such value is applied. 2. Corrected description for Gatherers' hut.
<color=#df840e>9/29/2022 Announcement:</color> <color=#df840e>V0.85.311.140</color> Feature Changes: 1.Halloween treats can now be obtained via faction trading routes. 2.Fishing ports and Pelagic fishing harbors now must be appointed to harvest only ONE kind of production in their lists. 3.Structures, including bread shops, Textile water mills, Jam workshops, etc., now have optimized recipes or workflows. 4.Achievement "New year blessing" now has changed descriptions to inform different ways to obtain related items. 5.Techs related to latrine modification are now removed. The structure can now be upgraded directly with the required materials in stock if obtained via faction trading routes or other methods.
Bugfixes: 1.Houses placed in the range of effect of boiler rooms will now correctly consume the fuel stockpile of their own if the boiler rooms' is depleted. 2.Deep quarries and mines will no longer remove their production appointments with their required consumables depleted. 3.Corrected descriptions for certain structures.
<color=#df840e>9/28/2022 Announcement:</color> <color=#df840e>V0.85.310.139</color> Feature Changes： 1.Modification effects of marquees and tents are now changed individually
Aesthetics: 1.6 new BGMs 2.Better model for Jewelry Workshop 3.Better model for nurseries 4.Better model performance for mills and water mills
Bugfixes: 1.Savefile loading failure caused by material revision is now solved 2.Searching functions will not be corrected to the difference of capitals and lowercases 3.Merchant ships now would not bring time-capsule-items from former versions 4.Techs now will no longer require former version exclusive materials
<color=#df840e>9/26/2022 Announcement:</color> <color=#df840e>V0.85.307.134</color> Here are the major stat changes included in this update: 1. All in-game stats are now recalculated and renewed to form a new stat structure. 2. Readjusted early-game buffs for a brand new early-game experience. 3. Readjusted yields and growth cycles of certain crops. 4. Readjusted yields and slaughter gains of certain livestock. 5. Readjusted distribution patterns and yields of wild resources. The changes will affect manual gathering, Forester's Huts, Hunters' Huts, and Gatherers' huts. 6. Readjusted fillingness and Thristiness provided by food and drinks and health and happiness values. 7. An almost-overhaul for recipes and efficiency of production and procession structures. 8. Renewed buff sets for certain modifications, structures, mayors, and techs. 9. Certain tech trees were redesigned. (Liveability included) 10. Happiness and health values are now divided into three tiers; a new kind of buff is applied for each tier reached. 11. Readjusted rates of dependency for different subjects to happiness and health tier evaluation. 12. Readjusted states for health-and-happiness-related consumables. 13. Dense farms and water nurseries now have readjusted production bonuses; the structures above will no long be benefitted from fertilizer buffs. 14. Deep Mines and Quarries now require consumables to start working. And their production rate is raised as compensation.
Feature adjustments: 1.New items: Medicinal Powder, Salt Soap, Ceremonial Bread, Peasant Bread, and Veggie Salad. 2.New structures: Chapel, Herbalist Cabin, Marquee, and Veg Procession Plant. 3.Selection Special Structures is no longer available in the starting phase. The existing subjects of special structures (Rubik's Cubes, Goof-off hero, and three statues) can now be unlocked via blueprints sold randomly by merchant ships. 4.Boiler rooms readjusted: It will provide proper insulation rather than make citizens gather. Thus, residents in its zone of effect will no longer consume fuels. 5.Docks can now be built without pre-techs. 6.Docks and tea shops now have different construction recipes. 7.Certain random events were rewritten and re-rewarded. 8.Tents are now only available for the Easter island scene.
FX optimization: 1.Better icons for certain items like milk and cakes. 2.Better click-on sound FX for certain structures like latrines and hospitals. 3.Better sound FX for certain disasters. 4.Better models for certain structures (e.g., Forester's Hut, Saltworks, Small trading posts, Large trading posts, Water trading posts, docks, Curing Workshops, Leather shops, Carving Workshops, Pottery workshops, latrines.)
Bugfixes: 1.Structures with zones of effects will now no longer display their effect zones multi-layered. 2.Corrected resource sources and job descriptions in the help journal. 3.Fixed display for recommended workers of Drag-and-size structures
<color=#df840e>8/12/2022 Announcement:</color> <color=#df840e>V0.85.303.129</color> Features update: 1. Recommend staff numbers will now be colored in non-fix-sized structures. 2. Tools now have new default priority levels.
Aesthetics: 1.Re-worked model for Sankore Madrasah. 2. Resized Compost plants is now available 3.Re-colored roof for Theaters and Academies.
Bugfixes: 1. Certain citizen occupations now have new instructions in the help texts. 2. Candy Workshop's staff now have corrected occupations. 3. With max tech level, no more error messages about miss techs will be shown. 4. Certain texts are now fixed. 5.Issues occurred on savefile saves and loads under rarest condition.
<color=#df840e>8/8/2022 Announcement:</color> <color=#df840e>V0.85.301.127</color> New features: 1.Recommend staff number is now colored in the structure panel for better visual comprehension, there are also changes on the very numbers. 2.Work load module now has a optimized logic for judgement. 3.Images in the help text is renewed to match the changes. 4.Saplings are removed from Help-Illustration panel. 5.Saplings are removed from Town Detail-Seeds and livestock panel. 6.Goof-off Hero will no longer grant any health or happiness bonuses.
Bugfixes： 1.Changed description for certain items. 2.Tiles can no longer be added to warehouses placed in the mountains. 3.Recipe anisette in the winery is now able to be produced properly. 4.Silver coin consumption of Decorations will no longer overflow the boxes. 5. Older version exclusive items are now removed from Town Detail-Production Overview, while fuzzy query is now available for searching panel. 6.Special structure---Rubik's cube will now give correct rewards.
<color=#df840e>8/5/2022 Announcement:</color> <color=#df840e>V0.85.299.127</color> Better warehouse sorting: 1.Sorting of warehouse contents is now reworked to allow sorting of single-items. 2.Warehouse sorting panel is now reworked to match the changes. 3.Searching is now available for warehouses.
Changes on features: 1.Decorative structure are now ONLY able be purchased with SILVER COINS. (Cancelling the construction does not give back the coins consumed) 2. Recipes of saplings are now removed from the nurseries. 3.Changed material requirements for hospitals.
Aesthetics: 1.Factions now have better item showcasing panels. 2.Adult school and Grand thermae are now shown in Antonio's faction panel. 3.A new kind of blueprint structure---Grand thermae is now available. 4.Recipe for building latrines now has changed numbers of required materials.
Bugfixes: 1.Certain item-related mods would no longer stop the game from starting. 2.Some texts are updated to prevent further misunderstanding. 3.Remodeling will no longer cause removed items to appear. 4.When the relationship with Carlos's faction reaches lv2, the tequila seeds will now be correctly given. 5.Missing seeds and animals are now back in the dock's Order panel. 6.Seeds purchasable when relationship with Carlo's faction reaches lv.4 will now be correctly available. 7.Dung collector now have corrected descriptions for their actions. 8.Achievement-Seeds Collector will now not be unlocked at the start of every new game. 9.Certain abnormal productions caused by orchard recipes will cease to happen from now on.
<color=#df840e>8/1/2022 Announcement:</color> <color=#df840e>V0.85.291.125</color> Here's the changelog of the re-worked welfare system, check them below: 1.Original ways of inc and decrease of happiness and health value will no longer apply in further versions. 2.
