There're now several different sections in the gaining of Happiness and Health value bonuses, a reworked kind of stat tips is also applied to happiness and health value. 3.Happiness and health value now have reworked effects in different intervals. 4.Citizen's panels now show stats about happiness and health related requirements. 5.Happiness and health value now have a max number of 150% rather than 200% 6.A Happiness and health-affected bonus is applied in the starting phase of the games. 7. Reworked effects and panels for following structures: Churches/Mosques, Hospitals/Barber Shops. Theatres/Jingju Theatres,Bath houses. 8. Reworked effects of certain structures and Remodel selections. 9. Changed classification and effect for certain items. 10.Removal of existing items and rework of original recipes. 11.Reworked Happiness and health value related tech-trees 12.Tombstones will now expire faster. 13.Help texts are changed to reflect reworks on happiness and health system. 14.Reworks on guide texts. 15.Reworks on new players' guides. 16.Reworks on first game texts.
A better upper-left resource panel: 1.Annual production and consumption is now available in tips-items. 2.A new button jumping to stock management 3.Reworked resource classification in the panel. 4.Optimized text effects in the resource panel.
Easy searching: 1.Searching panel is now available in some of the Help texts,City Details and Trading panels. 2.Categorized display is now available for some search panels. 3.Fuzzy query by the initial letters is now available in search panels.
Features: 1.Fertile soil bonuses will now apply to orchards. 2.A selection of 2 is now available for initial population. 3.Fruits now have higher costs, no fruit seeds will be given in the start-game. 4. Overall fat production-50% 5.Recipe of straw shoes are now available in Knitting workshop rathen than the tailors' 6.Cellars and storage yards are now placed in changed position of the tech tree of Logistics 7.Range of effects will be displayed whenever a structure with effect range is selected. 8.Now you can summon the control panel with ctrl+~.
Aesthetics: 1.An almost-overhaul on the VFX of structure models. 2.Citizens with both handcarts and horses will now make makeshift wagons, a great step forward! 3.Plantations now have better models and readjusted planting areas. 4. Structure panels now looks better in double-row mode. 5.A new health value-related structure: Latrine.
Bugfixes: 1.Fishing ports will now be correctly benefitted from education bonuses. 2.Reworked on the positioning of the accesses and working animals in the delivery center.
!239! Are you sure you want to delete this saved data?
!23a! The deleted saves cannot be restored. Are you sure you want to delete them?
!23b! This key is being used. Do you want to change the keybind into this function?
!23c! Settings haven't been applied. Apply current settings?
!248! If enabled, usually set it to setting 1. Setting 2, 3 and 4 will consume less power but frame rate of the game will drop. When enabled, the frame rate setting does not take effect.
!24e! Can be obtained from trade or gathering in the wild.
!24f! Can be obtained from Hunters Hut.
!24g! Can be obtained from trade or hunters hut.
!24h! Can be obtained from trade or game start at low difficulty.
!24i! Can be obtained from trade or technology.
!24l! <color=#df840e>Skin-borne: Measles</color> unlocked in <color=#df840e>Technology (T) - Livability - Bath House</color>
!24n! <color=#df840e>Saliva-borne: Tuberculosis</color> Can only be treated at the <color=#df840e>Hospital</color>. Unlockable in <color=#df840e>Technology (T) - Livability - Hospital</color>.
!24p! <color=#df840e>Air-borne: Pandemic Flu</color> Can only be treated at the <color=#df840e>Hospital</color>. Unlockable in <color=#df840e>Technology (T) - Livability - Pharmacy</color>.
!24t! Storage exceeds the upper limit, can not be traded.
!24z! Housing can only be built within the market places.
!25c! Laborers can mainly collecting materials on the ground and help the town's logistics system.
!25d! Gatherers increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.
!25e! Transporters increase the Logistics Proficiency Level through their work.
!25f! Cooks work at the gourmet shop and produce various advanced delicacies which increase citizens' happiness. Some special foods increase multiple different stats.
!25g! Cooks increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!25h! Leatherworkers work at the Leatherware Hut and the Leather Shop, they process ordinary Leather into Refined Leather and other Leather product.
!25i! Leatherworkers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!25j! Shop assistants work at the luxury store and sell rare, luxury items, designed primarily for trade. Luxury items are a main source of silver coins.
!25k! Shop assistants increase the trading proficiency of the town.
!25l! Silkworm farmers work at the silkworm shed and produce silk for the production of advanced textiles.
!25m! Silkworm farmers increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.
!25n! Actors work at theaters and perform shows, which largely increase citizens' happiness. Theatres serve a limited area. Building more theatres will help generate higher levels of happiness.

!25o! Fishermen work in various fishing industries. The fishing dock is the primary structure in the early stages and its yield is related to the area of water that it covers. As fishing boats are usually some distance from the city, paving roads or building warehouses nearby can reduce transportation times. Upgrading the fishing industry as early as possible allows you to construct advanced fishing structures which significantly increase the yield of the fishermen. You can further boost the output by using fishing nets. Once upgraded to the Fishing Port, fishermen can sail out to sea to fish.
!25p! Actors increase the Livability proficiency of the town.
!25q! Workers in the Delivery Center deliver the designated raw materials from all storage-type buildings to the corresponding processing buildings within the range.
!25r! Suppliers increase the Logistics Proficiency Level through their work.
!25s! Mint workers make silver coins, which can be used as a common currency for trade.
!25t! Mint workers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!25u! Jewelry workers work at the jewelry workshop and make jade, silver, and gold sand into jewelry for trading, which is an important source of silver coins.
!25v! Jewelry workers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!25w! Carvers work at the Carving Workshop and process various raw materials into statues for trade. Statues are one of the main sources of silver coins.
!25x! Carvers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!25y! Gold miners work at the gold miner's cabin and pan sand for gold sand, which can be used to build structures or pave gold avenues.
!25z! Fishermen increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.
!260! Gold miner increases the processing proficiency of the town.
!261! Jade workers work at the jade house and search for jade in stone, which can be used to build structures or pave jade avenues.
!262! Jade worker increases the processing proficiency of the town.
!263! Beverage workers work at the tea shop and process raw materials into coffee, tea, and other beverages.
!264! Beverage workers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!265! By using Fuel in the Boiler Room, the boilerman can supply hot water to citizens and provide heat to houses within the range. Houses within the range no longer need Domestic Fuel.
!266! Boilermen increase the livability proficiency of towns during their work.

!267! The sheriff is responsible for the security of the city. When a crime is committed, the sheriff can find out who the offender is and mark it for you. However, it's up to you to decide what to do with the crime. Exile crime can get him out of town but it's also a way to increase his happiness to stop him from committing a crime.
!268! Sheriffs increase the Livability Proficiency Level through their work.

!269! Hunters work at the Hunters Hut, which is also a resting place for them. They search the whole map for prey, and then hunt or catch it. Although there are no area restrictions as to where hunters can work, they cannot cross the river without bridges. Connecting land masses via bridges as early as possible will help increase hunters' output. When a hunter's inventory is full, they must return to a cabin, so constructing additional Hunters Huts or warehouses will also increase their output.
!26a! Hunters increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.

!26b! Woodcutters chop wood to make Domestic Fuels and improve combustion efficiency by processing Timber and Dried Dung. After an industrial upgrade, woodcutters can also produce planks for construction. In Water Sawmills, working efficiency is enhanced due to the use of water power.
!26c! Woodcutters increase the Processing Proficiency Level through their work.

!26d! Foresters' job is far more than felling trees. As the guardians of nature, they only cut down the mature trees and periodically plant saplings to replace them. Of course, trees do not grow very fast... Typically, the area around a Foresters Hut will not be a lush forest. In order to maintain the ecological balance, the output of Timber is of course not high. For higher yields, you can develop technology in the early stages to unlock forest farms. Once trees are mature, foresters can cut them down, providing a steady supply of Timber.
!26e! Foresters increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.
!26f! Herbalists know knowledge about herbs. They collect herbs and improve citizens' Health. They don't plant herbs; instead, farmers plant herbs in the Nursery after the Herb Seed is obtained.
!26g! In circumstances where workers in other professions cannot do their job, they will help the laborers with their work.
!26h! Herbalists increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.

!26i! A miner's job includes high levels of physical work. They can work at various mines and you will need to assign enough manpower to ensure a steady output. Ore is heavy and mines are built in remote areas. Building advanced roads, placing nearby warehouse or advanced storage structures as soon as possible can significantly increase their output.
!26j! Miners increase the mining proficiency of the town.

!26k! Quarry Workers work in all kinds of quarries, which require many people to guarantee stable production. Stones are the main consumables in the early game. You can also command Laborers to clean up and gather stones on the map. But for sustained and stable output, quarries need to be built.
!26l! Quarry Workers increase the Mining Proficiency Level through their work.

!26m! Blacksmiths turn metal into tools, they can also make stone tools, however, these are not as durable. Iron and Steel tools are a blacksmith's main product. Citizens without tools have low work efficiency. Construct a blacksmith as soon as possible to ensure a healthy supply of tools and improve the development of the town.
!26n! Blacksmiths increase the processing proficiency of the town.

!26o! Brewers make alcohol, which is an important source of citizens' Health. Advanced alcohol provides higher Health. Different raw materials can be used to make different types of alcohol. The seeds of raw materials can be collected in the wild or purchased from merchant ships. Fermentation requires a large amount of water. To ensure the stable output of alcohol, a steady supply of both water and raw materials is needed.
!26p! Brewers increase the processing proficiency of the town.

!26q! Tailors make clothing and backpacks. Basic clothing protects citizens in the winter and allows them to work outside, reducing their chances of freezing to death. Advanced clothing also increases happiness, though you will need to upgrade the Tailors to unlock advanced tailoring techniques. Advanced tailors can make all kinds of clothing. Backpacks allow citizens to carry more weight and largely increase transportation efficiency.

!26r! Builders play a central role in developing the town. They can build structures from scratch: clearing sites, transporting materials, and constructing structures. If they are short-handed, laborers will help them with clearing the site and transporting materials. You can cancel a construction at any time. You can prioritize structures for builders to work on if there are many sites and too few workers to cover all of them at once.
!26s! Tailors increase the processing proficiency of the town.

!26t! Vendors work at the marketplace. They move daily supplies from warehouses to the market where citizens in the area can freely use whatever they need. Vendors organize and collect resources so that the citizens do not need to waste time running between different warehouses. Once you unlock Delivery, vendors can deliver goods directly to houses. Citizens will be able to use daily necessities at home without going to the market or the warehouse, which significantly cuts down their time spent traveling.
!26u! Vendors increase the Logistics Proficiency Level through their work.

!26v! Traders are responsible for making transactions and moving goods. Traders will sell designated goods which could be primary resources or goods made exclusively for sale. The value of tradable goods is much higher than that of primary resources. Citizens do not rely on tradable goods for survival, so they are the best source of silver coins. Goods purchased from merchant ships will be stored at the dock and can only be used after traders have transported them to warehouses.
!26w! Traders increase the trading proficiency of the town.

!26x! Teachers educate citizens and produce Tech EXP for the town. They teach students and impart knowledge in schools. Only educated adults can be assigned as teachers. The town's first generation of adults are all educated. The output of Technology Experience is related to the educational building. Consuming paper will accelerate the production of Technology Experience.

!26y! Unlock the building <color=#df840e>Pharmacy</color>. A structure capable of producing <color=#df840e>special medicine</color>.Curing speed of <color=#df840e>Pandemic Flu</color> will be greatly increased.

!26z! Doctors work in Clinics and Hospitals, and they are crucial to maintaining citizens' Health. They treat diseases and plagues with medication. A doctor can only treat limited patients. In order to steady citizens' Health and properly handle sudden illness and plague, you need to build enough hospitals.
!270! Doctors increase the Livability proficiency of the town.

!271! Clerics preach religion to citizens. They work in churches, which can serve a limited area. Citizens will visit churches and develop religious beliefs, which will largely reduce crime rates. If all citizens become believers, there will be no more crime.
!272! Builders increase the construction proficiency of the town.
!273! Clerics increase the Livability proficiency of the town.

!274! Masseurs and masseuses work in the Bathhouse. They use water or soap to clean citizens, which prevents disease and significantly increases Health. Due to limited spaces in the Bathhouse, it can only serve a limited area. A sufficient number of Bathhouses is needed to ensure all citizens' Health. Higher soap reserves can encourage citizens to clean themselves more often and increase Health.
!275! Masseurs and masseuses increase the Livability proficiency Level through their work.

!276! Water Fetchers mainly work in wells to produce stable drinking water for citizens. Please noted that, water is also part of the production material for products except being a drinking resource. In addition, when the fire comes, the well can also be used for fire fighting. Spreading wells near various buildings is an effective measure to deal with fires.
!277! Water fetchers increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.

!278! Bartenders work in taverns, which provide a place for drinking and partying, and greatly increase citizens' happiness. Taverns have limited space and adopt a membership system, accomodating a certain number of citizens. To increase the happiness of all citizens, you must construct a sufficient number of taverns.
!279! Bartenders increase the Livability proficiency of the town.

!27a! Repairmen fix structural wear caused by years of use and weather damage (even unused structures require upkeep). Ruined structures should be demolished and rebuilt by builders. The work of repairmen is inconspicuous but vital. Repairing buildings when there is only slight wear and tear does not consume materials. When the structure is ruined, it requires construction materials to repair it.
!27b! Repairmen increase the construction proficiency of the town.

!27c! Apiarists work at the apiary. Note that beehives will spawn on mature trees, but dense forest may also hinder the production of hives. So, not recommend to be near a Foresters Hut. Apiarists collect honey for food and beeswax for processing of lamp oil.

!27d! Farmers are the main labor force in agricultural production and play an important role in generating food supplies. They can work in fields or in Orchards. Farming requires seeds, which can be found in the wild, or purchased from merchant ships. Fields have busy seasons as well as slack seasons. There are three stages to the busy season: sowing, farming, and harvesting. In the slack season, farmers will help laborers to transport goods. After upgrading the industry, farmers can grow Herbs and advanced materials in nurseries and plantations. It takes years for fruit trees to grow. When they are mature, they will produce fruit whenever the temperature is favorable.
!27e! Apiarists increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.

!27f! Weavers process fabric raw materials into textile products at the Textile Mill. Advanced textile products require special raw materials, most of which can be grown in fields. Weavers at the Textile Water Mill generate a higher output due to their use of water power.
!27g! Weavers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!27h! Fuel workers work at Fuel Factory, processing Timber or coal into Refined Fuels, which are only for industrial use. Refined Fuels produce materials crucial to industrial processing.
!27i! Fuel workers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!27j! Mill workers process wheat and malt, providing raw materials for bread-making and liquor production. A watermill uses water power and is more efficient.
!27k! Mill workers increase the processing proficiency of the town.

!27l! Bakers work in Bakeries and Pastry Shops and are able to use flour to produce more High-quality Food. High-quality Food can increase Citizens' Happiness, and some can even relieve Citizens' stress.
!27m! Bakers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!27n! Butchers work at Butcher. They cut the meat from animals slaughtered by the hunters in the pasture. Cut meat provides more energy and can feed more citizens.
!27o! Farmers increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.
!27p! Butchers increase the processing proficiency of the town during work.
!27q! Fat Makers process Milk into Butter, and Fat into Soap.
!27r! Fat Makers increase the Processing Proficiency Level through their work.
!27s! Sugarmakers extract sugar from beets for the production of advanced food.
!27t! Sugarmakers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!27u! Jam makers extract jam from fruits for the production of advanced food.
!27v! Jam makers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!27w! Salt makers work at Saltworks. They extract salt from water for curing meat.
!27x! Salt makers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!27y! Meat curers work at curing workshops. They use salt to make salted meat and salted fish, which are tastier and can be easily preserved.

!27z! Herdsmen breed animals. Livestock and wild animals can be raised on pastures. Wild animals can be acquired through hunting, and you can get livestock by trading or ordering from Merchant Ships. Pasture animals can reproduce without a herdsman, but there will be no output.
!280! Meat curers increase the processing proficiency of the town.

!281! Reed farmers work in reed fields, which can be built near rivers and yield reeds stably. The reed farmers regularly collect reeds, which can be used in Knitting Workshop and Textile Mills for production.
!282! The working reed farmers can increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.
!283! Knitters work at Knitting Workshop. They can process raw materials into ropes and make ropes into fishing nets for the fishermen.
!284! Knitters increase the processing proficiency of the town.

!285! The Smelter is one of the main production lines in industrial production, and various basic raw materials can be processed by it to produce large number of raw materials for a buildings and high-end industries. These materials included Glass, Steel and Bricks. The Smelter can also further process the Glass into Glass Bottles, which can be used to produce Portable Lamps and other glass products.
!286! Smelters increase the processing proficiency of the town.

!287! Dredger work at sandpits. They collect sand and clay from water which are both important materials in industrial production. Occasionally they will find gold sand in the sand, but only in very small proportions.
!288! Dredger will gradually increase the Mining Proficiency of the town during work.
!289! Papermakers work at paper mills and printing factories. They can process Timber or reeds into paper or books, and turn coal and water into ink, which is mainly used for education and research.
!28a! Herdsmen increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.
!28b! Papermakers increase the processing proficiency of the town.

!28c! Researchers work at research institutes and academies. Their research on society and science provides a large amount of Technology Experience, which significantly increases the speed of town development. The output of points from each researcher is limited, but using paper and books can greatly improve their efficiency.
!28d! Researchers increase the Science Proficiency Level through their work.
!28e! Candy makers work at candy workshops. They can make fancy like candy and chocolates, sugared ration grants happiness bonus.
!28f! Candy makers's work process increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!28g! Can-makers work at canneries and can make all kinds of cans. Canned food provides more energy and allows citizens to work outside for longer periods.
!28h! Can-makers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!28i! Bedding Weavers work in the Bedding Shop, processing linen and cotton cloth into Bedding Sets. Bedding sets are essential materials for advanced structures.
!28j! Bedding Weaver increases the Processing Proficiency Level through their work.
!28k! Furniture makers work at furniture factories and produce all kinds of furniture, which is necessary for advanced buildings. Luxury furniture can also be sold for silver coins.

!28l! Gatherers work at the Gatherers Hut, which should be placed in a wooded area. Gatherers will search the area around the station for plants, including wild vegetables, raw materials for the brewery, textile materials, and so on. Notice that the wild plants grow with the trees. If too many trees are cut down, there will be no more wild plants for gatherers to collect. Gatherers Huts are most effective in the early stages, due to the abundance of forested areas, but be careful to avoid overlapping stations, as this will reduce the overall yield.
!28m! Furniture makers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!28o! Light makers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!28p! Potters process raw materials into pottery, which is primarily used as tradable goods. Pottery is the main source of silver coins.
!28q! Potters increase the processing proficiency of the town.
!28r! Stonecutters process stone into cut stone which can be used to build roads and advanced structures.
!28s! Stonecutter increases the Processing Proficiency Level through their work.
!28t! Fishpond workers work at the fishpond. They are land-based fishermen and provide a steady supply of fish.
!28u! Fishpond workers increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.
!28v! Transporters store supplies at the Transfer Station, which functions similarly to a warehouse. But transporters deliver supplies from the Transfer Station to warehouses outside the range.
!2b7! {0} the {1} ({2} years old) was struck by a meteorite and died. Family's happiness dropped for no place to bury the dead.
!2b8! {0} the {1} ({2} years old) slipped on a banana peel and died unfortunately. Family's happiness dropped for no place to bury the dead.
!2b9! {0} the {1} ({2} years old) died by the spit of an Alpaca when playing with it. Family's happiness dropped for no place to bury the dead.
!2ba! {0} the {1} ({2} years old) was struck by lightning when picking mushrooms under trees. Family's happiness dropped for no place to bury the dead.
!2bb! {0} ({1}) was killed by a turtle falling from the sky. Family's happiness dropped for no place to bury the dead.
!2bc! {0} the {1} ({2} years old)was struck by a meteorite and died.
!2bd! {0} the {1} ({2} years old) slipped on a banana peel and died unfortunately.
!2be! {0} the {1} ({2} years old) died by the spit of Alpaca when playing with it.
!2bf! {0} the {1} ({2} years old) was struck by lightning when picking mushrooms under trees.
!2bg! {0} ({1}) was killed by a turtle falling from the sky.

!2bh! Remodel the structure with Building Kit to strengthen its stability to withstand wind and rain, thus it will not be damaged or destroyed. The floor tiles under buildings will not be destroyed by earthquakes.
!2bi! Remodel the house with Luxury Bedding to provide extra insulation and reduced fuel consumption. The fuel consumption decreased by <color=#df840e>20%</color>.
!2bj! Remodel the structure with Brick Kiln to get the fire burning stronger, thus improve work efficiency by <color=#df840e>10%</color>.
!2bk! Mass the herb soap storage to provide more kinds of services.
!2bl! Remodel the house with Furniture, raising the housing capacity to <color=#df840e>one person</color> in addition for each family.
!2bm! Remodel the house with Luxury Furniture, raising the housing capacity to <color=#df840e>two people</color> in addition for each family.
!2bn! Remodel the structure with Lanterns to impove the lighting of working environment so miners and quarrymen could dig deeper. Work efficiency increased by 10%.
!2bo! Light makers work at lighting factories to produce lamp oil and lanterns.
!2bp! Scarify the soil on the farm, Orchard, forest farm, or pasture by hoe. Work efficiency increased by 10%.
!2bq! Remodel the structure with Steel Tool to make the citizen's work easier. Work efficiency increased by 10%.
!2br! Explore the Technology with Books, which improve the <color=#df840e>10%</color> of generation efficiency of technology points.
!2bs! Expand the capacity of buildings with Stone, which increase <color=#df840e>2000</color> of the containable weight of items.
!2bt! Make baits using Fodder to lure fish, thus improve <color=#df840e>10%</color> of fishing efficiency.
!2bu! Remodel the costumes in theater with Gowns. Improve the buff scope of theater.
!2bv! Remodel the cellar with tools, which increase <color=#df840e>100%</color> of the containable weight of items.
!2bw! Taking a basket while gathering. Work efficiency increased by 10%.
!2bx! Remodel the Hunters Hut with Traps. Increase probability of obtaining cubs from hunting.
!2by! Raising a cat in house can relieve <color=#df840e>5%</color> residents' stress.
!2bz! Signing new employment contracts can increase one person of the maximum number of workers in buildings.

!2c0! Remodel the structure with Tool Kit to reduce <color=#df840e>20%</color> of materials consumed for production, which is only effective for raw materials that reached 5 or more numbers in recipes.
!2c1! By increasing the number of academic dress, the school can admit extra <color=#df840e>10</color> students more for study.
!2c2! Remodel the constructive storage room with Bricks, the capacity of items increased by <color=#df840e>100%</color>.
!2c3! Building Bell Towers on structures can widen missionaries' range.
!2c4! Remodel the house with Toilet to provide residents with sanitary places.Residence no longer produce dry feces, while the residents health will not be improved.
!2c5! Remodel the Field, Farm, Orchard or Forest Farm with Scarecrow to drive away seed-eating birds thus increase <color=#df840e>15%</color> output.
!2c6! Remodel the wind wheels and water mills with gear to make the rotation smoother. Work efficiency increases by <color=#df840e>10%</color>.
!2c7! Remodel the structure with Oven, improving its work efficiency by <color=#df840e>10%</color>.
!2c8! Issue residents with home textiles to provide extra insulation and reduced <color=#df840e>16%</color> fuel consumption.
!2cg! Add Special medicine to clinic and hospitals' stockpile to extend their service.
!2d0! Seeds planted in Field that yield Potatoes. Cold-resistant.
!2d1! Seeds planted in Field that yield Flax.
!2d2! Seeds planted in Field that yield Cotton.
!2d3! Seeds planted in Field that yield Oats. Can be used for brewery. Seeds can be collected in wild, pretty low production.
!2d4! Seeds planted in Field that yield Rice.
!2d5! Seeds planted in Field that yield Soybeans. High yield.
!2d6! Seeds planted in Field that yield Chickpeas.
!2d7! Seeds planted in Field that yield Squashes. Fast-maturing but low yield.
!2d8! Seeds planted in Field that yield Lettuces. Fast-maturing but low yield.
!2d9! Seeds planted in Field that yield Tomatoes. Fast-maturing but low yield.
!2da! Seeds planted in Field that yield Sugar Beets.
!2db! Seeds planted in Field that yield Peas. Higher yield than vegetables. Productions are slightly higher than Vegetables and Staple Food, but lower than Soybeans.
!2dc! Seeds planted in Field that yield Sugarcane.
!2dd! Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Coffee Beans.
!2de! Seeds planted in Nursery that yield Tobacco.
!2df! Seeds planted in Nursery that yield Tea Leaves.
!2dg! Seeds planted in Nursery that yield Cocoa Beans.
!2dh! Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Apples.
!2di! Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Cherries.
!2dj! Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Chestnuts.
!2dk! Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Peaches.
!2dl! Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Pears.
!2dm! Seeds planted in Field that yield Broccoli. Fast-maturing but low yield.
!2dn! Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Pecans.
!2do! Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Plums.
!2dp! Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Grapes. Can be used for brewery.
!2dq! Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Maple Sap.
!2dr! Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Mulberry Leaves.
!2ds! Seeds planted in Forest Farm that yield Timber.
!2dt! Seeds planted in Nursery that grow into decorative Saplings.
!2du! Seeds planted in Nursery that yield Herbs.
!2dv! Seeds planted in Field that yield Hay.
!2dw! Seeds planted in Field that yield corn. High-yield crop.
!2dx! Seeds planted in Field that yield Chili. Fast-maturing but low yield.
!2dy! Seeds planted in Field that yield Pumpkins. Fast-maturing but low yield.
!2dz! Seeds planted in Field that yield Wheat. Can be used for brewery.
!2e0! Seeds planted in Field that yield Cabbages. Fast-maturing but low yield.
!2e1! Seeds planted in Nursery that yield Agave. Can be used for brewery.
!2fv! {0} the {1} has been sacrificed for the happiness of the town.
!2fw! March is the time of planting. You can increase or decrease the number of farmers according to the food reserves.
!2fx! Make sure the citizens have access to heating in winter.
!2fy! The autumn harvest is about to start. Assigning more farmers will speed up the harvest.
!2fz! Citizens need warm clothes to work outside in the winter.

!2gp! Trees grow slowly on Easter Island, so structures that grow trees are disabled in this scenario.Easter Island is a sea island, so land trade is disabled and the interval between sea trading stations is increased. Some technologies are already unlocked at the beginning of the game.Easter Island is densely forested, so the construction of fields and pastures will destroy the local ecology and affect the growth of trees. Completing the scenario will unlock the unique wonder of Easter Island: Easter Island Statue.
!2gq! The rise and fall of the Vikings.
!2gr! The rise and fall of the Middle Ages.

!2gs! In sandbox mode, you'll start with all the technologies unlocked and can build structures without any building materials and building stages. In addition, you will be able to dig rivers and change the terrain.
!2gx! The Vikings invaded the coasts of Europe and the British Isles from the 8th to the 11th century, covering a wide area from the European mainland to the Arctic.

!2gy! It began with the fall of the Western Roman Empire in 476 A.D. and ended with the fall of the Eastern Roman Empire in 1453 A.D. when it was assimilated into the Renaissance and the age of navigation.

!2h0! Since the time when the islanders landed on the island, they have built their homes for survival and can survive on the island. Now they are preparing to build stone statues by the sea for their faith. Now they need you to help them build the stone statues!
!2ht! The construction of the Moai stone statue
!2iq! Need Builders of Island to carve the stone to statues.
!2ir! Need the builders on the island to carry ropes and roll logs
!2is! Need the builders on the island to erect the stone statue
!2it! The carving of the first stone statue is finished. You need to use a large amount of logs and ropes to transport the statue to the sea.
!2iu! The carving of the fourth stone statue is finished. You need to use a large amount of logs and ropes to transport the statue to the sea.
!2iv! The fourth stone statue has been transported to the sea. Now you need to assign workers to set it up.

!2iw! A group of colonists have arrived and burned the wood tablets for recording by accident. The villagers will not turn a blind eye for this. Would hold on to the rules of hospitality, or simply drive them away?
!2ix! A merchant ship from the ocean has arrived. They have brought some sheep and want to trade with the Easter Island. Do you accept the trade?

!2iy! Congratulations on constructing the imperfect statues, but life is not over for the Easter Islanders. As the population increases, the competiton for resources get more and more intense. Some of them even start to eat their own kind. The Easter Island, whose population has once reached over 30,000, eventually ends in tragedy, with only a few hundred people left.
!2iz! The carving of the fifth stone statue is finished. You need to use a large amount of logs and ropes to transport the statue to the sea.
!2j0! The fifth stone statue has been transported to the sea. Now you need to assign workers to set it up.
!2j1! A group of colonists have arrived. Do you treat them with hospitality or deport them?
!2j2! The carving of the sixth stone statue is finished. You need to use a large amount of logs and ropes to transport the statue to the sea.
!2j3! The sixth stone statue has been transported to the sea. Now you need to assign workers to set it up.

!2j4! The priest propose to carry out the Birdman Warrior Event to find the strongest warrior of the tribe. The event has risks, but the those who survive will bring good things. Do you want to hold the event?
!2j5! The carving of the seventh stone statue is finished. You need to use a large amount of logs and ropes to transport the statue to the sea.
!2j6! The first stone statue has been transported to the sea. Now you need to assign workers to set it up.
!2j7! The seventh stone statue has been transported to the sea. Now you need to assign workers to set it up.

!2j8! Contratulations on constructing the perfect statues, but life is not over for the Easter Islanders. As the population increases, the competition for resources get more and more intense. Some of them even start to eat their own kind. The Easter Island, whose population has once reached over 30,000, eventually ends in tragedy, with only a few hundred people left.
!2j9! The first stone statue has been built, and the priest suggests using the ancient ritual script to record the great move. Do you want to record it on the wood planks?
!2ja! The carving of the second stone statue is finished. You need to use a large amount of logs and ropes to transport the statue to the sea.
!2jb! The second stone statue has been transported to the sea. Now you need to assign workers to set it up.
!2jc! Without enemies, the rats on the island are rapidly multiplying. As a result, the fruit trees cannot produce food and the rats are eating the tree seeds. Would you consider eating rat meat?
!2jd! The carving of the third stone statue is finished. You need to use a large amount of logs and ropes to transport the statue to the sea.
!2je! The third stone statue has been transported to the sea. Now you need to assign workers to set it up.
!2jf! The propagation of doctrines will strengthen religious belief and double the construction speed of the statue. Do you want to start the propagation?
!2jk! Sheep acquired; Dock and Grocery store unlocked
!2jl! Complete the challenge and quit Easter Island scenario
!2jv! Complete the challenge and quit Easter Island scenario
!2k2! Every month there are workers dead from hard work
!2k3! Some villagers die of desperate resistance
!2k4! The merchant ship leaves and will never arrive again
!2k5! Continue to experience the life of islanders
!2k6! Some villagers die of desperate resistance
!2k8! Continue to experience the life of islanders
