!3be! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town.
!3bg! Objective panel will be disabled, proceed? (You can always re-enable it in the settings panel)
!3bj! Living conditions have been upgraded. Unlocked the <color=#df840e>Senior Housing</color>.

!3bm! Can store items. Structure with a highlighted area. Smaller floor area. Collects designated items from all warehouses. Delivers essential raw materials to production buildings in the highlighted area. Unlocked in 'Technology - Logistics - Delivery Station'.

!3bn! A <color=#df840e>crime</color> has occurred in the settlement. You can use the <color=#df840e>Sheriff's Office</color> to find them, and use the Expel button in the upper right corner of the character details to expel them.

!3bo! The occurring of crimes is a sign of <color=#df840e>extremely low happiness</color>. Crime can only be eliminated by increasing citizens' happiness. <color=#df840e>Churches</color>, <color=#df840e>Alcohol</color>, and <color=#df840e>Candies</color> can also increase citizens' happiness.

!3bp! <color=#df840e>Tornadoes</color> and <color=#df840e>Sandstorms</color> are terrible disasters. They will destroy buildings along their way, sweep away supplies, causing the death of citizens, plants and animals.

!3bq! <color=#df840e>Shelters</color> can protect citizens' lives when these disasters hit, and the <color=#df840e>Reinforcement</color> remodel can keep buildings from being destroyed. Besides, <color=#df840e>wild trees</color> can weaken and stop the momentum of <color=#df840e>Sandstorm</color>.

!3br! <color=#df840e>Medicine</color> stock is insufficient, and citizens’ Health will be hard to maintain without them. <color=#df840e>Herbs</color> can be collected in the wild, and to have a stable herb supply, you may obtain the herb seed through gathering after unlocking the technology, or buy it from trading.
!3bs! Also, <color=#df840e>Soaps</color> grant Health bonuses and can be used as an alternative to Medicine.
!3bt! <color=#df840e> Silver coins </color> are necessary if you want to order goods from overseas. <color=#df840e> Trading Post</color> can be built to sell goods to get silver coins.
!3bu! Even if you don't have silver coins, you can still <color=#df840e>trade for goods</color> with a docked merchant ship.
!3bv! There is a lack of <color=#df840e>Builders</color> in the settlement. Building construction and demolition will both <color=#df840e>be halted</color>.
!3bw! Build a Builders' Cabin in <color=#df840e>Services(6)</color>, or click on an existing <color=#df840e> Builders' Cabin </color> to add a Builder.
!3bx! A Citizen is caught the <color=#df840e>plague</color>. This disease is highly infectious, and requires the development of the necessary Tech in order to treat effectively.
!3by! Herbalist Hut, Bathhouse, Hospital, and Pharmacy in the <color=#df840e>Livability</color> technology can effectively treat certain infectious diseases.
!3bz! <color=#df840e> Without enough Tech Points </color>, you cannot develop new Tech. <color=#df840e> Education </color> type buildings can produce Tech EXP.
!3c0! <color=#df840e> Research Institutes </color> can produce a large amount of Tech EXP. Upgrading it to Research Academy, spending Papers and Books, are all good ways to produce Tech Points.
!3c7! Ban citizens from using or eating the item. Item can only be processed.
!3c9! Selection limit has been reached, unable to select!

!3ce! It is said that there was a gurgling sound and even a muffled voice in the well even no one was fetching water from it. Citizens who live near this well are starting to feel scared. Do you go investigate the well?
!3cf! Event - Voices From the Well (click to trigger)
!3ci! Water fetchers were carefully checking the well when a translucent ghost suddenly emerged! The ghost took out come candies, seemingly inviting the citizens to eat some together.

!3cj! The story of the well haunted by a ghost spread, causing water fetchers to be too afraid to work. Some citizens couldn't sleep well, and even children who hears the story refuses to drink water.

!3cl! For several months in a row, when the market vendors are taking stock, they had found that certain small items constantly go missing, and their records just couldn't match up. They finally decided to investigate the entire market, but where should they start their investigation?
!3cp! The enclosed staircase partition was filled with a jumble of miscellaneous items.
!3cr! The hollow plank wall contained a squirrel nest, and a large amount of supplies.
!3ct! The squirrel ran away with a squeak.
!3cu! Looking at the poor little squirrel, the citizens did not take anything, and put the plank wall back.
!3cw! Event - Bee Swarm Crisis (click to trigger)

!3cx! Spring wildflowers are blooming beautifully. Some citizens want to pick some flowers to decorate their homes, but soon discovered that this year's honey hives are extraordinarily numerous. There are so many bee hives in the woods near the settlement. Do you want to clean up these hives?
!3d0! Citizens smoked away the bees with smoke.
!3d1! Because there were so many swarms of bees in the woods, some citizens were stung when they went out.
!3d3! Event - Beautiful View of Old Trees (click to trigger)

!3d4! The old trees in the settlement blooms pink every spring, and the beauty of their falling petals attracts more and more outsiders to come and visit. Several glamorously-dressed tourists are now interested to settle here after seeing the settlement developing so well. Will you welcome them?
!3d7! The tourists felt very sorry and left after buying the flower petal accessory made by the villagers as a souvenir.
!3d9! Event - Waves of Lobsters (click to trigger)

!3da! Seafood these years are more abundant than usual, which seems it's the years when an extraordinary number of lobsters will breed. Do you think we should take this opportunity to fish more? Though overfishing might have an impact on next year's production.
!3dd! Fishermen in Fishing Port harvested a large number of lobsters.
!3de! Next year's output from Fishing Ports is sure to grow by a lot.

!3dh! Can accommodate <color=#df840e>36 people</color>. Must be built near <color=#df840e>Marketplace</color>. Able to store enough supplies and fuel to provide basic living for the residents. <color=#df840e>Senior citizens who are incapable of having children</color> in town will voluntarily move in.
!3dj! Dig them out and transplant them as decorative trees.
!3dm! After a spring rain, the sky cleared and a beautiful rainbow appeared. The temperature has warmed up a lot under the sunshine. Perhaps we can pray that this year will be a warm year.
!3dp! The sunlight coming in from among the leaves seemed warmer.
!3dq! A breeze blew. The spring breeze at this time is still quite chilly.
!3ds! Event - Industry or Agriculture (click to trigger)

!3dt! Many workers have found that they can increase work efficiency and production by increasing power and water consumption at the expense of producing more wastewater containing pollutants. Grant them a permit?
!3dw! Self-purification capacity of water is surpassed as more wastewater has been discharged for the increased production output. This pollution has led to a decline in fishery production.
!3dy! Event - Stolen Salted Fish (click to trigger)

!3dz! Recently the workers at the Curing Workshop noticed that several pieces of meat drying in the sun will go missing every day. They suspected that some naughty kids had taken them, but could never catch the culprit in action. Should we further look into this case?
!3e0! Assign citizens to guard the place.
!3e2! The man on duty waited until midnight, only to find the culprit was a group of kittens!
!3e3! Salted fish kept being stolen, and no one was able to find the culprit.
!3e5! Event - Deep Into the Mine (click to trigger)

!3e6! A miner found some pieces of rare ores at a corner while working in mine. The mine structure there seemed unsafe, but if you dig deeper, you might be able to mine out more of rare ores. Do you want to risk mining these ores?
!3e9! A collapse occurred during mining, killing some miners. Only a small amount of silver ore had been obtained.
!3ea! The miners took the risk and opened up a new mine area. The production of ores will increase a lot in the next few years.
!3ec! Event - The Prom in Great Castle (click to trigger)

!3ed! After the Great Castle was completed, citizens have begin to lead a more comfortable life inside their bigger living space. Everyone started to regularly hold small parties in the castle hall, and someone even proposed to hold a large ball here.
!3eg! The citizens held an extravagant ball at the Great Castle.
!3eh! The citizens were frustrated that the ball was canceled, but soon discovered that by doing so, they were fortunate enough to avoid a widespread epidemic.

!3ek! The heat is unbearable. Some citizens are resting by the riverside as they cool off, but there are also some people propose to go for a swim in the river. The river looks calm, and many citizens are tempted to go for a swim. Do you want to stop them?
!3en! Citizens who gave up swimming continued to cool off under the trees and accidentally picked up wild mushrooms.
!3eo! The river was far more dangerous than it appeared to be, and multiple swimmers drowned.
!3ep! The days are getting hotter, and some citizens suffered heatstroke at work.
!3eq! The citizens were able to cool off the heat in the water, and even caught many lobsters.

!3et! The fog is particularly thick in late autumn, and for several days in a row citizens have collided with their neighbors in the thick early morning fog, and accidentally spilled the goods they were carrying to the ground. Perhaps they should slow down to ensure safety during this time.
!3eu! Tell the citizens to walk carefully.
!3ew! Movement speed was lowered in the fog, but safety was preserved.
!3ex! A citizen sprained his ankle while going out in the fog!

!3f0! The days are freezing, and fuel is running out. If there is no way to heat the houses, people may freeze to death inside. Thus, some citizens have considered bringing out old furniture and burning it to heat their home.
!3f3! Citizens used some of the old furniture as domestic fuel, but they didn't last long.

!3f6! Miners in the settlement feel that the current explosives used for mining are not powerful enough to substantially improve mining efficiency. Thus, they want to develop new explosives, but they couldn't figure out how much saltpeter should be used in the formula.
!3f9! A small explosion occurred during the blending, but fortunately no one was hurt.
!3fa! The explosives worked well, and mining efficiency had improved.
!3fc! Event - A Strange Patient (click to trigger)

!3fd! The hospital admitted a patient who was unable to move his limbs. The patient had been in a coma with a high fever for a week, but did not seem to have a life-threatening condition. Doctors had been studying this case for a long time and were at a loss, having never seen this disease before.
!3fe! Take risks with drugs that may be effective.
!3ff! Use conservative treatment to maintain the patient's stability.
!3fg! The patient soon regained consciousness, but his body mysteriously shrank a lot, and he moved with newfound agility.
!3fh! A few days later, the patient's body mysteriously swelled a lot, but he regained his health, and seemed to be in better health now.

!3fk! In recent days, one particular citizen seems to be sleepwalking. No matter how much others call out to him, there is no response, and he continues on without eating or drinking. People around here are really worried. Force him to wake up?
!3fn! This citizen awoke from his sleep. 'It seems that I have a long dream, where I was alone in a desert and couldn't get out no matter how I tried, and now I feel so hungry and thirsty.'

!3fo! The citizen awoke from his sleep after two days. 'It seems that I have a long dream, where I was alone in a desert and couldn't get out there no matter how I tried. I feel so hungry and thirsty at first, but now I am totally fine, not hungry or thirsty at all.'
!3fq! Event - The Mysterious Merchant (click to trigger)

!3fr! A mysterious merchant, dressed like a foreigner, came to the settlement and hawked his goods to citizens passing by. '200*Croissant only for 1000 silver coins! Get this deal before it's too late!'

!3fu! The merchant sold the food and left, after which people started suffering from bad stomachaches one after another. It turned out that he is a crooked merchant who is selling rotten ingredients at low prices.
!3fw! Event - Beware of Wild Mushrooms (click to trigger)

!3fx! Since autumn began, never-before-seen mushrooms have been found by gatherers to be sprouting in the wild. It does not look like a poisonous species, but whether or not it is edible is anyone's guess. Do you want to try it?
!3g0! The mushrooms were poisonous, and citizens who tried them nearly died.

!3g3! Harvest season is coming. Fruits in the wild ripened, and sturdy weeds by the river can also be collected. Some citizens intend to go out to search for some of these supplies in the wild. Where should they head to?
!3g6! There were many ripe wild fruits in the shrubs and they came back with a good harvest.
!3g7! The weeds along the river were tall and tough, and the citizens cut some and tied them into Scarecrows.

!3ga! A stranger with a large piece of luggage and thin clothing was freezing in the snow, and was hoping to warm up in the town. The citizens helped him into the house to shelter from the wind and snow.
!3gc! Ask him where he came from.
!3gd! He turned out to be a lost merchant, and he presented some goods he was carrying to the citizens to show his appreciation.
!3ge! It turned out that the merchant's ship was shipwrecked upstream. He could only bring a small amount of goods with him, and he gifted a few of the goods to the citizens as a thank-you gift.
!3gg! Event - Whimpers In the Grass (click to trigger)

!3gh! It's winter time, and animals and plants out in the wild are now much more scarce. But some citizens who was out reported that there are some soft whimpering coming from the grass field. Could it be some kind of animal?
!3gk! A litter of kittens are shivering in the grass.
!3gl! Something scurried out and disappeared into the snow.
!3gn! Event - Something took the bait? (click to trigger)

!3go! A seasoned fisherman found something took the bait while fishing, but strangely it was not struggling like a fish. It only appears to be something very heavy that's hooked, and it took some mad effort to drag it up.
!3gr! Event - Beware of Wild Mushrooms (click to trigger)

!3gs! Since Autumn began, never-before-seen mushrooms have been found by gatherers to be sprouting in the wild. It does not look like a poisonous species, but whether or not it is edible is anyone's guess. Do you want to try it?
!3gv! This type of mushroom tastes really bad, but it can still be used as food.
!3gy! A light spark glided through the clear night sky, it’s a shooting star! It is said that if you make a wish to a shooting star, your wish will come true. What do you wish for?
!3h1! The shooting star disappeared into the night sky. Whether or not it will bring good fortune is anyone's guess.
!3h2! The shooting star disappeared into the night sky. Whether or not it will bring good fortune is anyone's guess.

!3h5! Although drinking can improve one's mood, too much drinking just leads to drunkenness. Last night, a citizen drank too much and fell into the river. Fortunately he was not injured, but he woke up, he suddenly found a bag of silver coins scattered around next to him.
!3h6! Pick it up and take away.
!3h8! They investigated along the river, and discovered a bunch of goods floating, some of which had been damaged.
!3h9! Pick up only the ones that can be used.

!3hc! A citizen who kept a cat as a pet were shocked to find a fresh dead mouse at the door when they went out in the morning. The cat was innocently sleeping next to it. It seems to be a gift from the cat, but should it be accepted?
!3he! It's too scary! Throw it away quickly!
!3hf! Although you accept it, perhaps it's better to grill it before eating it.
!3hh! Event - The Mysterious Merchant (click to trigger)
!3hi! A young lumberjack was tending to the trees around the lumberyard as usual, when he found several crooked trees that cannot become proper lumber even with ongoing cares.
!3hm! 'Then how about this?' 150*Fruit Candy, only for 500 silver coins.'
!3ho! Event - A New Recipe (click to trigger)

!3hp! The beverage store only has a small variety of drinks. To develop new products in order to bring in business opportunities, an employee proposes to mix and blend different flavors of drinks to create new trial drinks. What kind of new ingredient should be used?
!3hs! The new recipe was successful, and cocoa with milk became a very popular drink among the citizens.
!3ht! The coffee with fruit was loved by passing merchant caravans, and was bought in large quantities.
!3hv! The fishermen strove hard to salvage the box. Some raw materials have been obtained, but the risk of accidents for fishermen was also increased.
!3hw! The drift box has floated away, and there is no longer any chance to salvage it.
!3hx! After smoothly trading with the traveling merchant, some exquisite food were obtained. The merchant left with great satisfaction.
!3hy! The traveling merchant didn’t manage to sell anything, and left the town brokenhearted.
!3hz! Traces of rare animals from days ago are found near the bear. You can send hunters to catch them, but the chances are slim.
!3i0! Some citizens were sent to capture the bear, and a large amount of animal fat were obtained. However, due to the bear's struggle, some citizens ended up as sacrifices.
!3i1! A significant amount of wood was obtained after this tree was chopped down, but because the ecosystem was also damaged, it has caused the trees in the settlement to grow slower.
!3i2! Since this tree was transplanted to another location, the fertile soil was preserved. Seems like the trees in the settlement are growing more rapidly.
!3i5! Floods will inundate farmland and cause no harvest.
!3i6! The flood broke out, the farmland was submerged, and the crops died.

!3i8! Floods can inundate farmland and cause large-scale crop deaths. Manually harvesting crops in advance before flooding can sometimes recover some of the losses. Reserving enought food for emergencies can avoid famine even without harverst from cropland due to disasters. New Fishing Point will be brought when flood hits.
!3i9! Obtain through trade or Gathering after unlocking skill Herb Knowledge.
!3ib! Remodel a tent with campfire, making the citizens live happily and increase their happiness.
!3id! Keeping a puppy in house can lower citizens' stress, relieving <color=#df840e>5%</color> residents' stress.
!3ig! A gigantic alpaca has run into your city! It seems to be in shock and was running around, injuring several people. How are you going to deal with it?
!3ij! The alpaca fiercely resisted and ran away after injuring several people.
!3ik! The panicked alpaca ran around the city and died after hitting the fence.
!3in! As sowing season is arriving, farmers start to plow the farmland. They get some stone and weed from there. It seems these materials are recyclable, so how are you going to deal with them?

!3is! As temperature rises, the number of mosquitoes also increases which makes citizens often bitten and infected with infectious diseases. They are not fatal, but they surely affect citizens' work efficiency.
!3iv! After citizens cleaned up the town thoroughly, mosquitoes were much less and their health was guaranteed.
!3iy! A bunch of drunkards were lighting the campfire and holding a party near the city. Unexpectedly, they started to argue about which wine was better, and asked others and you to judge.
!3iz! Tequila is a better choice of liquor.
!3j1! Some disapproved of this answer and brought out loads of Whiskey for them to appreciate.
!3j2! Some disapproved of this answer and brought out loads of Medicinal Liquor for others to appreciate.
!3j5! Over two dozen peasants were wandering in your town, looking for a new place to settle in. The soil of their former settlement was poor and yielded few crops.
!3j8! The peasants accepted your invitation and settled in your town with the seeds they used to plant in their ex-settlement.

!3jb! There is smoke rising from the forest, and soon people can confirm that is a fire. Since it is not big yet, should we put out the fire first or cut down surrounding trees to stop fire to spread?
!3je! Citizens successfully put out the fire and picked up a lot of twigs for winter.
!3jf! Citizens successfully stopped the fire from spreading, and also caught some animals trying to escape from the fire.
!3jh! Event - Happy New Year (click to trigger)
!3ji! As the year comes to a close, citizens are checking their inventory, wondering what supplies they should prepare for celebrating the new year.
!3jm! A Hole in the Snow (click to trigger)
!3jn! The ground was covered by a seamless white coating after a heavy snow, but a citizen still found a hole there has been dug up, with dirt and snow scattered around.
!3jq! Citizens dug up a lot of good clay, but found no treasure.
!3jr! A few days later, a huge wild boar appeared nearby, and the citizens worked together to kill the wild boar.
!3jt! Event - A Gift from a Gourmet (click to trigger)
!3ju! A chubby gourmet was passing through town, having a good talk with the citizens who treated him. He wanted to treat them back with his food but he wondered which ingredients do citizens prefer?

!3jz! Hunters always need to go out for hunting, and sometimes they have to go somewhere faraway because they can't find any trace of animals nearby. So a hunter wants to make food that is easy to take with.
!3k1! Suggest him to take some longlasting food.

!3k3! There is a mysterious building outside the town. It does not belong to your town but occupies the land here, and other buildings cannot be built here. Should we demolish the building or wait for it to leave?
!3k6! Just as citizens were about to go up and demolish the building, it flew away, leaving bewildered citizens and a burst of fire behind.
!3k7! It wasn't long before the building disappeared of its own accord, and the only evidence of its existence was a pile of building materials he left behind.

!3k9! An unidentified flying object suddenly showed up in your town, hovering over your place and sending out mysterious waves. It seemed like saying hello to you. Will you respond or pretend not seeing it?
!3kc! They friendly greet you and teach you their planting technology. After they flew away, the yields from farm seems to have a increase!
!3kd! They seem to be mad at you for not getting a response, and they've taken a few of your citizens to do experiments, but they've also left behind a bunch of mysterious items.
!3ki! A giant Christmas tree, which will send gifts to kids <color=#df840e>every 5 years</color>.
!3kj! A lovely snowman built on streets can increase the health of citizens in the area. Can be built on roads.
!3kk! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> trees that can be placed in the town.
!3kn! Decorate houses with Christmas trees to make the house full of festive atmosphere and improve the happiness of citizens.

!3kp! The earthquake caused by the movement of the earth's crust will destroy the houses with low durability. The old houses need to be repaired before the earthquake to avoid being destroyed, and the wild animals on the map will escape, and there will be no wild animals for a period of time. Jade Points and Gold Points will disappear when earthquake hits. Besides, mountains or hills will be spawned in map.
!3kq! The earthquake is coming. Wild animals are killed and low durability buildings are destroyed.
!3ks! An earthquake will kill all wildlife on the map, and low-durability buildings will be destroyed. In addition, Jade Point will also vanish.

!3ku! Animal plague can lead to the gradual death of animals in a Pasture, so spreading animals across multiple Pastures before the plague arrives and culling them as soon as possible after the plague is triggered can prevent greater losses.
!3kv! Animal plague is coming. It will break out in Pasture, causing death of Pasture Animals.
!3kx! Animal plague will gradually spread to and kill animals in the same Pasture.

!3kz! Sandstorm is extremely destructive and will destroy all plants, buildings and citizens as it passes by. However, the scale of sandstorm will reduce after passing trees, so more trees are needed to eliminate a sandstorm.
!3l0! Sandstorm is coming. All buildings and trees in its path will be destroyed. Animals and people will be taken away. Trees can reduce its scale.
!3l2! The sandstorm will destroy all buildings and trees in its path and take away animals and people.

!3l4! An outfit with a Christmas hat made from <color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color> or <color=#df840e>Linen</color> and <color=#df840e>Wool</color> or <color=#df840e>Alpaca Wool</color> in the <color=#df840e>Tailor</color>. It can keep citizens warm. This event item can only be produced during event time.
!3l6! Animal in this structure is suffering from Plague.
!3l7! {0} ({1}) is missing due to sandstorm and there is no tombstone for people to mourn over.
!3l8! {0} ({1}) has been taken away by sandstorm.

!3le! In this ‘Banished’ inspired city-builder, lead a group of survivors in their search for a new home. Manipulate the landscape, manage limited supplies, plant crops, hunt wildlife, gather resources, and develop trade routes to build a bustling and unique town. 'During this Early Access stage, we hope players will become an integral part of the development process, providing feedback and suggestions to grow the feature set and improve the experience. Early Access is expected to last for a minimum of six months and we welcome you all to discuss and communicate here during that time. Our team will be keeping a close eye on the Steam discussions and reviews, listening to each player’s feedback and opinions to improve the gameplay accordingly, while simultaneously optimizing for performance and stability.'
'The Early Access is expected to last at least six months. During this period, we will continue to update the contents of follow-up plan.'
'Our roadmap for the game includes, but is not limited to: Exploration Mode: Updated levels, more historical stories, and new difficulty challenges. Civic Center and Tourism: Develop tourism, boost tourist consumption, and attract new talent to your city. Blueprints: Further blueprints for structures and effects will enrich the gaming experience by providing additional methods of development and routes to success. Player Workshop: MOD editing tools will be available. Multiplayer (Possible): Online mode where multiple players can interact and develop on the same map. Transportation and Logistics (Possible): More complex logistics and transportation lines, allowing you to manage the industrial routes as you choose. Multi-language: English version. '
'Our current build provides all the core features of the game, including: Full experience in random map mode. Functionality and industrial routes for more than 100 constructions. Early warning and response to disasters capability. Trade - focused gameplay. 108 development skills that unlock buildings and abilities. Proficiency mechanics for eight different play - styles. For further information, please refer to the 'About the Game' section below.'
'Thank you for your support, we may adjust the price after the Early Access period.'
'Our developers will keep an eye on Steam’s community and reviews in which we will post future updates and changes. You are invited to discuss and communicate here with us, and we'll be sure to listen to each player’s feedback and comments.' ABOUT THIS GAME Lead your people to their new settlement in this survival city - builder. You will need to provide their shelter, guarantee the food supply, protect against threats of nature, and pay attention to well - being, happiness, education, and employment. Do all of this well, and you might even attract residents from foreign cities! Choose where to build your settlement based on nearby resources, before determining your perfect layout. How will you build your settlement? Carve out the land, join rivers, form lakes and use your tools to shape your settlement exactly how you want it. Build housing, recruit Mayors to determine the morality of your settlement, control crime and ensure your baby - booms don’t negatively impact your resources. Experience all seasons and heed the early warning signs of disasters. Bunker down and protect your citizens from the elements as well as envIronmental disasters, or risk losing all that you’ve built. Offering powerful effects, unique themes and styles, rare blueprints are an opportunity to customize your settlement even further when you’ve mastered the art of trading. Determine which development routes you will choose, with options that range from trading, education, mining, construction, agriculture, processing, logistics, and liveability. Each route unlocks new buildings and abilities to boost development. and there is no set pattern to the route selection, so you can choose freely and play to your staminas. With each map randomly generated, right down to its resources and landmarks, every experience is unique and brings with it its own challenges. Whether exchanging artistic items of high value, unprocessed products or unlocking the mint to create a common currency, trade is key to your populations survival. Experience a unique game mode designed to challenge even the most experienced player. From the bubonic plague in Europe, to the Easter Island disaster, are you able to overcome its challenges?
!3lk! Event - the Arrival of a Sommelier (click to trigger)
!3lm! A self-proclaimed master sommelier came to your town and disbelieved people in the town could produce fine wine. 'You must be talking big. I dare you to show me the wine in your warehouse?'
!3ln! Show the premium wine in warehouse. (Need {0} in stock)
!3lo! 'Didn't expect there are people here who appreciate fine wine!' The sommelier was deeply touched and gifted his whiskey collection to you.
!3lp! Lack of wine in stock, you missed the opportunity to impress the sommelier.
!3lq! Event - The Joining of Scholars (click to trigger)

!3ls! Around twenty or so young scholars passed through the town. 'Based on our measurements of paper use in this town, you have a strong desire to spread knowledge. We would like to join this academic place.'
!3lx! The town's clothing industry is booming, and our officials want to invite famous designers to hold a fashion show here. However, the designers have one requirement:
!3ly! We'd love to hold a fashion show if there are {0} stocked in your town.
!3lz! The designers were impressed by the citizens' exquisite clothing, and so they shared a batch of their well-designed gowns.
!3m2! As time went on, some citizens wanted to emigrate to other cities, and some immigrants wanted to go back to their former homeland. They left the town but may come back to visit in the future!

!3m6! 'We are starving! Could you offer us some food?' There were more than 20 refugees from famine areas trying to get relief here. If we had enough food, maybe we could help them. Otherwise, our citizens may have to compete with refugees for food.

!3mb! Some artisans from other places passed through the town and wanted to engage in collaborative learning with the locals. 'Everything here is so beautifully made! Your craftsmanship is very advanced! Can you show me your tools?'
!3mc! Hone their skills by collaborative learning. (Need: {0} in stock)
!3md! Through collaborative learning, the local artisans acquired more practical tool usage techniques. The output in all kinds of workshops will increase by 20% in the next year.
!3me! Event - Foodie's Adventure Team (click to trigger)
!3mg! A gourmet named Foodie came to the town with his adventure team. You wonder what food in town can appeal to them?
!3mh! Invite them to taste the local cuisine. (require {0} in stock)
!3mi! The local cuisine impressed them, who then shared many recipes with the citizens.
!3na! More people in the caravan lowers the risk of death but will prolong the trade time.
!3nh! Pay {0} coins to buy insurance for the caravan. {1} coins will be compensated if your caravan meet with a mishap.

!3ni! ·Residential place for citizens. ·Occupants can have children. ·Can accomodate up to 64 people. ·Fuels last longer. ·Huge inventory capacity. ·Built within the marketplace range needed. ·Citizen Stress -25% ·Unlock in Factions - Miao - Reputation Lv4.
!3nj! Can plant 2 crops per grid. Unlock in Factions - Miao - Reputation Lv3.
!3nk! Can plant fruit trees at lower spacing. Can be fertilized to reach higher output. Unlock in Factions - Miao - Reputation Lv3.
!3nl! Can plant trees in Forest Farm at lower spacing. Can be fertilized to reach higher output. Unlock in Factions - Miao - Reputation Lv3.
!3nm! Can plant trees here. Workers will cut down the mature ones periodically. Can boost output using fertilizers. Unlock in Factions - Lorenzo - Reputation Lv1.

!3nn! Can raise animals here. Workers will slaughter mature ones periodically. Different animal products according to animal types. Can boost output using fodder. Unlock in Factions - Lorenzo - Reputation Lv3.
!3no! Can produce sea food. No bonus effect from Fishing Point. Built on an area with land and water. Unlock in Factions - Lorenzo - Reputation Lv3.
!3np! Can produce gems. Built on a hillside. Unlimited total output. Unlock in Factions - Rania - Reputation Lv3.
!3nq! Built on water. Higher yield. Can grow special crops. Unlock in Factions - Carlos - Reputation Lv3.
!3nr! Can produce obsidian. Built on a hillside. Unlimited total output. Unlock in Factions - Carlos - Reputation Lv3.
!3ns! Can process bamboo into paper. Unlock in Factions - Miao - Reputation Lv1.
!3nt! Can process Iron ore and Timber into Steel. Citizens who work here are at risk of Tracheitis. Unlock in Factions - Lorenzo - Reputation Lv3.
!3nu! Can process Cotton Cloth and water into dyeing cloth. Unlock in Factions - Rania - Reputation Lv3.
!3nv! Can process dyeing cloth into clothes. Can produce advanced clothes. Unlock in Factions - Rania - Reputation Lv3.

!3nw! A mysterious merchant, dressed like a foreigner, came to the settlement and hawked his goods to the citizens. 'Hear ye, hear ye! 3000 silver coins for 200 special medicine! Buy them or miss them!'
!3nx! Can produce simple food and fancy food. Unlock in Factions - Carlos - Reputation lv3.
!3ny! A primary school that offers basic education Teachers can produce Tech EXP Accommodate 15 students Unlock in when reach Reputation Lv.2 in Miao's faction panel
!3nz! Increase the citizens' happiness within the service scope. Structure with an AoE buff. Unlock in Factions - Miao - Reputation Lv4.
!3o0! Can appoint an administrator here. Can deal with immigrants acceptance. Unlock in Factions - Miao - Reputation Lv5.

!3o1! Can provide medical insurance for citizens. Can treat the citizens for disease. Citizens with medical insurance have higher health. Structure with an AoE buff. Unlock in Factions - Lorenzo - Reputation Lv2.
!3o2! Can deposit money in the bank to earn interest. Unlock in Factions - Lorenzo - Reputation Lv4.

!3o3! - Increase citizens' Happiness within its effective range. - Citizens with high Happiness do not commit crimes. - A building with an AoE buff. - Can predict disaster but the prediction can be wrong. - Unlock in "Factions - Rania - Reputation Lv. 2".
!3o4! Can trade with various factions. Can own more Caravans. Lower by 50% the price volatility caused by trading with factions. Unlock in Factions - Rania - Reputation Lv4.
!3o5! Provides a resting place for the dead so the bereaved families do not lose happiness after a burial. Can bury the dead without limits. Unlock in Factions - Carlos - Reputation Lv4.

!3o6! A advanced school that offers higher education for all citizens The study process will require more paper Output from the Research Institute and Research Academy within the range +300% Unlock when reach Reputation Lv.5 in Factions - Rania
!3o7! · Consume Water to provide town-wide sanitation services for citizens. · Greatly increase the Health of citizens. · The Merchant Ship may carry Blueprints to the Dock.

!3o8! Can accommodate <color=#df840e>8 families, up to 64 people</color> with long residual fuel endurance and allows large stockpiles. Must be built in the range of marketplaces, which will relieve <color=#df840e>25%</color> residents' stress.
!3o9! Can grow crops here, the density of crops grants a <color=#df840e>+50%</color>production bonus.
!3oa! Can plant fruit trees here, and trees can be planted at <color=#df840e>lower spacing</color>. Can be fertilized to reach higher output..
!3ob! Can plant trees here, and trees can be planted at <color=#df840e>lower spacing</color>. Can be fertilized to reach higher output.

!3oc! Can cultivate hardwood trees and produce large amounts of <color=#df840e>Hardwood</color>. Farmers who work here will harvest full-grown trees. Can use fertilizer to <color=#df840e>increase output</color>.
!3od! Same function as <color=#df840e>Eco-Pasture</color>, but <color=#df840e>doubles</color> the max capacity for raising animals.
!3og! Farmers will grow <color=#df840e>Herbs</color> and <color=#df840e>special crops</color> in the field area. Higher output than Nursery.
!3oi! Paper Mill using Tsai's unique paper making technology, which in addition can process bamboo into paper.

!3oj! Can process <color=#df840e>Iron ore</color> and <color=#df840e>Timber</color> into <color=#df840e>Steel</color> through exposure to high temperatures. Citizens who work here are at risk of Tracheitis.
!3ok! Can process <color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color> and <color=#df840e>water</color> into <color=#df840e>dyeing cloth</color>. Dyeing cloth is a kind of luxury textile materials.
!3ol! Can directly process <color=#df840e>linen</color> into <color=#df840e>clothes</color>, also process <color=#df840e>dyeing cloth</color> into <color=#df840e>gown</color>.
!3om! Can process cactus into <color=#df840e>cactus juice</color>, <color=#df840e>cactus cuts</color> or <color=#df840e>fodder</color>.
!3on! Can process raw materials such as <color=#df840e>cocoa </color>, <color=#df840e>corn cuts</color> etc into <color=#df840e>all sorts of cuisines</color>.
!3oo! A <color=#df840e>primary school</color>, which has the same function as the schools. The architecture is in an oriental style.
!3op! Citizens can go to Jingju Threatre to watch Peking opera, which <color=#df840e>increases their happiness</color>.

!3oq! <color=#df840e>Central building</color> of the town where you can accept <color=#df840e>immigrants</color> and recruit a <color=#df840e>administrator</color>. Reputation gained from all factions increased by <color=#df840e>+100%</color>.
!3or! Grants extra <color=#df840e>Health</color> to nearby citizens. Consuming items can get higher Health bonuses.
!3os! Can deposit money in the bank and get it back with interest after a certain period of time. Money deposited in bank <color=#df840e>cannot be used</color>.
!3ot! Mosques provide citizens with spiritual sustenance and grant <color=#df840e>Happiness bonuses</color>. They predict disaster but the prediction can be wrong.
!3ou! Can own more Caravans to trade with various factions. <color=#df840e>Lower the price volatility</color> caused by trading with factions.
!3ov! Citizens can be buried in Chichen Itza after death <color=#df840e>without limits</color>.

!3ow! An <color=#df840e>advanced school</color> where citizens can get Diplomas <color=#df840e>without entering campus</color>. The study process will require more paper. The speed at which Tech Points are generated in the Research Institute and Research Academy within its range increases by <color=#df840e>300%</color>.
!3p3! Can process cactus into fodder. Can process cactus into medicinal powder Can process cactus into cactus cuts. Unlock in Factions - Carlos - Reputation Lv1.
!3pr! Crops planted in <color=#df840e>Forest Farm</color> that yield bamboo, which can be processed into paper or used as building materials.
!3ps! Raw materials produced at <color=#df840e>Forest Farm</color> for <color=#df840e>making papers</color>. Seeds can be obtained through Factions Reputation.
!3pu! Produced from the <color=#df840e>Hardwood Forest Farm</color>. It can be used to make sturdy tools in the Smithy and used in building construction.
!3pv! A tool made from <color=#df840e>Hardwood</color> in the <color=#df840e>Smithy</color>. It's more durable.
!3pw! Tool made from <color=#df840e>hardwood</color>, <color=#df840e>Steel</color> and <color=#df840e>rope</color> in <color=#df840e>Advanced Smithy</color>. More durable.
!3px! Fancy food made from <color=#df840e>soybean</color> in <color=#df840e>Mill</color> or <color=#df840e>Water Mill</color>.
!3py! A seed that grows hardwood. It can be planted at the Hardwood Forest Farm.
!3pz! Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Dates.
!3q0! Fruit harvested from the <color=#df840e>Orchard</color>. Trees cannot produce fruit until they have matured. It's a kind of simple food, edible and can be processed into other kinds of food.
!3q1! Exquisite <color=#df840e>traded goods</color> made from <color=#df840e>Wool</color> in <color=#df840e>Bedding Shop</color>.
!3q2! Cloth made from <color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color> and <color=#df840e>water</color> at the <color=#df840e>Dyeing Mill</color> are valuable textile material.
!3q3! Precious gem produced at <color=#df840e>Gem Mine</color>. valuable traded goods.
!3q5! A clingy puppy raised in <color=#df840e>House</color> can relieve occupants' stress. Obtained through trade only.
!3qm! Bank tellers can guarantee citizens steady investment and profit.
!3qn! A seed that grows hardwood. It can only be planted in the Hardwood Forest Farm.
!3qo! Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Dates.
!3qp! Seeds planted in Field that yield Cactus.
!3qu! Unlock the function of buying insurance for caravans. The town can get compensation if the insured caravan meet with a mishap.
!3qv! Improve the preparation efficiency of traders. Now they can <color=#df840e>carry more items and move faster</color>.
!3qw! Unlock the recipe for making <color=#df840e>basket</color> at the Knitting Workshop.
!3qx! Unlock the recipe for making <color=#df840e>Tofu</color> using soybean at Mill and Water Mill.
!3qy! Lower the price for buying insurance, and increase the insurance payout.
!3qz! Unlock the recipe for making <color=#df840e>hardwood tool</color> at Smithy.
!3r0! Increase the work efficiency of hunters. Now they hunt faster and in shorter periods to get resources sooner.
!3r1! Unlock the recipe for making <color=#df840e>luxury furniture</color> at the Luxury Furniture Factory.
!3r2! Citizens are now physically better able to withstand the cold. Maximum warmth increases by 100%.
!3r3! Your honest trade with Factions makes you more famous. Reputation gained from trading with various Factions increases by <color=#df840e>25%</color>.
!3r4! Unlock the recipe for making <color=#df840e>sugar</color> using dates in Sugar Workshop.
!3r5! Unlock the recipe for making Anisette at the Winery.
!3r6! Unlock the recipe for making <color=#df840e>persian tapestry</color> at the Bedding Shop.
!3r7! Unlock the recipe for making <color=#df840e>exquisite sword</color> at the Advanced Smithy.
!3r8! When trading with all Factions, price of all trade goods increase by 25%.
!3r9! Remodel the caravan to <color=#df840e>increase its max carrying weight</color>.
!3ra! Unlock the recipe for making <color=#df840e>rough clothes</color> using agave at Tailor.
!3rb! Unlock the recipe for generating <color=#df840e>Tech EXP</color> using rope at Research Institute.
!3rc! While trading with Carlos, the price of seeds decreases largely.
!3rd! Increase the output of silver and products from Gold Miner Cabin by 100%.
!3re! Remodel the caravan to increase its speed thus <color=#df840e>shorten the round-trip time</color>.
!3rf! When the total weight of goods sold in the caravan is less than 80%, the round-trip time is reduced by 15%.
!3rg! Unlock the remodel function for caravans. Max number of caravans <color=#df840e>increases by 1</color>.
!3rh! Increase the max caravans number in all the Trading Post and Water Trading Post.
!3sq! Simple food produced by <color=#df840e>using fishing net</color> at <color=#df840e>Small Fishing Port</color>. Edible.
!3to! Time deposit will be withdrawn automatically at maturity with interest. In case of withdrawal before maturity, interest will be calculated at the lowest rate.
!3ty! The bank collapsed because of the crisis and all the money was lost.
!3u2! Time deposit was withdrawn, please check the profit.
!3ub! A paper note found from lanterns. Riddles and wishes are written on it. This event item can only be obtained during event time.

!3uc! With money inside as an amulet. In Eastern cultures, giving this money to children protects them from evil and danger throughout the year. This event item increases citizens' inventory and can only be produced during event time.

!3ud! Food made from <color=#df840e>Rice</color> at the <color=#df840e>Mill</color>, which is called 'Nian Gao' in Chinese, meaning life would be better over the next year. Event item, only can be made during the event period.

!3ue! Food made from <color=#df840e>Flour</color> and <color=#df840e>Meat Chop</color> at the <color=#df840e>Gourmet Shop</color>, which can bring good luck over the next year. Event item, only can be made during the event period.

!3uf! Food made from <color=#df840e>Rice</color> and <color=#df840e>Sugar</color> at the <color=#df840e>Mill</color>, which is called 'Tang Yuan' in Chinese, conveying a wish of family reunion and happiness. Event item, only can be made during the event period.

!3ug! A wine made from <color=#df840e>Herbs</color> and <color=#df840e>Water</color> at the <color=#df840e>Winery</color>. It improves citizens' <color=#df840e>Health</color> and helps them <color=#df840e>be immune to the plague</color> for a certain period. This event item can only be produced during event time.

!3uh! Low-power explosives made from <color=#df840e>coal</color> and <color=#df840e>paper</color> at the <color=#df840e>Fuel Factory</color>, which will make a loud noise when lit. What a blast! Event item, only can be made during the event period.
!3uj! <color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town. <color=#df840e>Provides lighting</color>.
!3ul! Can build more than one. Citizens will set off all the fireworks when lighting one of them. It takes three months to prepare new fireworks.
!3up! Plaza guarded by five Rui Beast statues, symbolizing peace and happiness. Can set off the firecrackers every 5 years to celebrate the festival.
!3uu! The New Year arrived and citizens were going to paste up the Chinese character "Fu" on the door to show their wishes in next year. How are they supposed to paste it up?

!3ux! An old man came out to stop the citizens from pasting the character 'Fu'. 'Oh this young man, the Chinese character 'Fu' should be pasted upside down, which means happiness is flowing down into you thus we could have good fortune in the New Year!'
!3uy! Citizens put up the Chinese character 'Fu' and prepared a lot of food to celebrate the Lunar New Year.
!3uz! The character 'Fu' is pasted upside down, that is, 'happiness is flowing down into you' in the New Year!
!3v1! A fierce man-eating monster 'Nian' came to the town. It was told that this monster will slaughter people and livestock, so how are you going to deal with it?
!3v4! The hungry monster ate a lot of food and killed some villagers before leaving.
!3v5! The explosion of firecrackers and the red paper seemed to startle the monster. It quickly ran away.
!3v7! Citizens were attracted by the beautiful lanterns on the river and found paper notes with riddles and New Year wishes hanging from them.
!3v8! Try to solve the lantern riddles.
!3v9! Collect the paper notes with riddles.
!3va! Some citizens managed to guess the lantern riddles and won a reward!
!3vc! The emissary from the East sent a New Year's gift!
!3ve! Wow! It's a red packet for Lunar New Year.
!3vg! Extend the building, making the max number of caravan <color=#df840e>+1</color>.
!3vt! Introducing exquisite oriental cooking technique, the dishes are getting more tasty, which can reduce the citizens' stress by <color=#df840e>5%</color>.
!3w0! Safeguard the shipping on the sea, reduce the probability of distress of the caravans at the Water Trading Post.

!3yq! Strong winds and heavy rains from the ocean this year was far beyond normal levels, and sudden floods displaced my people. Now the disaster is over, but we are in need of wood to rebuild our homes.

!3yr! Agriculture is our top priority, but this year the locust plague happened. The locusts that spread all over the ground are eating the farmers' crops! In order that our people may not suffer from famine... We need help.

!3ys! After years of disaster, we finally started to make our city booming! Now our people are working hard for a better life. However, there is a slight shortage of building materials for our rapidly growing cities. Could you support me with some building materials?

!3yt! The magnificent and lofty city buildings are the symbol of our strength! It's time to think about something stronger and more beautiful including our town hall. We have heard that the building materials from your place are of good quality, so we want to purchase a large quantity, could you give us a discount?

!3yu! Some collectors here are so fond of exotic products that they are willing to exchange large amounts of valuable goods for those special items. I wonder if you have them in stock? I can introduce you those who want to buy them.

!3yv! Members of the caravan told of their wonderful experience: 'In the small towns near the water, we saw a great number of Silkworm Sheds and Textile Mills, where the finest silk anywhere could be produced. We consulted on weaving skills and were given a gift of silk.'

!3yw! Members of the caravan told of their wonderful experience: 'Our captain has learned the language of the other country, and this time he bargained very smoothly in selling items, which allowed us to get a lot of extra income.'

!3yx! Members of the caravan told of their wonderful experience: 'We caught up with all the meetings of foreign merchants, where a lot of them saw our products for the first time. Without question, they loved it, and the word of our town had spread. It's gonna be so much easier to set up a stall.'
!3yy! Distinguished guest! Seeing how well your town is doing, I'd like to introduce you to our fancy casino. Maybe you'll get to know more people with your swagger.

!3yz! It's always freezing cold in the area on north of the sea, but this winter has been even more challenging than usual. To add insult to injury, we have a problem with our fuel supply, and now we are in need of more fuel for living...

!3z0! The plague has just stopped and we have lots of fields and farms but not enough labor, so there will be famine again this year...Would anyone like to live here?I'll make sure you're treated right.

!3z1! The permission for immigration came just in time. We had some people who wanted to move here because of the plague there. And I heard you guys have great medical care. Would you please help these poor people?

!3z2! Have you ever thought why our Beef exports are expensive? That's because our cattle are well kept. There are dedicated entertainment area in our cowsheds, and we would hold an afternoon tea party once a week for them! We could have a talk if you want to learn from us.

!3z3! Bandaged members of the caravan told of their wonderful experience: 'On the way we met a fighting among local factions, and several men were injured and part of the cargo was lost. Fortunately, we were not the only ones who lost money. There was a shortage of all kinds of goods in the market, and the goods remained were sold at higher prices.'

!3z4! Members of the caravan told of their wonderful experience: 'We happened to run into someone who had overproduction in their ranch this year, and a lot of ranch products were on sale, so we brought some back.'

!3z5! Members of the caravan told of their wonderful experience: 'Local fishermen invited us to go sailing and experience the life at sea. To be honest, we puked all the way through. However, there still was a small gain.'

!3z6! I'm Carlos. We live in a place where the soil is so poor that we can't support too many people. Even the souls that God can take in are limited. Can you take in these old people who have nowhere to go?

!3z7! What? Haven't you heard of our Almighty God? Let me tell you a good story about them... Hey, why didn't you listen? Our sacrificial festival is coming again. Our god not only likes human sacrifice, but also exquisite pottery, but good pottery is not so easy to make...

!3z8! Guess what, when I woke up this morning, there was another group of old men and women outside my house. They were kicked out by their kids! Still weeping there! And told me they haven't eaten yet! How can I feed so many people? By the way, has your Senior Housing been built yet? Can I sign up for them?

!3z9! I saw that many rich people in other countries are carrying the handbags made by you, how fashionable! Could you give me some to let the young people in our small town also wear some fashionable trinkets? !

!3za! We were getting more and more people here, and there was not enough food to eat. My friend, I heard there are many places in your town willing to take young people, and, of course, many of our young people want to move out. I promise, they are the best workforce!

!3zb! Members of the caravan told of their wonderful experience: 'This business trip was really thrilling, we lost our way in the tropical rainforest and were almost eaten by crocodiles. There were snakes everywhere, and big bugs. Luckily, we met some locals and they gave us plenty of food to eat.'

!3zc! The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'The locals really like offering sacrifices! And during the sacrifice, we outsiders are not allowed to enter the village, and business will be delayed. At this moment, there was a sacrificial event. We had nothing to do outside the village and collected a lot of agave from the wild. '

!3zd! The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'The locals, already familiar with our caravan, were finally willing to let us participate in the festival and were blessed. Not kidding, their gods are really efficacious, and we all felt much luckier during the journey, and all the problems were saved. '

!3ze! Hi. I am Rania. Nice to see your caravan here. Our country's biggest problem has always been water scarcity. Can you provide us with water? Anyone in our land who can receive help from you would know and thank you.

!3zf! Our people love to make clothing. But recently our cotton farm has been devastated by natural disasters and my favorite scarves are now less and less on the market. Can you bring some cotton here?

!3zg! Our people love to make clothing. But recently our linen field has been devastated by natural disasters and my favorite scarves are now less and less on the market. Can you bring some linen here?

!3zh! Hi, how are you doing? I'm visiting because we need some groceries and wonder if you can do me a favor. Next time if you happen to run out of salt for cooking at home, come ask me for some. We are the neighbors who would help each other.

!3zi! Why haven't the goods been delivered after waiting for several days? It seems that something was wrong with our caravan on the road. But we're really in dire need of some Leather Shoes. The feet of the workers who work in the fields are worn out. My heart aches for them.

!3zj! If you've seen our premium custom gowns, you know we're the industry leader. To thank you for your help in the past, I'd like to sell you some of the custom gowns at a discount. Please note that our luxury items don't usually drop in price.

!3zk! The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'We brought back many local specialties, be it food or drinks. And the wine there was really good! We were high as f*** after drinking it! '

!3zl! The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'We've been to the metropolis this time. There were goods from all over the world. We brought back some specialties from other places this time. '

!3zm! The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'Traveling in the desert is unforgettable. I always imagined that monsters would crawl out of the sand and guard the underground treasures. But guess what, we actually found the source of a rare ore on the way! '
!3zn! I heard that your town has trade relations with Miao's. We are in urgent need of a batch of bamboo and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
!3zo! I heard that your town has trade relations with Lorenzo's. We are in urgent need of a batch of hardwood and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
!3zp! I heard that your town has trade relations with Carlos'. We are in urgent need of a batch of dates and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
!3zq! I heard that your town has trade relations with Rania's. We are in urgent need of a batch of cactus and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
!3zr! I heard that your town has trade relations with Miao's. We are in urgent need of a batch of bamboo baskets and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
!3zs! I heard that your town has trade relations with Lorenzo's. We are in urgent need of a batch of hardwood tools and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
!3zt! I heard that your town has trade relations with Carlos'. We are in urgent need of a batch of dyeing cloth and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
!3zu! I heard that your town has trade relations with Rania's. We are in urgent need of a batch of obsidian tools and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
!3zv! I heard that your town has trade relations with Miao's. We are in urgent need of lots of tofu. You got them in stock? I promise you would satisfy with the price we offer.
!3zw! I heard that your town has trade relations with Lorenzo's. We are in urgent need of lots of oysters. You got them in stock? I promise you would satisfy with the price we offer.
!3zx! I heard that your town has trade relations with Carlos's. We are in urgent need of lots of exquisite swords. You got them in stock? I promise you would satisfy with the price we offer.
!3zy! I heard that your town has trade relations with Rania's. We are in urgent need of lots of tacos. You got them in stock? I promise you would satisfy with the price we offer.

!3zz! The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'When we were looking for a buyer for the goods, a seemingly enthusiastic businessman came and introduced the local customs and culture, but the price he offered was outrageously low. Fortunately, he did not know our goods well, so we vaunt and hype our goods and ripped him off. '

!400! The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'We heard a cry for help when walking on the steep mountain road. After searches, we found it was a local with injured legs. So we took him home, where we were warmly entertained, and before leaving he gave him some silver coins as a thank you. '

!401! The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'We found a lot of abandoned materials in the wilderness, and some of the building materials were still available, so we brought them back. '

!402! A man in ragged clothes came to the town. The villagers stepped forward to ask and found that he was actually a member of the caravan in distress. After many twists and turns in other places, he finally returned here.

!403! A well-dressed old man came to the town, claiming that he had been a citizen here many years ago, but was shipwrecked while following a caravan out to trade, and in order to make a living in the field with the remaining supplies in his hands to start a business, and is now quite wealthy. Now he wants to return to the place where he used to live, but no one knows him anymore, to take him in?
!404! Oops, is there a caravan in distress? It's a shame, but just buy our insurance and you'll be able to recover some of your losses in the event of a distress!
!405! Thank you for your trust, I will give small gifts to excellent partners.
!406! It will be too late regretting the loss until you meet with a mishap!
!407! I see that our insurance has saved you a major loss! See? I did not lie to you. We welcome you to continue buying! I will also give more gifts to senior customers.
!408! I heard that {name of disaster} attacked this town, we have food and water here, please accept these supplies. I hope it can help you.
!409! A lot of animals got sick and died? These animal husbandry products are given to you. In the future, you should pay more attention to the management of pastures!
!40a! Our God can feel the earth shaking in the distance. Accept these materials to overcome the natural disaster!
!40b! Were any homes damaged in the disaster? I wonder if these building materials can help you rebuild them.
!40c! Thanks for your support, our refugees were resettled in time. We will remember your assistance at such a critical time.
!40d! Now we can get through this winter. Thank you!
!40e! This is great! Soon people will be able to move from the shack into the house!
!40f! With such high-quality building materials, even our workers couldn't help asking about the origin.
!40g! Can't win? Take it easy! What about one more round to make it even?
!40h! This really saved me! Or else everyone here would move out because of no heating!
!40i! Take this opportunity to experience a different life!' The young people left with a dream.
!40j! Sure enough, some immigrants contracted the plague. Plague is highly contagious and has a high fatality rate. Please handle with caution.
!40k! Carlos was deeply grateful, and soon a group of thirsty and hungry old men came to town. 'We felt hopeless at one point. Thank you for hosting us. You are really a nice person. '
!40l! Fabulous! Our God is satisfied. I will say a few good words for you in the presence of God.
!40m! Thank you! Although we are old, we can still do something. Hope to spend the rest of my life here.'
!40n! A fashion craze was sweeping over our town. Whether it was a college student, a farmer, or a small factory worker, everyone wanted a small leather bag.
!40o! We no longer have to live in a shabby room with several people, and now we can have a better job and life here with more abundant materials.
!40p! The water was enough to ease our endless anxiety for a while. Thank you so much.
!40q! With these materials, our people in garment-making industry can start working again. Nobody likes the feeling of being unemployed. Not to mention, what a wonderful job that is!
!40r! It's great to have friends like you! Now I'm going to be tinkering with the house with these materials.
!40s! Thank you. Our workers will remember you being good to them!
!40t! Being able to purchase our high-end luxury brand at such a low price is something that nearly no fashionista dares to imagine!
!40u! It's really pleasant working with you.
!40v! Thank you so much, my customers will appreciate the supplies.
!40w! You are my best trading partner to be able to provide such rare materials in time!
!40x! That's a shame. Reckon I'll have to look elsewhere for this shipment.
!40y! Are you also reluctant to sell? Where can I find such rare goods? What a headache.

!41x! Raw Food made from <color=#df840e>Cactus</color> at the <color=#df840e>Cactus Workshop</color>.
!41y! Roads constructed with <color=#df840e>obsidian</color>. Greatly increases the speed that citizens walk by <color=#df840e>125%</color>.
!41z! Processed from <color=#df840e>Obsidian</color> and <color=#df840e>Timber</color> at the <color=#df840e>Smithy</color>. More durability.

!421! Simple food that made from <color=#df840e>Corn</color> in <color=#df840e>Outdoor Kitchen</color>. Have better fillingness.

!422! Fancy food that made from <color=#df840e>Corn</color> and <color=#df840e>Sugar</color> in <color=#df840e>Outdoor Kitchen</color>. Have better fillingness. Can help <color=#df840e>release citizens' stress</color>.

!427! Your caravan met with a mishap en route. People were dead and goods were lost. You suffered great losses without buying insurance.
!429! Remodel the structure with building kit to strengthen its stability to withstand wind and rain, thus it will not be damaged or destroyed.

!42b! Beverages that made from <color=#df840e>dates</color> and <color=#df840e>water</color> in the <color=#df840e>Winery</color>. They can <color=#df840e>relieve stress</color> and increase the <color=#df840e>Health</color> for citizens.
!42f! Can <color=#df840e>trade</color> with various Factions through the trading structures.
!42g! Select the <color=#df840e>Small Trading Post</color> in <color=#df840e>Storage</color> toolbar and build it on map.
!42h! You can check your <color=#df840e>Reputation</color> to various Factions after owning the building. And you can increase your reputation through <color=#df840e>Trade</color>.

!42k! You can form a caravan after selecting a trading Faction and items if you have enough laborers.
!42l! The Market Prices would fluctuate when trading with other Factions. And prices vary from one Faction to another.
!42m! You can open the Market Prices menu by pressing the hotkey (<color=#df840e>V</color>) or clicking on the <color=#df840e>Trading Post</color> to have a look at the prices at different Factions.
!42o! Unlock Bamboo Seeds that can be planted in <color=#df840e>Forest Farm</color>. Bamboo can be processed into paper or used as building materials.
!42q! Unlock the Hardwood Seeds which can be planted in the <color=#df840e>Hardwood Forest Farm</color>. Hardwood can be used to make tools and used in building construction.
!42s! Unlock Date Seeds that can be planted in <color=#df840e>Orchard</color>. Dates are edible or can be processed into sugar.
!42t! Seeds planted in <color=#df840e>Forest Farm</color> that grow into Bamboo.
!42u! Unlock Cactus Seeds that can be planted in <color=#df840e>Field</color>. Cactus can be processed into edible Cactus Cuts or medical Cactus Juice.

Building a dock allows you to trade with merchant ships from the Chamber. Merchant ships may sell blueprints of special structures, such as those from Antonio's, and other hidden structures.

!5ak! Event - Children's Day Gifts (click to trigger)
!5al! Children's Day arrives, and the residents is sending some gifts to the children. Some children receive delicious candy, some children get and wear beautiful new clothes.
!5an! Event - Candy for Children's Day (click to trigger)
!5ao! Children's Day arrives. Should we send some candy to the children in town?
!5ar! Everyone felt very happy to see the children who were happy with the candy.
!5as! Children were having fun on the street without candy. And the street was full of happy laughter.
!5av! Must be built on a hillside.
!5aw! Must be built on the water.
!5ax! Must be built by the water.
!5ay! Gold Point: can obtain extra Gold Sand output from quarry and open mine structures.
!5az! Jade Point: can obtain extra jade output from mine and mountain quarry structures.
!5b0! Events unable to handle for a long time will be closed. Can reopen them in event logs at the bottom left corner.
!5b3! A group of wild geese made their homes by the field, not only pecking at the seedlings in the field, but also attacking passersby in groups from time to time.
!5b6! After some struggle, the farmers eliminated this group of geese that harmed the farmland and the citizens.
!5b7! After some struggle, the farmers drove the geese into the enclosure, and after a few feedings, they finally managed to tame the geese.
!5b9! Event - Fisherman Selling Oysters (click to trigger)
!5ba! A tattered fisherman carried a large bag of oysters to town, wanting to sell them. 'Fresh and tasty! My oysters were all freshly caught today! '
!5bd! The fisherman thought about it and decided to sell them cheap. 'Well, since them won't sell well tomorrow. '
!5bg! Event - Refugees in Need (click to trigger)

!5bh! A group of people came to town with large and small packages. A tornado hit their original settlement and completely destroyed their shelters. Fortunately, all of them had survived through the disaster and took the remained food to look around for a new place to live for the winter.
!5bk! The refugees were very grateful to the town for their accommodation so they distributed the food they brought to everyone.
!5bm! Event - Kids in Winter (click to trigger)
!5bn! Winter is here and the kids want to go outside to play in the snow, but it's very cold outside, should they be allowed to play outside?
!5bq! With the cold wind blowing outside, the children listened to stories in the warm house and tried to make some cakes that were not pretty but tasted good!
!5br! Although the temperature was low, the children playing in the snow were still full of energy, and rare seeds were found in the snow.
!5bt! Event - Merchant from the North (click to trigger)

!5bu! A caravan from the north passed by, and their drinks were running out. They wanted to exchange their goods for some spirits. "Our hardwood tools are strong and durable, and you won't lose out in exchange for the same amount of spirits."
!5bx! A Small Merchant Ship in Port
!5by! Event - A Small Merchant Ship in Port (click to trigger)

!5bz! An uncommon small merchant ship docked quietly at the dock at night, and a sneaky merchant got off the ship. "Our chamber of commerce does not allow private adjustment of prices, but I have too many leather shoes in the backlog. I hope to sell them cheaply to you, please don't disclose it to others!"
!5c3! Event - An Elder Selling Glass Bottles (click to trigger)

!5c4! An old man came to town with a bag of old glass bottles. "Although my glass bottles are all old, I have cleaned every one of them, and the price is cheaper than those new bottles. Just buy some!"
!5c6! Ask him if he buys glass bottles
!5c7! I can only buy old glass bottles at a low price, and the price can’t be higher, 1 silver coin per glass bottle. '

!5cc! The tailors in the town sorted out the leftover scraps and some old clothes that could no longer be worn in the store. Although they could not be made into decent clothes, tailors could still reuse these materials to make simple clothes or backpacks that can be put into use.

!5ch! Doctors have recently treated many patients with wind-heat and colds. Seeing that people are vulnerable to wind-cold in autumn and winter, he suggested to prepare some medicines or clothing for cold weather.

!5ci! A material produced from the <color=#df840e>Obsidian Mine</color>. Can be processed into Obsidian Tools or for road pavement. Houses with <color=#df840e>Shockproof Obsidian Floors</color> can withstand earthquakes at levels I - IV.
!5cj! Prepare some clothing for cold weather.
!5cl! Event - Citizens of Relocation (click to trigger)

!5cm! The citizens who moved into the garden villa were very satisfied with the spacious and comfortable new house, and together they made delicious food and invited their neighbors and friends to celebrate.
!5co! Event - Merchants from the Desert (click to trigger)
!5cp! Merchants in exotic clothing passed through the town, interested in local winemaking skills.
!5cq! Exchange your local premium wine for their goods . (need: {0})
!5cr! Ask him about new ways to make wine
!5cs! The merchants were amazed at the quality of the wine and took out expensive specialties to trade.
!5ct! The merchants distributed his specialty wine to everyone. This wine brewed from their specialty plants had a unique flavor and attracted many citizens.
!5cv! Event - New Discovery of Researchers (click to trigger)

!5cw! Researchers in the town found that a bug brought by immigrants mainly fed on weedsin the fields, which can increase the yield of crops. They wanted to make use of this bug to boost the field yield, but they knew little about this species.
!5cx! Provide them experimental sites for research.
!5cy! Introduce more books to help with research

!5d1! Press <color=#df840e>R</color> to rotate the structure while choosing the building location. The yellow arrow on the ground marks the entrance and exit direction of the structure. Citizens' efficiency will increase if they are built facing the road.
!5d3! Some building styles can be changed. Press <color=#df840e>F</color> to change their styles while choosing a constructure location.
!5d5! Press <color=#df840e>P</color> after selecting a building can quickly enable or disable it. Once you enable the building, workers will be automatically arranged if there are enough laborers.
!5d7! Press <color=#df840e>G</color> to toggle on/off the map grids.
!5d9! Press <color=#df840e>Tab</color> to switch to a different building toolbar and then you can select decorative buildings.
!5db! Press <color=#df840e>F5</color> to quick save your game. Press <color=#df840e>F6</color> to open Load menu.
!5dd! Press <color=#df840e>H</color> to hide all trees on current map. A second press can unhide them.
!5df! Holding <color=#df840e>Left Shift</color> and <color=#df840e>Left Click</color> the building can quickly build another same one. Invalid to those that can only be built once.
!5dh! Press <color=#df840e>Y</color> to move back to default perspective.
!5dj! Press <color=#df840e>B</color> to move the camera to Town Hall or Great Temple. If the above mentioned buildings are not built, camera will be moved to starting spot.
!5dl! Press the <color=#df840e>+</color> or <color=#df840e>-</color> in Numeric Keypad when a building is under selection can quickly increase or decrease the workers.
